Ratings.comment: Worst TA ever had, find someone else in SchedulePlanner

I took her at CSCC, not OSU, but I can't find her for CSCC.

I wanted to be charitable to her because I did like her, but she sent a dispute over me having a meltdown after intentionally antagonizing me (I'm autistic, FYI) and now I can't start my classes on time. She had ample time to tell me this but she didn't. She wasn't even mad at me. Insane.
Actually the worst TA I've ever had in my life

The other ratings here are not dramatic or exaggerated whatsoever. She is very condescending and rude towards her students to the point that it is cruel. The lecture portion of this class is incredible but the recitation… specifically HER recitation sections… worst experience I've ever had. She is the SOLE reason I do not have an A in this class.
She was the harshest grader the first half of semester. Once Donald Trump was elected she became much more enjoyable. It seems there is a positive correlation between his election and her happiness.

Avoid any class with this teacher, the work that she makes you do in recitation is tougher than the course itself. It's tougher than an ochem lab. Any example that you will try to use she turns down immediately.
She is the only thing wrong with this integrated biology class. Grades harder than anyone I ever met.

I haven't met a single person who had anything good to say about this TA. I hope she sees all these bad reviews and decides to change herself, because never in my life have I had a "teacher" (I put teacher in quotes bc she doesn't teach) this bad. I genuinely think she's heartless the way she's tanking everyone's grades...

She is exactly who Steve Chordas talked down upon. He said he hated how scientists are so brutal when peer reviewing articles and she grades every assignment like you are submitting a paper to the world. Girl we are not scientists nor are we actually that interested in what you have to say because this is just a biology class we are forced to take.

I would rather take 10 Baldwin classes than have this TA. She takes points off just so you do not get a 100, and her comments are harsh. "Go to the writing center" even when your writing is eloquent. I got over a 100 on the exam and yet the rec weighs my grade down so much.
She grades extremely hard.

Takes points off like her life depends on it. No matter how much effort you put into something, it won't be enough for her standards, which I'm pretty sure she makes up as she grades. I've lost all hope in this class and it is 100% because of her.

Easily the worst TA I have ever had. It does not matter how hard you work on your projects and papers, you're getting a B at the absolute best. You can follow the rubric to a T and she will find ways to take points off for the most random thing. It does not matter how many times you ask for help, you will lose points, always.

Do not take this professor ever. The worst recitation instructor I've ever had. I can't believe how awful she is at grading. She will just take points off for fun. Doesn't care about how much effort and time you put into assignments. No constructive feedback. She just wants you to fail. I'm not sure how she still has this job.

This has got to be the worst TA I've ever had. I wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt for a long time, assuming that the profs want the recitation to be hard but this girl is just actually insane. she wants you to fail, and she would give you a zero if she could.

Sarah Rose is the worst TA I've had in my life. She's extremely nit-picky and makes up nonsense reasons to take points away on assignments. Sometimes it seems like she takes away points just because she can. Nothing is ever good enough for her and she turns a very easy class into an impossible one. Avoid at all costs.

She grades harder than any other professor/TA I have ever met. Even Dr. Chordas was trying to get her out of this position because of how many complaints he's been getting about her. Some of these ratings about her are extremely mean, but couldn't be more true. Don't take her. Just don't.

doesn't help or care no matter the situation. It might be a power trip or something, but I've never seen a worse grader in my life. She'll take off points if you breathe too hard lol. I hope she reads this and considers a different career so she doesn't make any more people suicidal.

You have to give her credit. You have to be pretty creative to come up with the things she takes off points for. Some of the stuff is just unheard of. She also has some thick skin too to be able to deny helping people constantly. Even the professors don't know what to do with her with the amount of complaints they have been getting about her.

If I could go back in time and change one thing in my life, it would be picking a different major than bio so that I wouldn't risk having to be in the same recitation section as her. The lecture was great by the way. But I seriously do not know how she is leading a recitation and whoever qualified her to do so needs to be investigated IMMEDIATELY.

Is all over the place all he cares about is getting out of class quickly. He'll just throw information at you without you knowing what any of it means, spends more time asking if we're looking forward to the exam then actually teaching. He does however hold review sessions that have been kinda helpful.
just no, very tough grader and makes mean comments to those who get a question wrong
He was a tough grader but his critiques made it easy to learn from mistakes. You knew exactly what was wrong and why. When asked questions, his answers were clear and helpful.
Fun person, but VERY VERY strict in grading. He reads every sentence you write and finds every point you miss. Then, you lose points here and there.

alright dr lenny has gotten some bad reviews but he is really not THAT bad. the recitation is annoying and he isnt very helpful for the lab portion but he literally tells you the answers for the lab reports and tells you what will be on the lab quizzes. he is just a little awkward but hes actually so nice. love this guy!

Recitation is a long game with convoluted question delivery. We get no review or deeper explanation out of the content, simply play the game for an hour then do lab. Procedural demonstration and explanation is minimal at best, many technique issues prolonged labs. He also demeans incorrect answers as a joke, discouraging figure engagement.

I had a terrible time in this class. Avoid this TA if possible. I asked him about my extended response answers on an exam and he read them in front of my group and proceeded to tell my why I was wrong and make fun of me. He also continued to make jokes about my responses in future labs. Also if you think it will be a quick lab you're wrong.

He's a horrible TA, genuinely take it with anybody else. He grades a lot harsher than all the other TAs and laughs when you get a question wrong in lab. Lab quizzes are also borderline impossible. He also has a game during recitation that you genuinely get nothing out of, it's boring and takes up tons of lab time. Never take him frl

He was so unhelpful, and often left us more confused. He would not answer any of our questions, even when our group clearly stated we were having struggles. Furthermore, he was particularly distasteful towards me, and would often ignore me when I tried to participate. This truly affected my overall ability to learn and my learning environment.

If you expect to be able to not put in any effort, he will not be fun. He can be a bit tough grading and his labs are long but he teaches you the material well. He is accessible outside of class, approachable, and genuinely cares that you understand the material. His online review sessions were really helpful and so I recommend going to those!

I think he is a nice guy, but lab with him was so stressful. I couldn't understand his directions; his questions were confusing, and asking him for help honestly made me more confused. He is the head TA so he grades lab reports super harshly.

Don't take bio lab with this instructor. He's such a hard grader and makes lab quizzes impossible. He's really not mentally there and has no idea how to teach individuals. If you are confused or need help, he just won't.
Very rude and a harsh grader. He really enjoyed seeing students confused and did nothing to help. He is intelligent but a horrible teacher.

He is just not mentally here - he makes objectively easy directions impossible to complete and I have never left a lab with a better understanding, only frustrated and confused. I truly do not understand how he was approved - he is not a good TA save urself the frustration.

Dr. Lenny has very high expectations of his students and expects them to know far beyond the introductory biology course. He tries to explain things as if he is talking to a professional and leaves students much more confused afterwards. Recitation is useless. His lab quizzes are very difficult and the labs almost always go past the end time.
Dr. Lenny is a great TA! To exceed in his class, participation is key! He is a very experienced and knowledgeable TA who has a lot to offer for pre-med students. He helped me get into a research lab!
Super tough grader, expects you to know what he wants even when the question is vague. Not good at answering questions about
Doesnt try to help and laughs at your confusion.

Dr. linan is a very tough grader. He will take off points and the labs are long. Given that its online, he is not very understanding. Prepare for working very hard just to get points taken off over a small mistake.
He is so confusing and his rubric for grading is very specific. Online learning with this professor was so difficult. He does not set his students up for success.

Bad professor. The first exam average was a low D for my class. She has practice exams, but even after that bad exam, she won't give us those practice exams because "we aren't studying hard enough." However, the book and study material she gave us were nowhere near the difficulty of the exam, and we don't know what to study.

Overall, she is a good lecturer, but she is very inconsiderate of her students schedules. She will not allow you to receive extra time on her assignments, if they are due on the date of your exam. Even if asked for an extension at 11:59, she will decline your offer and you will still have to submit your assignment at the start of your Biology Lab.

worst professor I have had in my three years. lectures BARELY relate to the exams. exams themselves were AWFUL. nothing wrong with difficult exams, but hers were confusing and abnormal for a basic biology course.not inspirational whatsoever. lectures are awful, she is a bit unbearable. If you could have ANY other professor....CHOOSE THEM!!!

She has a passion for the subject but the exams were extremely difficult. I studied the slides and dynamic study modules but most of the material that was on exams aren't discussed in class so the exam are a hit or miss. I highly recommend you take a different Bio lecturer if you have the chance.

Dr. Ball is a good professor. She really knows what she is talking about. She explains topics clearly, manages her time well. However, she can make you feel a bit dumb when asking questions. The three exams are a bit difficult so you really have to know the topics. Lab final is cumulative, but lecture final is not.

She is a great professor. Had her for BIO1113 and if you attend lectures and do the Mastering, there is no reason you shouldn't do well in the class because a lot of concepts and questions come directly from those on exams. She is very receptive to feedback and very good lecturer. Her exams are only "hard" because they are very application based.

Even though the exams were very tough, the overall grade is points and not percentage so it's easy to recover. TopHat questions in lecture for attendance, but graded on participation and not correctness. Lab is a lot of group work and on large project. Dr. Ball is nice and is clear when explaining things in lecture.

Take this class if you want to crash out over a course! I spent all of my time taking this class just to score a 50% on every exam. As someone who spent lots of times studying her class was extremely difficult. I would never take her class or her exam.

If you took AP Bio in high school you will be more than fine with Ball. My lab really screwed me over. DO NOT TAKE SEA PHAGES LAB. It isn't necessarily hard but it is EXTREMELY TIME CONSUMING OUTSIDE OF CLASS. The real class itself was very straight forward and fine though. I started studying the day before every midterm and did fine.

Take this class if you hate yourself! This was easily one of the hardest classes i've taken. She often times goes too fast. Only thing that was good was she was passionate and loved talking about biology. Despite that, her exams were super duper difficult for an intro biology class. If you can take any other professor under biology 1113, do it.

Lecture pros/cons
-straight forward
-easy to understand :
-very dense
-speaks very slow (ended up watching lectures 2x speed)
-tophat attendance 

Exams are probably more difficult than other bio professors but despite what everyone says, they are not impossible to study for.Guarantee most complaints are from first year students w/ HS study habits

Exams aren't going to be simple multiple choice/memorization - neither are most  college STEM classes. Use Mastering as a main study tool - she pulls some questions word for word from them on exam. Put the work in as you would for a college class and you'll be good. SEA PHAGE lab is tough but just stay on top of it and ask for help if you need it.

She really does enjoy teaching, I do have to give her that, but this class was so incredibley challenging. For lectures she pretty much just read off slides and made tophat questions to go along. AVOID SEAPHAGES LAB AT ALL COSTS!! The lab work was so precise and graded SO strictly. Exams were so so so difficult. Don't take if possible!

Dr. Ball is very passionate about what she teaches and is obviously very knowledgable in the subject area.  She places a special emphasis on asking analytical and application-based questions on the exams.  Use the Mastering hw and the TopHat questions to review; these are often reflective of actual exam questions and prepare you to score well.

Like most, I struggled with her exams. I did everything she recommended and averaged terribly on them! I would avoid this course if you had the SEA Phages lab. It absolutely had nothing to do with lectures and the TA grading was harsh but Sarah Ball is very nice and passionate. I just wish with the work I put in there was something to show for it.

A lot of people say this professor is bad I would have to disagree. Exams can be tricky but if you go to lecture, study, and really put in the effort you'll do well. I honestly found the lab to be harder than the actual lecture for this class.

Sarah Ball makes exams WAYYYY too hard. as long as you do fine in everything else you will end the class with at least a B-. I got a 66%, 54%, and 51% on the three exams we took and ended the class with a B- just because I locked in for everything else. The exams are made very applicational and you don't learn half of it in lecture. Good luck.

A difficult course, but I feel that Dr. Ball does a good job at making lectures interesting and explains things well. I would try to avoid the SEA PHAGES lab if you do not want to be doing a lot of time-consuming things for lab, but the skills learned in this are beneficial. Ex) My friend had Dr. Ball and no SEA lab and had way less work.

Where do we begin. This class has been my most difficult experience at OSU. Small assignments are worth too much of your grade with homework graded for every question without room to learn, TopHat questions and NO study resources given. Very unhelpful and ambiguous teaching style, with impossible exams even if you study!! Do NOT take her class!!!!!
Tests were harder than they needed to be. If you have option to take a different professor, do it.

Dr. Danhart is an engaging lecturer who makes complex topics understandable. Exams require solid preparation, but his teaching style and helpful resources like unstuckstudy make the class manageable. Definitely worth taking if you're interested in biology.
Dr. Danhart was a great Bio 1113 professor! Would defiantly recommend him.

Dr.Danhart was a good professor and clearly loves biology. His lectures were a bit dull as he read off of slides in a vaguely monotone voice, but it wasn't bad overall. If you don't have any biology experience (like AP Bio or the intro to bio courses) and take this class, then be prepared to play catch-up. Overall an A is achievable with effort.
Professor Danhart is amazing. Really engaging lectures and clearly cares about his students and their success. His exams are fair and he makes sure you know what study.

Lectures have Tophats but are accessible through Zoom. He's decent at explaining concepts and if you know the slides and application questions well then you're set. Nice and funny guy. Most exam are 80% MC with a few short responses. Overall, easy class with a good professor.

The class is pretty easy overall and there were plenty of assignments throughout the semester. He provides learning outcomes for each chapter in his slides which directly correlate to what will be on the exams. Labs were confusing at times, not necessarily his fault but more of the TA I had.
His exams are kinda tough, you really have to have a good understanding of the material. He did a good job of explaining everything, and there was never an exam that had stuff that we didn't cover.

Take Dr. Danhart's class! He is probably the best professor for biology by far! Some topics may be confusing but he does a great job explaining them. The difficulty of the lab is really based off of which TA you get. But I wouldn't say his exams are super difficult if you know how to study. Find a rhythm and go over the application questions!

I love Dr. Danhart. He is clearly passionate about biology and provides an in-depth understanding of basic biology. He includes TopHat questions in his lectures and talks through the slides more thoroughly in class but he provided a Zoom option and recorded his lectures. The exams can be difficult but he provides enough resources to preform well.
I've taken 2 classes now with Dr. Danhart and i have no complaints at all.

Dr. Danhart is a really great prof.  I am not good at biology, but going to his office hours helped me so much. 
The class is definitely a lot of studying and not a lot of homework assignments, but there are a good amount of extra credit opportunities to get your grade up.  The class is weighted heavily on the 3 exams throughout the semester.

Dr. Danhart is such a gem! He genuinely cares about his students and is very kind and approachable. Exams were a bit difficult because there's a lot of memorization but he did his best to make lectures straightforward and not overwhelming. Labs were long but not challenging. I wish he'd teach every biology class I took.
Dr. Danhart is a great lecturer. However, his tests are a little harder than other bio 1113 teachers. However, I think this is offset by the quality of his explanations. Definitely would recommend.

Absolutely amazing professor. Knows how to teach and explains everything in great detail. This class is not an easy A, be prepared to study. If you follow the learning objectives you will be fine. Has lots of Tophat and HW points so take advantage. Lab is very dependent on your TA. Enjoy him while you can because he is one of the best at OSU.

If you can get Dr. Danhart for Bio 1113, PLEASE take his class. He explains things in the same amount of detail as he expects you to know for exams, and often provides mnemonic devices to help remember more of the difficult stuff. If you go to his office hours, he will like you and help you a lot with homework/projects/lab work/studying etc.

Dr. D is an amazing professor. 420 out of the 1000 points come from exams. To get an A, all you need to do is rewatch old lectures and be able to answer each of the learning outcomes. The labs are harder than what we learn in class. Dr. D is a good teacher and one of the best professors at OSU - he explains the 'why' behind everything!

This class wasn't super hard but be prepared to study a fair amount for the exams. Danhart has specific learning outcomes that are perfect to study with because he makes the exams off those. Over 1000 points in the class so not horribly test heavy. I recommend going to lectures because he gives a lot more detail that the slides don't have.

Dr. Danhart loves his to use tophat in class for every lecture, but honestly as long as you pay attention to the lecture you'll be fine. The midterms are also kinda easy because they are exactly like the tophats.

Dr. Danhart is a great professor who really cares about his students. He is very accessible outside of class. This class is difficult and it covers a lot of content but he is a good lecturer. You definitely need to put in a lot of time studying in order to do well. The labs are often annoying, but your lab grade is very dependent on your TA.
Great class and great teacher. He is always available to answer questions and his lectures were so helpful.

Gives hours worth of work outside of class and then ramble in lecture about nothing related to material. Spends 20min going over material and 60 min rambling about "explaining" the concepts. We are in college and are able to read and follow directions. Only cares about her ants. EX: had no idea we were in the National Championship this past week.
She is the worst. So annoying. A million assignments a week. Thinks her class is the only class anyone could possibly be taking during the semester.

This professor is amazing. She is super nice and understanding. There was a lot of work to be completed in this professors class, but it is not for a lot of points and if you finish the assignments assigned through out the course, you are likely to get a good grade.

Dr. Adams is very passionate about ants. The class itself seemed disorganized at times and this was especially true for the carmen canvas page. It was sometimes hard to find assignments or see when things were due.This class wasn't so difficult, but more just a lot of work and preparation. It would definitely be more appealing to entomology majors.

This was the worst GE I have ever taken. I signed up because of the name, but I don't think anyone knew that this class was about ants. Unless you are an entomology major or have an interest in insects/ants, you won't enjoy this class. She wasn't helpful at all, her instructions were never clear and she was super condescending. Avoid this class!!

In the most respectful way, I would never take this Professor again. For a GE this class was extremely strenuous and demanding. I feel as though there were a few moment of unfairness most of them being the instructor saying one thing then doing another. Save your time and energy, pick a different GE that meets the requirement.

Class was advertised as biodiversity but was entirely about ants. The professor was disorganized and condescending, often patronizing students about tech she couldn't even use herself. Deserted projects were due abruptly during finals week. As a pre-med, time wasted. By mid-semester, students were disengaged. Avoid if you value your sanity.
So disorganized, gives 8 credit hours worth of work for a 4 credit hour class. Do not take EEOB 2260
Worst and most unorganized class I've ever taken.
Terribly unorganized, expects you to an ungodly amount of work for a GE. Do not take EEOB2260 is it the worst class I've ever taken.

Makes a GE class, then proceeds to grade projects expecting high level work. Grades very strictly, class is unengaging and mundane. Most unorganized professor I've ever had the displeasure of taken the class of.

Do not take EEOB2260 unless you are an entomology major with previous experience.

Dr. Adams seemed disorganized and this class made me question the relevance to my major (Biology). She lectures on ants for 8 weeks but it is a flipped classroom so you don't really learn anything and lectures were hard to bear. Midterm was extremely hard and you couldn't check your answers.

Bio3401 made me wish I dropped my bio major and ran for the hills to any other major. The class has almost nothing to do with biology and is just a series of writing assignments that take a lot of work and have unclear expectations. Dr. Adam's exam was super confusing and the TA's grade so hard you'd think they got fired for handing out 100s.

If you have the option, avoid taking her. Not organized & you have some sort of writing assignment due every week. Flipped classroom for lectures. She BARELY goes over lecture material in class,so you are not getting set up for the exam, it's awful. "Best answer" and you can't go back to change your answer after you submit next on a question.

Great professor, excited to engage with students and participation. Material isn't too hard, flipped classroom but only attend one day a week. Recorded lectures were very precise with information you needed.

She's a very nice person but the way the class was set up was so overwhelming. Too much busy work and TA's and graders were really tough on assignments that really should have been easy points. Expectations for assignments aren't spelled out clearly too. Lectures are hard to pay attention to, partially due to them being an hour and 20 minutes.

This class is very boring and, for the most part, useless. However, Dr. Adams did a good job at making the material somewhat interesting. I am giving her such a high rating because her section of the class was extremely easy. You don't even have to show up to lecture (just watch the videos she posts online) and keep up with the busywork assignments

Dr. Adams is an amazing and well-respected researcher who really cares about her students in Biology 3401. She was in tune with students and adapted where necessary. There was a lot of material communicated in confusing ways in long out-of-class lecture videos and her exam is very tough. Understand everything thoroughly. Lots of small assignments.

This course was easily one of the worst courses I have taken as a graduating senior. The layout of her module was unorganized and there were too many unrelated assignments to focus on actual class material. The flipped class format does not work. The exam was all "what is the MOST correct" questions. I would literally take anyone else.

If you can avoid having Dr. Adams do it. Her lectures were all over the place and the organization was all over the place. We had too many pointless group assignments and papers that didn't really pertain to the class. While I think Dr. Adams is a really nice person, the structure of her class was god awful. Stressful for no reason.
Slides have alot of material so he goes really fast. Super funny professor but can be easy to zone out when going over super lengthy material. Exams are difficult.
Great professor, has a good grasp on everything he taught in the class. Takes time to answer question in and outside of class. Also just a cool guy, 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Bisaro gave very engaging lectures (at least to me). His background is in epigenetics and plant pathology and you can kind of tell when he lectures what he's passionate about. Very funny. Was nice to me when I was stressed about a grading mistake.
he's a very knowledgeable guy, but he is very boring. try to pay attention because there's a lot of content
Excellent and organized, clearly cares about and respects his students. Never makes you feel stupid. Not great with technology, but great lecturer.

His lectures had a very good set up of starting broad and then adding in all of the details. The exams were fair and were derived mostly from his powerpoints. Reading the book helps because he tried to follow it closely.
Excellent lecturer, fair grader, lots of material but extremely well organized, reasonable tests.

Dr. Bisaro was a great professor! His lectures were easy to understand and he was great about answering questions that students had about the material. His exams were easy as long as you studied what was taught in lecture.

He's awesome, incredibly informative, gives easy and straightforward exams, his notesets are excellent preparation for the tests, and his name makes me think he'd fight Batman.  He was really good and I look forward to having him a few more times in the year to come!
Love his classes! He's awesome!
Very good professor! he explains things slowly and have his own noted which are exteremly helpful. His test was fair. I recommend him.
I love this guy! He is so cool, and he knows stuff and explains really well!
No textbook for the class, simply provides extensive handouts.  They are very helpful.  Very clear in class... expects you to know your stuff but doesn't trick you too badly.
Cool dude, goes nice and slow - easy to follow lectures.  Excellent Noteset, straight forward test.  Would definitely take another class with him.
Very slow and concise. He does not try to cram too much into a single class period. Pretty good teacher.
He gives notes and he's great! I love this class.
She doesn't post any notes online, expects us to review every bit of content including useless videos for tests, and does a terrible job explaining concepts. Would never take here again.

Professor Booton is passionate about the material but his lectures can be fast-paced. Practice exams are crucial, and using tools like Unstuck ai alongside the textbook helps cement the concepts. With effort, you can do well in this challenging but rewarding class.

Dr. Booton was really great. I took his course over the summer over 8 weeks, so it was really lecture heavy, but it was not unreasonable. Dr. Booton explains tings really well, just make sure to come to lecture consistently.

Not much work outside of keeping up your lab notebook and lab reports. Exam was easy enough, though there wasn't any practice to prepare for it other than him verbally giving some practice problems in class. A lot of waiting around for the experiment to run though so it could be fairly boring

The worst teacher I have ever had in my 16 years of education. Lecture chapters > 350 slides and completely disorganized. Clusters of mass information are projected and exams are given every two weeks. I taught myself the entirety of the semester. With a 89.4, Dr. Booton would not round my grade. No curve even though he states it in the syllabus.

His lectures are very heavy for example the first module was over 700 pages. He gives you practice exams for the actual exam. Here is my problem he tells you to generate 6-9 of those practice exams. Which I did and still on the actual exam all the extended response weren't on the practice exam. Just be prepared to be disappointed.

Dr. B provides the materials you need to succeed, all you have to do is use them. Go to his office hours, get to know him, and take all of the practice exams. If you do good on the module exams, the final won't be stressful. He also provides a lot of in-class points so make sure to attend even if it isn't required.

Practice exams will definitely help but exams are still pretty hard. I'd recommend taking his recitation 4500E as it's a grade booster and not that much extra work(and a good way to get to know him, he's a very nice guy). Lectures were kind of hard to pay attention and certain concepts I felt he explained fast/poorly. He tries to keep it engaging.

Dr. Booton is a highly engaging lecturer who truly understands the field of genetics and all it entails. His lectures, while they had a lot of slides, were interesting and highly applicable to today's world. Does assign a lot of homework and exams were difficult. Do the practice exams he provides - they are a great help in succeeding in his course.

Prof. Booton is a great guy and fun to talk to. However, his class is difficult with how he sets it up. Each module has about 4-5 lecture slideshows and each one is easily 100-150 slides. He lectures quickly and it is easy to get lost if you miss something. He gives you unlimited practice exams which is the only reason I am passing this class.

Dr. Booton is a decent professor and he taught the material well. My biggest issue with him is that his problem sets fell out of sync with the lectures so we couldn't usually even begin the weekly homework until the night before it was due. Also, he uses TopHat so attendance becomes part of the grade.

Dr. Booton is very knowledgeable and willing to help. He provided plenty of practice materials to help students succeed and provided strong feedback on answers. I felt grading among his TAs was inconsistent in terms of points deducted across questions. Each lecture easily contains 80-100 slides with repetitive information.

So the first time I took MOLGEN4500 with Booton, I failed the class. When I passed, I sat in the front row. To study, I converted the practice exams to quizlets. Exam questions are pulled right from the practice quizzes. Booton also will get to know you if you sit up front and really likes student interaction. Also yes, his office hours are great!
he goes through slides so fast and does not explain them. he goes through 100 slides a day and the slides do not always make sense. i spend most of my time confused in his class

Im not sure why his scores are so low because I thought he was an average/good professor. He was really kind and incorporated funny things into the lectures. He does go fast, but its a STEM course after all. Tests are pretty fair and he offers to help often during class and office hours. His grading scale is different too which made it easier.

Super caring and patient professor. He has a lovely tone and is willing to re-explain slides in another way if you ask. Exams were tricky, but if you use the module self-evaluations you'll do fine. Gives a few weekly assignments per week so you can average a B/B+ on exams and still get an A in the class.
Very boring and repetitive lectures.

Synchronous lecture classes. Lots of assignments due before every new module. One project in the middle of the semester. Uses Tophat for attendance often but even if you missed a few lectures you get full credit. Pretty kind. Majority of exam q's straight off the practice exams so do those multiple times.

Dr. Booton taught the second half of my lecture which was pretty hard to adjust to after having a different prof for the first half. His lectures are very dense and it was less clear with him than with Dr. Picking what we needed to know for exams. Overall, he was a good professor and he is also a very interesting person.

If you ask questions there's a good chance he will find your question stupid. There are a few students he simps for but he always treated me like I was dumb. I guess you have to come to office hours for him to respect your learning efforts. He is very unhelpful and listening to his lectures can be incredibly discouraging.
His class is hard but he is a great teacher. Tests are fairly straightforward and easy
Super chill. No real exams, just a few online proctored quizzes. Uses TopHat each class for attendance. Records lectures and uses good slides.

Professor Smock is great! There aren't any mid or final, so it wasn't painful during the final time. Instead, there are 5 quizzes and the average score is high. There are lots of bonus points, so if you put much effort you can get an A easily.

Dr. Smock was a good teacher, however her bi-weekly lecture quizzes were difficult, and affect your grade. Lecture was fine, participation points were tallied randomly, you had to get the question correct to get the point. She gives a decent amount of extra credit so do all of it!

Attending lectures is very important and is extremely helpful for the class. She gives so many extra point opportunities. The quizzes are all online and proctored by HonorLock. There is no “final”, just quiz #5 which isn't cumulative. I loved bio 1114 with her!

really lenient and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities that you should definitely take advantage of even if you don't need it at the time. class was super chill and you can easily get an A if you put effort in on quizzes. however, some content is rly boring and can be easy to skip lecture or just tune it out and get behind.

Dr.Smock was a great professor, but lectures got boring over the semester. Instead of midterms, there are biweekly proctored and timed quizzes. The guided notes are all you need to do well on the quizzes. However, it is good to start studying way before the quizzes, as they are application-based.

A good professor easy to approach but the ABP project was a waste of time. Give lots of extra credit she does biweekly quizzes that's online but proctored. You don't get to chose your bio lab group she assigns you to a group. Also there's a lab cumulative final along with three lab quiz and one gets dropped.

For future BIO 1114 students: Keep in mind that while your professor is knowledgeable and kind, TAs handle grading for homework and projects etc. The professor uses Top Hat and expects you to stay engaged in class because those are big chunk of your grade. Some assignments can be very hard so I would recommend to do it early and work with your Ta

While I do not find the content in 1114 to be an interest of mine, Dr. Smock is a great and caring professor. Great heart and wants to see her students succeed, through bonus and out of class accessibility. Exams are very clear and accurate to her lectures, you will do well if you put in the time. If you have to take 1114, take it with Dr. Smock.

Smock was great. She explained content multiple times and tied in past content/terms when applicable, which helped solidify my understanding. She gave a ton of extra credit. So reviews said her lectures were "painful." I think it depends on how much you care about the content. Smock does a great job bringing up current global issues and solutions.
Lectures are painful. Tests are fair. She is friendly overall. Work load not bad.

Lectures can be insufferable at some timesTalks like an annoying mom when a few people are talking instead of just talking louder or turning her microphone up. It's just annoying and wastes time because in a room of 450 people, some are bound to talk. Grading is harsh too, never expect 100%
I took 1114 not 1114H but there's no option for that. Great professor, interesting lectures.

She doesn't give any exams, but just biweekly quizzes. It personally isn't for me, but it makes you study more often but less intensely. She is an outstanding lecturer though, and teaches super interesting material. Attendance is mandatory though.

This class was unnecessarily difficult for an introductory biology class. Quizzes required lots of studying, labs took many hours out of weekends, and the overall nature of the course was just frustrating. Take the regular section. That being said, Dr. Smock was a great person/lecturer and was always willing to help. Ask her lots of questions.
Is very harsh on vague grading criteria. Little to no guidance in lab or how to study for lecture quizzes. Take the regular section.

Dr. Smock is an incredibly tough grader and seems indifferent to the effort students are putting in. Her lectures are boring and she often talks about the same topic over and over again. The quizzes are hard, but manageable if you study. The labs feel completely pointless and she often gives very little guidance.
Dr. Smock was an amazing teacher and lecture. Her PowerPoints are straight word for word so you can fill in but the quizzes are challenging.

Professor Smock was a great professor. Her lectures were interesting and it was easy to pay attention because of how passionate she is. When it comes to the quizzes, memorizing does not work as the questions are application/understand based. Show up to lecture to get TopHat points for extra credit. Most labs are about a bird project that is boring.

Human Bio (1102). Very knowledgeable and to-the-point in her lectures. Lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but is necessary to earn TopHat points and for learning the material. Recitation attendance is mandatory- for a grade. No exams, rather a fairly large assessment every other week. I found these to be a bit excessive- they could take hours.

The open internet exams really threw me. At the time I was happy not to have to memorize the things that people in other classes did. However, now in subsequent classes that build off of BioChem I don't feel like I have as strong of a basis for the metabolic pathways that other students who took BioChem with other professors seem to have.

Dr. Cogan's lectures are quite boring but everything on the exams comes right from the slides. There are 4 midterms and a final which is a lot but the final was much easier than the midterms to take off some of the stress. There are a lot of free homework and participation points to help your grade. There was a decent curve too.
Listen to the people who say Cogan makes organic chemistry look like a complete joke. Avoid!!

This may have been the worst profess I have ever had. For reference I had Baldwin for OCHEM, and I found that her class was easier. He gives you no practice problems and we missed two whole chapters due to lectures that talked about nothing having to do with the class. If you are pre-med don't waste your time you will be underprepared for the MCAT.
Told us the first day that he wasn't expecting to teach

This section has four midterms and a final compared to other sections led by better professors that have two midterms and a noncumulative final. His exams are not indicative of your ability to understand the content. Lectures are beyond dry and he makes biochem an unpleasant experience.

Cogan focus a lot on diagrams in his lectures and on exams. The exams have difficult diagrams that are complicated and don't really test you on your biochemical knowledge. His lecture do focus on the most important topics, but he is a nice guy and the class is doable. If you work hard you can do fine.

Dr. Cogan is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He cares deeply about seeing all of his students succeed. He is understanding, and will always work with you if you are struggling. Exams can be difficult, but they are doable and you're given all the resources to study. Highly recommend doing the practice exams and going to office hours.

Professor Cogan's class was a real challenge. The open-note exams are deceptively difficult, with content that often feels unrelated to lectures. Though disorganized at times, he genuinely cares about students. Unstuckstudy was a lifesaver for preparing - highly recommend.
Always willing to help. Has lots of chances to ask questions, lots of office hours. Has a large curve

extremely disorganized course and set up very strange. Exams are open internet but difficult, keeps the averages around 60-70%. Poor content time management skills and bad at communicating homework due dates changing to correlate. Overall an overwhelming course and the way his class is set up makes it significantly worse.

Honestly, the worst professor I have taken. I had a 4.0 GPA before this class; I'm sure I would have loved Biochemistry if he wasn't the professor. He is the worst lecturer, I don't think I learned a single thing in his class. He has a cumulative exam at the end that is closed-note and I had multiple panic attacks preparing for it. Take anyone else

This class was super hard for me, but I don't know how much of that was because of the prof since I suck at chemistry. The exams are open note but REALLY hard and deadlines always get moved around. Came across as kinda callous the first few classes but he actually really cares about his students even if doesn't seem like it at first impression.

Very good professor but has difficult tests. The tests are open notes, but that doesn't make them much easier. He is accessible via email and his Sunday office hours and review sessions are helpful. Lots of exams and quizzes.
Buddy is an absolute geed. Very unhelpful outside of class and disorganized. Thinks that some students ask questions for no reason.

His exams are so difficult it makes Ochem feel like a Communications course. Not studying for his exams is a completely viable strategy because most of the time it will not even help you. You will pass or fail based off luck alone. Luckily though, so will everyone else, and the class is curved. So if you just need a C, this is the class to take.

He was extremely unorganized and time management was not his strong suit. Tests are open note/internet however they're very difficult and seemed to have little to do with the material. He uses programs online to "help" with the tested material, however that means you need to troubleshoot and learn different programs in order to get correct answers.

Dr. Cogan's exams were open note and internet, but were difficult and unrelated to class material. Recitation content was completely separate from lecture, and you are expected to know material not taught to you. He didn't cover all the content before some exams, and gave us an ADDITIONAL EXAM TWO TIMES as a "part two" that was not on the syllabus.

Dr. Cogan is a great professor! His lectures really helped me to understand Biochem which is a very difficult topic, and he was always accessible outside of class. He really and truly cares for all of his students which is insane because he teaches 250+ in one class. The tests were difficult, but there is a curve. Good luck future students!

Dr. Cogan is very smart and nice but he talks in 2x speed. I'm not kidding when I say I have to rewatch all of his lectures which normally takes me over 2 hours to write everything he says. You really have to understand the concepts to do well in his class. Exams are open note but very tricky and every question makes you second guess yourself.

This class has time management /planning problems. It needs to be a lecture say once a week plus the two days in lab as the professor is trying to present content in the middle of the lab time. Additionally, there were multiple days where most students went well over time and the TAs said that it happens every semester for those specific lab days.

She's great. She teaches the first half of this course and explains things very well. She breaks it down to basic understanding. She'll tell you what things to focus on for the exam and the type of questions to expect. Some trick questions but overall pretty good I thought. If you've taken bio1113 then this class is much much easier. & lab is fun.

I really liked Dr. B. She was phenomenal. I missed an A just by a few points, but I guess it is not that bad. As long as you study to understand the concepts not just memorize them, you'll be fine. The lab exercises are fun albeit long. Go to her office hours. You should focus on the lab notes and the objectives from the manual for the lab quizzes.

I disagree strongly with the negative reviews given to Dr. B. Yes, the lectures hold a lot of information, none of it is inhertly hard though. Don't cram for these exams. Dr. B does a great job telling you what she wants you to get out of each slide. Pay attention to the top hats she gives and the concepts she repeats. I learned a lot!

Dr. B is a great professor. She makes it clear what is on the exams and how you should approach the exams. There is a heavy amount of content, but you're given enough examples of what you should be learning for a good grade in the class. The course itself isn't memorization heavy, so be prepared to understand the why something happens, not what.

The course was dense, and at times could be difficult. Requires understanding of the material & not memorization. Dr. B. really cares if her students were learning, that being said she's not going to put in more work than you, so study! She's very accessible outside of the class! Fantastic lecturer, one of the better professors I have ever had.

Really engaging lectures that make hard material much more understandable than any other stem class I've taken. She assigns a very fair amount of work outside of class including lab and everything I did outside of class helped me learn the material well for exams. She is very caring and helpful when students ask questions. Knows her field!!

Professor Bullwinkle was overall a great professor. Her lecture slides were easy to follow, and she was good lecturer. Overall, the quizzes were hard to ensure students are thoroughly understanding the material. The exams were straight forward questions. She provided a lot of different resources to aid and gave extra credit on quizzes and exams.

Dr. Bullwinkle herself is pretty nice but doesn't always explain concepts well and her exams had me questioning my life choices. Doesn't post lecture recordings for some reason. LOTS of memorization so make sure to start studying early (do not start learning material the night before exams plz). Lab for this class is long but not difficult.
TA's did most of the grading and she wasn't particularly kind
Dense lectures that cover a lot but she's a good teacher! She gives you good information on what will be covered on the exam, and explains slides thoroughly.

Lectures cover LOTS of material, but she's very clear on what needs to be memorized for exams so you can get away with not studying extremely minor details. Bullwinkle is tough but she wants you to pass. I'm not the kind of person who's super smart or has time to spend hours studying everyday and I still got an A on both of her exams. It's doable!
The exams had too much content and there were 5 exams. Lectures were difficult to follow and heavy on powerpoints.

I was anxious about this class before taking it. However, I ended up loving the class. We had 5 exams during the semester, which is a lot. But I preferred frequent exams with lower percentages over less exams that weighed more. Lab was also very helpful with keeping your grade up. One remark is that she reads off the slides.

Dr. B is such a great professor and teaches the material very well. Her exams are always fair and it is easy to do well if you know the information. She is always willing to help out and is reliable when it comes to answering emails. It is a shame that she has to teach the class with Dr. Wetzel. Dr. Wetzel truly ruined microbiology for me.

I really enjoyed when Dr. B taught, she does a great job of giving you the information you need to know in the slides, and the grading is more than fair. Averages are in the 70's, but if you study you can easily get an A. This class was interesting and I learned a lot.

Dr. B was a great lecturer! She made the information easy to understand, and offered various was to study the material. She makes it very clear what will be on the exams, and the exams are pretty fair.

Dr. B is a much better lecturer than Dr. W so enjoy her lectures before they switch. Asks very fair questions on the exams, just make sure you understand what she explains in lecture (memorize what she tells you to - I made a quizlet) and review her tophat and mastering homework.

I liked Dr. Bullwinkle as a lecturer. I feel that if you pay attention it was not hard to do well in the course. Really enjoy the lab portion of this course as its very starightfoward and really fair. Exams can be difficult if you dont study as its a lot of memorize the slides. This class has been on the back burner for me and I have been fine.
I have never studied so much for a class in my life and not have my grade reflect it. Not to mentions she flys through lectures and her tests purposefully try to confuse you.

Dr. L is an excellent professor. I've had her for EEOB 2510, 4550, and 4520. She's clear with expectations, always available outside class, and genuinely wants students to succeed. The work and class can be challenging due to the content, but if you put in the effort, you'll definitely do well. I highly recommend taking any of her classes!

Best lectures!!! She's very sweet and friendly, and really does care about her students. She is accessible outside of class and so so helpful. She wants you to succeed. I cannot say enough good enough things about this professor, I cannot wait to take one of her classes again. If you put in the effort in this class you will succeed.
I love her! So nice. Good for quick learner who gets bored easily. Labs tough.

expect intensive lectures which are very interesting! she is a funny person and informative professor; the animals we learn about are really cool to understand; while the material is a little hard, if you engage with the lectures outside of class, the exams are not terrible. there are reading quizzes on articles each week, outlined on syllabus!
She is amazing. Take her if you get the opportunity. Her classes aren't that hard either, I have had her like 5 times and got an A each time!

Erin is an amazing professor! She is so kind and caring to her students, and you can tell she really wants you to succeed in her classes. I also had her teach my lab section of EEOB 3520, and she was just as amazing. The class content is difficult, and sometimes she can stray off topic in lecture. The exams are difficult, but homework is easy.
She's alright. Doesn't answer emails and can be pretty unclear during lectures. Good at answering questions at least!

She has the energy of a golden retriever (very nice and caring but SO MUCH energy). Her lectures are hard to follow, mostly because she talks really quick and starts sentences over multiple times. She genuinely cares for her students and will make time to talk about the material and grades. Exams are very hard - not enough time and math heavy.

Dr. Lindstedt is very passionate about what she teaches! She also is open/flexible to let students come to office hours/receive help with post-grad plans. The only thing negative I have is her exams are extremely difficult compared to lectures/book. They are extended response/math heavy and she doesn't give enough time for the amount of questions.
One of the best professors at Ohio State. Would highly recommend taking her classes.
Great lecturer! Can tell she really is passionate about the material!
Nice but that doesn't make up for the fact that she didn't explain the material well.

Erin is so adorable! She really wants her students to do well, and tries to get to know you if you attend regular office hours. She is a pretty fair teacher, and, as long as you do your work, you should do well!
This class was pretty easy, if you pay attention you should have no problem getting at least a B. She lets class out early pretty often. Also, she's a smokeshow, so I highly recommend this class.

She is by far the best profesor in the EEOB department. Her class was clear and easy to follow. She knows what she is talking about and is so approachable. If you hare having any troubles with the class I wouldn't hesitate to go up to her and ask for help. Nicest person ever and a true teacher that cares about her students.

LOVE LOVE LOVE ERIN! TAKE ANY CLASS SHE TEACHES, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. She is so nice and helpful and made an hour and 20 minute class seem to be 30 minutes long. She's so passionate about teaching and is very approachable, almost like you're talking to a friend. I wish I would have taken more classes with her. (not to mention shes a fair tester)

She loves what she does and it makes it so much easier to learn. Random participation points are given in class so attendance is pretty much mandatory, but they are super easy. Would take another one of her classes in a heartbeat

You will never have a professor as excited about teaching as Lindstedt. She makes class upbeat with her bubbly personality. Organismal Diversity is a fun class. Mostly dissections and keeping of notebooks. Pay attention to notebook feedback and you'll do fine!

Dr. Mendes is an incredible professor! As long as you come to the lecture and pay attention, it is very hard to do poorly in this class. The smaller assignments have a much larger impact on your grade so be sure to get all of the attendance points and to complete the homework!
His tests were very unfair. He would test us on material that had never come up in the lecture and then tell us to "read the textbook" without telling us what to focus on.

Attendence isn't mandatory but TopHat is used about every lecture for points. He does get off topic during his lectures a lot but it's all for a purpose. He is very interested in the topics at hand. Overall great professor. If you're planning on taking this class, make sure you read the textbook and know details.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really good guy, but his lectures were not very well organized. He often got side tracked during lecture. He also expects you to learn the content outside of lecture from videos on his carmen which are very boring. His exams were tough but I didn't think they were tough compared to other professor's exams I have taken.

Dr.Chiucchi is an amazing person, but he is not a good professor. The class is plagued with disorganized content, confusing exam questions, and no practice actually reflective of the exams. You watch lecture before class and do useless tophat during, so if you hate this, avoid the class. Focus on your lab grades because they can save your grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a very nice guy, not a great teacher (I think his ratings are inflated due to that). He teaches in a confusing style, cancels A LOT of class time, and stretches out explanations in lecture. The lab and lecture do not line up, and the joke of a lab was terrible. I do like his passion, teaching metacognition, analyzing graphs, etc.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really cool and laid back guy. Material was interesting to learn as well. Lab kinda blows and its graded somewhat strictly. My biggest problem was the exams. They do not correlate well with the material that is barely being taught through his lecture videos. They were borderline unfair. Cool professor, sub-par exam style.

Prof was always late to class and you have to attend to get points. Young prof goes off on wild tangents, extremely difficult to understand his lectures, exams are extremely difficult. Prof doesn't create atmosphere conducive to learning. Inability for students to adapt in harsh learning conditions results in lower "grade fitness" to overall GPA.

The worst professor I've taken. He doesn't bother to show up on time, is always a few minutes late, and then has the audacity to keep everyone after the allotted time. Makes tests unnecessarily hard and relies on outdated team projects which basically determine your entire grade. Very difficult to keep a good grade, and gives no practice material.

Prob my least favorite science professor I've taken. I heard good things, but man he drives me nuts. Doesn't bother to come to class on time, his answers to questions are so drawn out that I forget what we're even talking about at times, and the tests were not easy. I wouldn't say I don't recommend him, I just didn't particularly enjoy his class

I love Dr. Chiucchi! He was very funny in his lecture and made learning bio fun. You need to go to lecture to answer the Top Hat questions. Tests were easy and he emphasized the important things you needed to know beforehand

He is honestly one of the best professors. If you are willing to take notes outside of class then it is very easy. Going to lecture was mandatory for easy tophat points. His lectures are fun and most days we wouldn't even do anything. He doesnt teach you anything that you dont need to know for the exams. Exams were exactly what he taught in notes

You need to come to lectures for 70 top hat points! Dr. C was a decent professor but he didn't like the online format very much. Exams can be tricky but the textbook helps reinforce lecture concepts. Grades are largely dependent on your TA and some rough grading. Be proactive, put in the effort, and ask questions to do well!

He is MUCH MUCH better in person. Seems very unorganized and less interested in teaching now that things are online. Also (and this may be do to carona) he is IMPOSSIBLE to reach, if you email him you get an automated email back saying "please wait 2-3 business days for a reply". Hes a great and funny dude, just wait till class is in person again.

heard his class was easy. lecture seemed pretty straightforward and top hat questions were easy and simple. thought i was prepared for the first exam. NOPE. got a 68. never have gotten below a B on an exam before. he does not prepare you well for the exams at all as they are way more complex than the top hat qs. wish i could change my prof.

People really like Chiucchi, but he is not my fav. Lab is hard and this class is very dependent on those grades. He says exams dont have trick questions, but at lot do have one piece of info in paragraph that dictates the answer which can be tricky. Go to lecture because tophat gives you free points, and i suggest taking notes on his slides.
Dr. Chucci is a pretty funny guy but he does not know how to present the material in a way that is easy to learn. His notes are scattered and his tests are difficult to prepare for.

He's a very funny and caring professor. This course is very passable, but you have to be willing to put in some work. He is very accessible outside of class. The labs in this course are incredibly easy, too.

Hes aight. Nice guy whos clearly passionate about the subject, but slides often include a lot of info that is not relevant to what is tested on. I did find a lot of the material to be interesting. Exam scores barely affect your grade somehow, and there is no hw to boost you up. Your lab TAs grading will pretty much determine your overall grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a good lecturer and cares about his students success. However, this course has a lot of the problems 1113 did. Exams are hard to prepare for (no practice exams) and it is unclear what content will be tested on and what is just important stuff to know. Course can be unnecessarily difficult, as I got the same grade in here as in OChem

Easily my favorite professor of my college career. If you're reading this Chiucchi, ily. Don't let the haters bring you down. - Lots of office hours/personal help - Very funny and personable - Cuffs his jeans - Drinks lots of tea - Plays soccer with colleagues - Likes dogs - Hates when people misuse the word "adaptation" - Individuals don't evolve

Lectures are boring and mandatory because of tophat questions, but her exams are over the exact stuff in her slideshows. She gives you lots of tophat review questions before the exam and some are even the questions found on the exam. Overall the tests are a majority of memorization in my opinion. AP bio in highschool was harder than this.

While her reviews are low, Dr C really isn't as bad as people made her seem. Attendance is mandatory and seats are assigned. A LOT of inclass work with mandatory tophat questions and in class questions within groups so you essentially MUST be in class. Her exams are very straightforward and from her slides, nothing is ever a shock on exmas.
Dr. C is a good professor, but her tests and homework are a little bit heavy, and every week discussion questions. But you will receive a good score once you work hard in her classes.
so boring and not passionate about topics. lectures are boring and so are labs

The content of Bio 1113 is not terribly difficult, however Dr. Calhoon is a seriously boring and monotone lecturer. Her slides are filled with yap information that is not easy on the eyes, and speaks as if she needs to take a nap. You will most probably fall asleep in lecture

GO TO CLASS. No seriously, go to lecture, listen to what's going on, do her TopHat questions and you'll be fine. Her lecture slides and TopHat questions are SUPER HELPFUL for the exams. If you go to lecture and do the TopHats consistently, you can pretty much predict what's gonna be on exams. Also incredibly accessible outside class.
Attendance is mandatory, but her lecture is amazing. She encourages group works and explains everything very well.

Dr.Calhoon is an overall ok professor who mostly reads off of the slides. The lectures are pretty boring and you have to spend time outside of class to actually study to ensure you do well on the exams. Exams are pretty straight forward if you study and understand the concepts outside of class. Lab is definitely a grade booster but is also boring.

Lecture is the most boring thing in the world, I watched Netflix everyday. However, the in-lecture assignments and TopHat questions were easy points in the class, so as long as you go everyday you'll be fine. Lab is easy, and as long as you study the main points from lecture for the exams for a couple hours they're pretty straightforward and easy.
Has tophat questions during lecture, goes through content very fast and not very in depth, be prepared to study and learn outside of class to gather a clear understanding
Lectures had graded assignments so attendance is mandatory. Labs were not very hard. The tests were very hard.

This class is so impersonal, that I don't have anything to say about Dr. Calhoon because, despite being in her class for 4 months, I don't think she ever had a 1-1 convo with any student. She reads off of slides (that you have asses to), but attendance is mandatory for TopHat point. I solidly say that this class was mid at best.

Dr. Calhoon's bio class was the WORST bio class I've ever taken. She only reads off the slides, but attendance is mandatory. I don't think I ever learned anything from her. Her tests are also way too hard for someone who doesn't teach. The class averages were never great on exams. Don't take her if possible; there are better bio professors.

Most unenjoyable lectures I have ever had to sit through. Considering lecture is about comparable to and boring as sitting in your dorm or the library, reading off the slides to yourself, it is an easy classes to skip and feel comfortable with material. Too bad you are forced to go. Cares more about students talking then having engaging lectures.

This is the worst professor I've had so far. She's not at all interesting in lecture, and almost no one pays attention, but you have to attend for a grade. She has weekly homework assignments with questions about things you haven't learned yet, and then she teaches after the homework is due. I taught myself everything. Would not recommend.

Not awful just not very engaging lectures and very easy to not pay attention. However, as long as you answer all the in class questions and look over the slides before exams you should be fine. exams are fairly straightforward.
Information in lecture doesn't match recitation, none of which match the test. She teaches behind the mastering assignments and is very dry in lecture delivery. Felt like I had to teach myself.

Dr. Calhoon is the most boring lecturer ever. I think I would get the same out of sitting in my dorm reading through the main point slides. The only reason I attend lecture is because she grades TopHat and In class questions. She also reads directly off the slide. She leaves no room to write on the slides so good luck fitting any notes.

Doctor Calhoon was very well organized. Lectures can be a little boring at times but are very clear and prepare you for the exams well. Exams were easy but AP Chem (Chem 1210 equivalent) was super helpful background knowledge. Make sure to do the Pearson mastery and the Tophat extra review, questions are very similar and sometimes the exact same.

I had no issues with her! It got a little tough since I had an early morning class and you really need to attend lectures for the Tophat/ICA points, but overall it wasn't too difficult. It is very clear what content from lectures are going to be on exams which I love, I wasn't studying material I didn't need.

I loved Dr. C! She certainly wants students to succeed; she provide main point slides, records lectures, study guides, and practice questions before exams. Exams aren't hard as long as you study a bit in advance. Labs are also pretty easy. There's a discussion post every week and lots of in class points, so your grade is more than just exams!

I was initially very scared because many people said that the exams were the worst and hard to prepare for, but its not that bad. There are MANY slides for each exam, but to be honest the only ones that matter are the main point slides. She does MANY tophat questions in lecture, but they are easy points which helps a ton. Start studying early!

I found the class enjoyable and informative. Attendance for lectures is mandatory, and there are weekly homework assignments. She explains the course material and provides the slideshows used during lectures. She was also clear about what would be on the tests. However, the grading system is heavily based on exams, so it's important to study.

I was surprised by the low score for her, she wasn't the best teacher ever but she also definitely wasn't bad in my experience.  Just pay attention in lectures, take notes, and have a good study strategy and you should be okay.  
She does tophat every class, so attendance is taken through that alongside ICAs but I learned in her class.

She knows her stuff, but the organization of her modules is horrible and she gives out way too much homework for an intro course. There were times where I found myself struggling to keep up. The exams were worded in a way that can trick you if you're not careful. She puts extra credit in the class, so take advantage of that if you take this.

Lectures were very excessive and an extreme amount of Tophat questions per class. Personally, didn't like the note slides because they were filled in already. Posts study guides/main concept sheet for every exam. Lab was definitely a grade booster, lots of projects, quizzes, assignments for lab. Exams are easy and straightfoward if you go to class

Dr. Calhoon is a great professor who really knows her stuff. She is lecture heavy and a lot of points come from in-class tophat questions and lecture questions, but this provides opportunity for easy points. Textbook is not required.
I loved the way she explained content. She encouraged us to think for ourselves but guided us when we got stuck. Provided us w/ clear organized notes and there were no surprises on exams.

Lectures are somewhat excessive with a lot of in-class points. If you aren't a morning person like me, don't choose an early section that you'll sleep in past. In-class points make up more than 12% of your overall grade. Tests are lab quizzes are easy if you study, and labs are never bad. Workload is decent, but not terrible.

Dr. Calhoon reads of powerpoint slides during lectures. Tests are relatively easy as long as you study the Top Hat questions given in class. Attendance is based on Top Hat questions and in class activities as a group. Boring class but not terribly difficult.

Only thing bad is that attendance is basically mandatory. In-class activities/top-hat questions for points are given in each lecture. Other than that, the tests are straightforward and are exactly what she says during lecture. No need to read the textbook. She's a good lecturer and her slides are easy to understand and provide enough information.

She is one of the worst professors I have ever had. The information on the slides that she gives in class is different from what you would see on the exam. The lectures are very boring, she just talks and gives you questions in between. She grades her assignments to hard, she expects you to be a professional scientist. FIND A DIFFERENT BIO TEACHER!

Professor Calhoon is a great lecturer. Bio 1113 is not an easy class, but professor Calhoon made an A very possible. She gives you all the resources you need for the exams. She is incredibly organized. Attendance isn't technically mandatory, but there are top hats every class that ARE taken for a grade, so come to class!

While Professor Calhoon is a very nice and easy to access if needing help, her class is really hard you if dont watch the lectures and do the participation assignments . Her exams are super hard and worded in a way for you to fail.

Dr. Calhoon gives all the resources to pass her class. It is by no means an easy A, but she tells you exactly what you need to know for the tests and compiles it into one study guide for each test. She knows a lot about the information in this class. I loved every minute of having Dr. C!

While she is SUPER smart and knows a ton about what she's teaching, this class is way too busy work oriented, and the wording on her exams are insane. It's like trying to decipher latin without a dictionary. For being a Gen Ed class, it is far too much effort, and not worth it for how much stress it causes. Find another professor.

Dr. Calhoon is a very knowledgeable professor who provides the information and resources for you to pass her class. If you're anything like me, you HAVE TO STUDY to pass the tests. You can't pass without putting in effort, doing the homework, and studying for the tests. This class is hard, but she's a great professor with a lot to offer!

She was the lecturer for Samantha Kelly Herrmann's online Bio 1102 The Class follows a pattern of *15 Minute Video * 3-10 Question *15 Minute Video *Etc It's an excellent format. The lectures are good, and they cover literally everything you need to know, book is optional. Late Work is accepted at an extremely generous -10% per day.
Lots of work but doable, 4 exams, a quiz, a disease project, and participation graded, extra credit included. Tests are tough.

By participation I mean TopHat questions. She asks about 4-6 every single lecture so make sure to bring some device with you to class. These questions may seem annoying but they are extremely helpful to study for the tests. Theres about 4 tests including the final, but she complies all the information we need to know into main point slides.

I took this class for an admission prerequisite for my program and its just an introductory to biology. Its like high school bio just deeper information. But if you decide to have this professor, just know she includes a lot of participation off of top hat&packback which is dumb, 4 reading assignments, lab, oh & her tests are difficultly worded.
She has so many difficult exams and is a tough grader. She behaves like a PPT reader and boring lecture, I almost fall sleep. She never smiles in class and her face is like her students are robots.

Her class is obviously going be be lecture heavy because there was a lot of information that needed to be covered in a short amount of time, but Dr. Calhoon did a good job of breaking up class with different group activities and tophat questions. She also provides a decent amount of extra credit which is really nice.
Class was okay. Liz wasn't very helpful to talk to in person. Her tests often have options that read "two of the above" but never specify which two, which is pretty annoying.
Easy class with boring lectures. Show up to class and pay attention and it'll be an easy A.
Incredibly hard for just a GE. Exams are extremely difficult and unlike any material we discuss in class. Very difficult to obtain an A.
This class was fairly easy as long as you attended lecture in order to get top hat points. Labs were really long and usually boring. Lexie was my TA and she helped me out tremendously!
Crazy boring and too hard for a GE course. Don't even get me started with the useless labs. If your looking for an A, although not impossible, I would chose another class or professor.
The exams are rough and she words the questions weirdly.

Dr. Calhoon didn't have very interesting lectures and its pretty much mandatory to go because there are a lot of in-class points. However, if you review the main point slides and make flashcards for the bold terms she tells you to know-- the class is a breeze!

Exams are incredibly hard. I memorized the slides and study guide and they are almost nothing like the exams. I spent all of my time studying and could not get higher than a C on both exams. FIND ANOTHER BIO TEACHER.

Fairly easy class as long you take notes and attend class. Attendance is not mandatory but lots of tophat questions and group activities that are turned in. Exams mostly concept based, but easy as long as you study. Lectures can be long at points, but a plus is that all the slides are put on carmen. Easy GE credit class. Labs are not hard either.

This class can be fairly easy as long as you attend and take notes. Attendance isnt mandatory, but lots of tophat questions & group activities that you turn in. Lectures can be pretty long and can lose interest, a plus is that she posts all the slides on Carmen. Exams are not that bad as long as you study the material, concept based, but not hard

Lectures are incredibly monotonous. She reads straight off the powerpoint slide, and this doesn't help you at all on the exams as the questions are all applied concepts. I took this class because it was supposed to be an easy intro, but she made it pretty difficult to keep up.
Lectures are INCREDIBLY lack-luster. Good luck staying awake.

Easy. Go to class to get points from TopHat, but you don't need to pay attention. Labs are ridiculously simple, homework assignments are easy and take less than 15 minutes, exams are also easy as long as you pay some attention and study the vocab. Lots of grades so messing up a few assignments won't tank your grade. Best GE science.

Calhoon is pretty boring. Even though attendance is not mandatory, she gives you grades on top hat questions that you can only get in lecture.  She literally reads off the slides and that all so it seems pointless going to class. Lab is the biggest waste of my time; you need to go but learn nothing from it. Don't take her if you can help it.

This class was supposed to be an Introduction to Biology, instead it turned into 15 hour study days for an average grade. The material itself is interesting. However, Dr. Calhoon ruins that. She reads from the slides; this ends up hurting you on the exams, because they are application. Lectures suck. No missed lab policy. Badly structured class.
The lectures are very boring. She reads directly from the slides. You have to go to class in order to get Top Hat points. The tests are hard. Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy GE.

While the class itself was not too hard, the lectures  were dry to the point of being hard to listen to. In addition, the fact that the TopHat points are graded for credit means you're forced to attend and sit through her reading off of a slide. Pace of lectures was very inconsistent. Some days you're scrambling to take notes, others are slow.
Calhoon has a dry lecture but if you go to class and listen and take good notes, this is an easy GE class. Exams are easy if you show up to class and go to recitation for the jepordy review game.

Dr. Chiucchi is the worst round about talker. He goes on tangents every class period that are barely related to our lecture. He is very knowledgeable but not the best at teaching. He is super nice and funny but I haven't learned anything this entire semester. If you actually need to know biology then please choose someone else.

Dr. Chiucchi talks more than any professor I've ever encountered. He goes on insane tangents that are barely related to our actual content.
