You don't need to buy the textbook, the labs are very easy, there is no midterm, there are tons of participation points and lots of extra credit opportunities, and the 5 quizzes are online and can be taken twice. I did nothing all quarter and got an A.

Dr Cogan is a good teacher who tries hard to get his class to understand the material, but the lectures are often unclear and hard to pay attention to. He offers 20 extra points which can bring up any grade, and the labs and final are farely easy. The online quizzes can be difficult, but as long as you stay on top of the class its is not too hard.

The class is harder then the rating i gave it if you are actually looking for an A, you will not get it in his class. But you can get by if you do well on the labs which are simple and the online quizzes follow directly from the power point lectures. Also participation is required in the sense that you can answer questions in class to earn points.
I do NOT understand why he doesn't respond to e-mails. His exams are extremely hard. He doesn't do a good job explaining the material. I would NOT recommend to anybody...

Cog is a nice guy, and you can tell he means well. He bounces around in his lectures and it's hard to tell what's going on. 5 quizzes in the quarter, some are harder than others. Labs are easy. You have to come to class to get 40 clicker points. opportunities for extra credit points. no midterm.
Dr. Cogan is a nice guy and is extremely helpful at office hours because he knows you care. The only thing is, he kind of makes the material more complicated than it needs to be at lectures.

Biology is a subject that  really can't be taught in an exciting sort of way, unless you are a Scientist yourself.  Since I major elsewhere, this course is somewhat boring yet required.  A majority of the class likes him, since he's an all around nice guy.  He cares and will take time for his students.  Pay attention in class, and you'll do well.
He is a really nice guy who looks like Alan from the Hangover, but his lectures are hard to follow. But labs are easy and he tells really dry jokes and he is really nervous in front of the class.
Extremely boring. Hard quizzes

His lectures were incredibly boring and he makes sure you attend class by having clicker questions throughout class. The quizzes are hard at times, but you get a couple tries. If you need him for a GEC, it isn't that bad. Just do the work and pay attention.

This guy is the most monotone person alive. He is so boring. Impossible to stay awake in his class. His test are impossible because he gives you concepts you never have seen before. His "Study" guides are useless. He basically takes his notes and copies everything down and tells you that everything will be on the test, you study you a$$ off. LAZY
this guy is sooooo boring.  did not pay attention in lecture b/c its impossible.  labs are so stupid.  supposed to be bio 101 but more like bio 114 way too hard for an introductory class

Someone wrote that Dr. Cogan does not teach new material....well this is not a research class. He teaches facts and how life on Earth emerged, I do not know what people need more. Anyway I should say that he is not the worse professor. The only disturbing thing is that there is one cumilative exam and bunch of quizzes on Cramen that are challenging

I do not think Dr. Cogan as described by others. He is fine professor, lectures jus fine as well. First of all he does not require to buy a book, since he posts all notes online and he created an online book. Second labs are interesting and TA a way better than those in Chemistry.

This was a horrible class!  Sign up for another prof!  Going to classes is useless and so extremly boring, and the labs consist of things that three year olds would be better off doing.  Cogan makes Bio 101 so much more difficult that it needs to be.

SIGN UP FOR ANOTHER TEACHER!! His lecture is way too in depth for a biology 101 class and the lab and lectures are so unrelated that it is hard to grasp any concepts.  Also, you only have online quizzes that you get to use your notes, but the notes from in class barely help you on his quizzes, because there is so much in depth stuff!

Everyone tends to get an A in the class. But he isn't a very good teacher. His lectures are too in depth for a 101 course, but not in depth enough for his quizzes. You don't have to buy the textbook, but you have to buy a clicker.

Simple, don't take this class with him as a teacher. He teaches far beyond the requirements of the class, and quizzes are completely different from his lectures. Lab is really easy, but even if you do well in lab it won't help your grade that much. Again, don't take this teacher. FIND A DIFFERENT TEACHER!

don't waste your money on the book. the lectures are very boring and the labs are stupid but if you go to lecture to get the participation points and you get good grades on your labs and quizzes, it will be easy to get an a in the class. its easy to get a good grade in this class if you put some time in, but you won't learn anything

Lecture and lab are completely unrelated, it's like taking 2 classes. So unorganized! I spent hours outside of class every week trying to organize my notes to no avail. While I admire his passion for biochem, it makes for less of the basic bio you signed up for and lots of completely unnecessary information.. his 101 class is NOT a 101 class.

I basically agree with everyone else. His lectures are virtually incomprehensible, the labs are completely unrelated to lectures, and his grading system is ridiculous. There's only a final exam, which will most likely end up killing your grade since it's so hard and he doesn't tell you what to study. Nice guy, but terrible professor.

this is the worst professor i have ever had. he does NOT stay on track. he spent 3 lectures on photosynthesis, yet barely anything on that was on the final. he focuses on MINOR POINTLESS details. quizzes don't match up with what was taught. class avg for final was 71% in a BIO 101 CLASS. worst teacher at ohio state, NEVER EVER take him. ever.

Not that this class was too hard, it was just all over the place. It seems like he taught more chemistry than biology. The average on the final was a C-. I feel like he should have taught the class like an introductory biology, and he didn't.

This teacher is awful. Listen to all the comments on this site because it's true. The teacher acts like its a 400 level class and his quizzes are rediculous. Don't take this teacher under any circumstances.

This class is a 101 class taught by a biochemist. He cannot teach the material and maybe that is not his fault since he has taken many biology classes to get where he is. BUT this professor is terrible, his lectures are impossible and quizzes are irrelevant to current material. DO NOT use this professor if you have to take this class.

Worst professor ever. Quizzes do not correspond with the lectures.  Labs are ridiculously easy and simple, like a bio 101 class should be, and the lectures are incomprehensible. Unorganized and never has planned what he's going to talk about in class. NO NO NO.

Doesn't teach to an equivalent of 101 level. teaches like a 400 level. Very confusing. Took forever to get an e-mail response for help. Lectures are incredibly boring, and the information is all imperative to know for the only test given (final only) online quizzes (get two attempts)

He seems like a nice guy but I had difficulty with this class - many concepts were rushed or briefly touched upon and I didn't feel as though I learned much of anything by the end.  I ended up with a decent A but I don't feel as though I did much to deserve it (a lot of points came from lab work which at best was loosely related to the lectures).

Worst professor I think I've ever had, he is extremely unorganized and all over the place. The material was way to indepth for a 100 level course. He tended to forget that he was teaching Bio and very frequently focused more on Chem. Did give extra credit which greatly helped my grade but do not recommend him for this class.

I signed up for biology, not chemistry. I dont really care if hes a biochemistry major, thats not what I signed up for. The lecture material has nothing to do with labs or quizzes. You don't use the book at all so do not buy it.

I would definitely NOT recommend this teacher.  The class is completely unorganized, lecture material is unrelated to labs, and the material is grazed-over. DO NOT buy the book. You won't learn anything, but you will get a decent grade. Requires blog writing and quizzes outside of class.
He is very boring, unorganized and hard to follow in lecture.

The worst professor I have ever had in my entire life. Doesn't understand basic chemistry. Doesn't teach. Doesn't come to lecture, review sessions,final exams on time. Doesn't answer emails. Makes you memorize everything you have to learn to the atom. Does absolutely nothing you want in a professor.

He tended to blab a lot and tested on random things on Midterms and finals.  For taking AP Bio in high school, I only came out of this class with a B- after attending class and studying.  Just make sure you study every single random thing.  Not a bad guy though.
Hard exams. Tests you on the most obscure things from powerpoint pictures that you dont pay much attention to. Concepts are fairly easy but the concepts aren't what is tested.

Cogan is a good teacher, and the notes are all online so you should bring them to class so you have a chance at actually following along. We did not get through the syllabus so it seems he has started to get better about going slower. It was still a REALLY difficult class, especially for a GEC so take 101 if you can.

Took his class AU 08.  He was an ok guy.  He did provide quiz reviews/lecture notes and was a helpful when we had questions.  His quizzes were somewhat difficult, but he allowed his students to challenge their grades. Would recommend.

Took his class in fall 08' and thought that his lectures were a waste of time.  Just MEMORIZE his lecture notes, because there were often minute details that were on his tests from the notes, also don't bother with the textbook, you won't need it.

He is good guy but he doesnt give enough study guides, his exams are tricky and hard. he gives previous exams for study guide but they dont help. i wish he could give study guide. other than that he is a good guy.

Lectures should be focused on important topics and less time wasted. Students are more likely to be apt to come to lectures if material covered was not prefaced with "this won't be on the test; don't worry about writing this down." He goes way too fast!

He posted thorough quiz reviews and lectures online.  His quizzes and final exam were fair and presented in a way that encouraged the students to think about the subject matter.  He was very easy going and likable.  His lectures were organized and  presented using various methods such as PowerPoint, films and etc.  I would definitely recommend him.
Only had him for half the quarter. Course is at a very fast pace. Exams were hard. Seems like a nice enough guy but did not like him as a professor.

The labs & article responses are easy points, but his quizzes and the final are difficult. The first few quizzes are pretty easy, then they just get ridiculous. His final is pretty hard too; he said to study the quiz reviews for it and that didn't even help. His lectures are very boring as well; luckily he posts the notes online & quiz reviews.

Avoid him! I did not like his teaching style (confusing examples...tried to incorporate pointless and unhelpful media sources.) Quiz questions are confusing and unclear and he only has one test:the final. I would have definitely taken this class with another professor. Plus, to top it off he makes inappropriate jokes to try to relate to students.

Dr. Cogan was very interested in the subject matter.  He did a very good job of making the long lectures interesting and helpful.  Some quiz questions were vague at times, but he usually tried to understand and make things fair in the end.  Great guy, recommend him.
he sort of expects everyone had taken AP Bio unless how could he cover 10 chapters in 4 weeks?! His explanation on the subject matter is not clear either...

I really tried to like Cogan because he seems like a nice guy.  His exams, however, are completely vague, which seemed to be the general consensus among my class.  If you study a lot and like to do well, take someone else!!When you don't know what test questions are asking, it doesn't matter how much you study. If only someone would have told me.

Cogan has the very best intentions. Unfortunately this wasn't exactly manifested through his somewhat mediocre teaching abilities.  In his defense, there is a ton of information to cram in your head in only one quarter, so often times the subject material seemed scattered and incoherent. None the less, I would still recommend taking him.
Cogan was alright. He was pretty boring, but his midterm was pretty easy if you studied. He gives homework so that the midterm is worth less. The assignments aren't bad.
Professor is very nice but very jumpy on subject matters. The quizzes and final was very hard even with studying the review sheets.

He was a super nice guy and great to help you when needed, considering the class size. The quizzes and tests were difficult, but there usually is quite a curve. Dr. Cogan is a great professor and I enjoyed getting to know him! Very funny, always said something in the mornings to make us laugh!:)

The class really isn't that hard.  The questions asked on the quizzes are more specific than you'd expect but he gives review sheets... show up to class and stay somewhat awake (not as easy as it sounds) and read the review sheet and you were fine.  I didn't buy the book... getting an A.
His exams are really hard as mentioned.

He's a little dry... and his PowerPoints make lecture a little useless to attend. My best advice for this class is READ THE BOOK! And you know that little CD that comes with it? Use that too! I did and I aced this class.

His efforts to be funny did not go unappreciated. He is very easy going and just an all around great guy. His quizzes were straight forward even though the tests were a little trickier. He made the 8:30 am 5 days a week go a little easier
Nice guy, but he is very boring. It is hard to stay awake in that class. His slides are really good and he gives helpful practice problems prior to exam. Study his slides and you should do fine.
He is helpful but I felt like at times he didn't know his stuff.  Class is very disorganized and exams were extremely hard.
Dr. Cogan was a pretty good teacher. Explained things well, made occasional jokes, and he answered questions correctly and to the point. Posted helpful notes online. I would recomend him to anyone.

He was our laboratory coordinator.  He never had anything set up by the time lab started and didn't even bother posting the stuff that we were supposed to read before class online, so we had to waste 30 minutes of class listening to him explain it after he made us read it.  He made bio lab a worthless 2 hours twice a week.
No Comments

posted notes online, which was nice.  tried to make lecture interesting and tell jokes, with occasional success.  quizzes every friday at 8:30 am were a pain, definitely required studying.  final was alright.  anoter prof would probably be easier for 101.

In the beginning of the quarter the course wasn't too bad, and I did well on the weekly friday quizzes. But later on, the class average for the quizzes started to drop. I would prefer non-multiple choice questions; the final exam is going to be hard.

early in the quarter he was very clear and everything made sense. as time progressed it seemed like he gave less useful information. its' best to just study the quiz review like a fiend than to actually attend this lecture.

I don't know whether the lecture is too early or just boring but I always fall asleep. Quizzes every Friday seem easy when I take them but the class average has steadily been declining. All notes are online and a really nice quiz review once a week.

This class has time management /planning problems. It needs to be a lecture say once a week plus the two days in lab as the professor is trying to present content in the middle of the lab time. Additionally, there were multiple days where most students went well over time and the TAs said that it happens every semester for those specific lab days.

She's great. She teaches the first half of this course and explains things very well. She breaks it down to basic understanding. She'll tell you what things to focus on for the exam and the type of questions to expect. Some trick questions but overall pretty good I thought. If you've taken bio1113 then this class is much much easier. & lab is fun.

I really liked Dr. B. She was phenomenal. I missed an A just by a few points, but I guess it is not that bad. As long as you study to understand the concepts not just memorize them, you'll be fine. The lab exercises are fun albeit long. Go to her office hours. You should focus on the lab notes and the objectives from the manual for the lab quizzes.

I disagree strongly with the negative reviews given to Dr. B. Yes, the lectures hold a lot of information, none of it is inhertly hard though. Don't cram for these exams. Dr. B does a great job telling you what she wants you to get out of each slide. Pay attention to the top hats she gives and the concepts she repeats. I learned a lot!

Dr. B is a great professor. She makes it clear what is on the exams and how you should approach the exams. There is a heavy amount of content, but you're given enough examples of what you should be learning for a good grade in the class. The course itself isn't memorization heavy, so be prepared to understand the why something happens, not what.

The course was dense, and at times could be difficult. Requires understanding of the material & not memorization. Dr. B. really cares if her students were learning, that being said she's not going to put in more work than you, so study! She's very accessible outside of the class! Fantastic lecturer, one of the better professors I have ever had.

Really engaging lectures that make hard material much more understandable than any other stem class I've taken. She assigns a very fair amount of work outside of class including lab and everything I did outside of class helped me learn the material well for exams. She is very caring and helpful when students ask questions. Knows her field!!

Professor Bullwinkle was overall a great professor. Her lecture slides were easy to follow, and she was good lecturer. Overall, the quizzes were hard to ensure students are thoroughly understanding the material. The exams were straight forward questions. She provided a lot of different resources to aid and gave extra credit on quizzes and exams.

Dr. Bullwinkle herself is pretty nice but doesn't always explain concepts well and her exams had me questioning my life choices. Doesn't post lecture recordings for some reason. LOTS of memorization so make sure to start studying early (do not start learning material the night before exams plz). Lab for this class is long but not difficult.
TA's did most of the grading and she wasn't particularly kind
Dense lectures that cover a lot but she's a good teacher! She gives you good information on what will be covered on the exam, and explains slides thoroughly.

Lectures cover LOTS of material, but she's very clear on what needs to be memorized for exams so you can get away with not studying extremely minor details. Bullwinkle is tough but she wants you to pass. I'm not the kind of person who's super smart or has time to spend hours studying everyday and I still got an A on both of her exams. It's doable!
The exams had too much content and there were 5 exams. Lectures were difficult to follow and heavy on powerpoints.

I was anxious about this class before taking it. However, I ended up loving the class. We had 5 exams during the semester, which is a lot. But I preferred frequent exams with lower percentages over less exams that weighed more. Lab was also very helpful with keeping your grade up. One remark is that she reads off the slides.

Dr. B is such a great professor and teaches the material very well. Her exams are always fair and it is easy to do well if you know the information. She is always willing to help out and is reliable when it comes to answering emails. It is a shame that she has to teach the class with Dr. Wetzel. Dr. Wetzel truly ruined microbiology for me.

I really enjoyed when Dr. B taught, she does a great job of giving you the information you need to know in the slides, and the grading is more than fair. Averages are in the 70's, but if you study you can easily get an A. This class was interesting and I learned a lot.

Dr. B was a great lecturer! She made the information easy to understand, and offered various was to study the material. She makes it very clear what will be on the exams, and the exams are pretty fair.

Dr. B is a much better lecturer than Dr. W so enjoy her lectures before they switch. Asks very fair questions on the exams, just make sure you understand what she explains in lecture (memorize what she tells you to - I made a quizlet) and review her tophat and mastering homework.

I liked Dr. Bullwinkle as a lecturer. I feel that if you pay attention it was not hard to do well in the course. Really enjoy the lab portion of this course as its very starightfoward and really fair. Exams can be difficult if you dont study as its a lot of memorize the slides. This class has been on the back burner for me and I have been fine.
I have never studied so much for a class in my life and not have my grade reflect it. Not to mentions she flys through lectures and her tests purposefully try to confuse you.

Great professor and person. Very useful slides and explained content very clearly. She teaches the first half of the class and did very well. I wish she taught the whole semester. If you memorize everything on the slides it wouldn't be hard to get an A.

Dr. Bullwinkle is a good professor and passionate about what she is teaching. If you read the slides thoroughly and have a good foundation of the material, you should do very well on the exams. Material for this class isn't difficult but can be quite dense for certain chapters. The lab portion was also fun and very very low stress.

Dr. Bullwinkle really wants students to succeed in the course and gives students the tools to do so. Lecture slides were well-organized. Exams could be a little vague in spots. Generally very passionate about the course material and about helping students succeed academically.

she's a relatively good professor but you really won't learn anything because she talks so fast. even her recorded lectures are done so quickly you have to listen to them on 0.5x speed. her tests are really difficult be she claims they are fair, which they kind of are if you think a 50% average on all the exams is a fair grade.

I enjoyed Dr. Bullwinkle, however, I did not find her lectures to be very helpful. Would highly recommend reading the textbook! Her quizzes and tests were somewhat challenging but very doable if you study well. She also offers some extra credit!

The quizzes definitely brought down my grade but overall having the option to drop a quiz and a test helped bring my grade back up. Make sure you watch the lectures and take good notes, I usually watched the lectures twice to help me. Her in person review sessions are SO helpful she makes sure you understand the material.

Had her for first half of MICRO4000.01. Listening to lectures and taking thorough notes for studying is key to doing well. TopHat questions seemed a little unnecessary as it took up class time. Quizzes/tests are all on Canvas, but questions are worded weirdly and some topics weren't really discussed in lecture.

The class is flipped format, so the lectures are watched on an asynchronous day and then material is gone over/quizzed on TopHat during in person days. Her prerecorded lectures were extremely long, and did not respect the students' time. Her tests were easy, came directly from notes, and there's 2 drops. She did not give the answers you got wrong.
I found her lectures very interesting to listen to, the course work was just the usual amount not anything terrible. As long as you take good notes you will be fine for the exams in my opinion.

Dr. B literally gives you exam answers in the lectures, so just take good notes during the videos and go to her office hour review sessions. If you do these things you literally cannot get below an A on every exam. When people say her tests are hard, it's only because they most likely never took notes.

I wish she went over the labs before making us answer questions on the material. Shes very helpful, nice, and friendly. The material is just hard to grasp and she doesnt quite help by making exam questions hard to grasp either. The exams are set up for a lecture class, not a lab class.

Dr. B is amazing. Her exams are detailed, but manageable as long as you understand the details of topics taught in lecture. Book is not even required, especially if you go to office hours and pay attention. Not to mention, she is very caring and patient if you do have questions.

I had Dr. Bullwinkle last semester in the spring of 2021 and Im not going to lie, but she was a pretty good professor. She is extremely nice and caring but definitely makes you earn your grade. Take good notes and take pictures and you will do just fine in her class.
She did not teach the concepts well. She could not explain the complex concepts well and left me more confused. Her lectures were very lengthy as well.

She is the more difficult of the two professors who teaches this class. It's not the material but she has an inability to convey complex scientific concepts where students can understand it. Read the book. Exams are very ambiguous and don't have much to complete. An exam example is "Respiration requires" it's not what you think.

She is nice, but her exams are a little bit on the harder side and she her lectures are pretty long for each section. I would recommend going to her review sessions because there are always test questions regarding the information she goes over then.
Honestly did not care about students. Hard exams for material that was never covered in pre recorded lectures or slides. Horrible professor. It is sad she is the only one who teaches this class.

Pay attention to lecture videos and go to OH (40-50/ 700 were there and she's very understanding - never made me feel stupid for asking Qs). Don't read the book - do the exercises she gives you and think about how concepts link together and big picture. Fairly straightforward to pass but hard to do well in.

Required a make-up exam within a week of a death in the family and offered no leniency on this (the death was from a parent very suddenly and proof was provided within the mandatory three days). The makeup exam was in essay format while the original was multiple choice, and she told me this was fair. She made a traumatic situation worse.

- You should read the book instead of relying on the lectures - Exams and quizzes are badly worded and a minute per question - Can't see the questions you missed or how you did compare to the rest of the class - No exceptions for emergencies for exams and quizzes even in a pandemic - Exam content is different and more difficult from lecture content
Her lecture material does not reflect her exams. She is very fast paced during the lecture and does not do a great job with explaining the concepts.

Dr. B's exams have nothing to do with what was talked about in lecture, and are impossible with the time crunch. She clearly doesn't care that her students do well, and does not care that we are all under a lot of pressure with classes being online. Honestly one of the worst professors I've had. do better Dr. B.
Her exams are next to impossible. Do not take!!!! Shes testing on stuff she did not review in lecture, and the questions are worded terribly and confusing.

Dr. B is good! She is clear about expectations and makes sure that all info is on the slides- attending lecture is a must to help solidify concepts! She is very kind and helpful in office hours, and will do everything she can to keep the course fair and doable. You definitely have to put in work, but she is clear about what is expected.

She's a decent professor who cares a lot for her students. If you show up to lecture, take notes, and stay on top of the material, this class is not difficult. There is a lot of material, but Dr. B is willing to sit down with you in office hours which I highly recommend going to. She's the sweetest person and great professor overall.

She is a terrible professor. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Don't even bother listening to her in lecture half the stuff she says she doesn't even test on. Pay attention to materials on slides that are written in very small font. I was really excited to take this class but she made it boring., dry, and uninteresting. Book teaches you more than she can.

Let me make this easy for you. Avoid this class at all costs Shes an amazing person but teaching isnt for this lady. She reads off slides. Her tests have no correlation to what she teaches. Unnecessary top hat questions. Just dont please take micro somewhere else

Dr. B seemed knowledgeable and willing to help her students! She tended to read off the slides for her lectures, but the exams seemed to be based on the content included in the slides. The exams were fair, but a little bit ambiguous at times. She offered 3 points of extra credit during her half of the course!

She was very knowledgable about the subject, but her tests are very challenging. You need to be prepared to work for your grade. It is very important to go to lecture as she mentions things there that are on the exams, Practice the online modules, tophat, study each week and you will most likely get an A.
Dr. B was good, but some of the exam questions were somewhat vague and hard to understand. I found that reading through lectures until I understood every concept was helpful.

She is a fair professor. I enjoyed her section of the class a good amount, as she kept it interesting. The exams weren't too difficult, but did require studying. Studying a decent amount resulted in doing well. Going to lecture and listening definitely helped, as the exams are based off of the PowerPoints.
Doesn't prepare students for exams, doesn't give good slides, doesn't explain things long enough. Is not clear what she wants us to learn.

Great professor! She makes her exams off of her powerpoint and not from book. Exams were vary fair and not super difficult. You need to study but it not a horrible class. She is fair and throws out questions that don't make sense or weren't written well. Also does unannounced extra credit so go to class. I would take a class with her again!

Was expecting hard class and hard professor from reading on here. Dr. B is one of the best profs I've had at OSU. Makes otherwise seemingly difficult material easy to understand. Does give unannounced extra credit so I recommend going to lecture. Usually does out of class review the day or week before exam, highly recommend, good time for questions

Dr. B was okay. She read a lot of the material off the slides, but she was always quite clear on her expectations when it came to what we needed to know. Exams were difficult but quite fair. The class is fast paced and her lectures could get mundane, but it could definitely be worse. Lab is useless and barely related to lecture, but a grade booster

when i asked a lot of people about this class they made it seem very hard and it really isn't. Regarding Dr. Bullwinkle, you can 100% skip class and do well on her exams because she goes right from the slides. However, about Dr. Mia, if you dont go to class you are screwed, she uses a lot of her examples on exams. Lab exam can hurt your grade.

I liked Dr. Bullwinkle, she seemed really nice and she enjoyed teaching. Her material was just really dry and boring, and she wasn't very interesting to learn from. She reads directly off the slides and doesn't elaborate, so it's incredibly difficult to listen to. The MasteringHW is a great way to study though!

I thought this class would be a lot more difficult from the things that I have heard people say. Bullwinkle was a good professor and if you go to class then you wont have an issue with her or the material. She gives some examples in class that will be on her exams. The mastering assignments are an easy way to study and actually learn the material.

Prof. B was very mediocre. It's hard to pay attention in class or find what she is saying remotely interesting because she just reads off the slides and doesn't really answer questions when they're asked (gives a very general/unsure answer). Make sure you study the slides & look into things you don't fully understand (Don't bother with the booK.
Dr. Bullwinkle is straightforward with her expectations. Follow her suggestions, figure out her style, and put in some work and the class should go smoothly.

Dr. B is an amazing instructor and she is very very sweet! Her lab really is the climax of the microbiology major and it's heavy genetic and biochemical basis. Her three midterms are difficult and rely heavily on knowing the experimental rational, and her homeworks are tricky, but she is more than willing to help her students succeed.

i've seen reviews that said she read off the slide a lot or said umm a lot but those were from 2 years ago so she must have drastically changed because just the other day I was thinking to myself how great of a presenter she is. Everything you need to know is on the slides. i crammed the day before the exam and got a good grade just from the slides

This was my favorite class I've taken as part of my degree because Dr. Bullwinkle makes it super easy to understand what's going on and is really clear about what's going to be on the exams. Also, the exams are incredibly fair.

it's hard to avoid reading off of slides in micro; i thought dr. bullwinkle was perfectly fine in that aspect. he seemed like she cared about our learning and our success, and i learned a lot. the class structure requires hw from the book. i don't really think you need to read to do well on the exams but you need it for the hw.

She gives very clear lectures. I liked her a lot as a person too. Still had to read the textbook, but exams weren't too bad. Not a lot of points in the course, so that makes getting a good grade hard. Really enjoyed the content and lab was super easy and fun.

Overall, if you just memorize the slides (she posts them online) it should be an easy A. Attending lecture can be helpful to learn what she focuses on, but not attending would't affect your grade that much. Online homework is easy, but not worth many points. Lab can seem overwhelming at first, but is mainly participation (no lab reports like chem).

She has the worst slides I have ever seen done by a professor, they each have maybe three words on them if you're lucky & the rest are pictures that half the class doesnt understand. When studying for her exams you have BAD slides about a topic & are then expected to know everything about it for the exam. Book required but doesnt help with studying

As far as bio classes go this one was one of the easier ones I've taken.   She is good at explaining things and very approachable in office hours.  Her slides can be unorganized which is why you need to go to class to know what is actually important. You will be required to buy the etextbook.
Reads directly from the slides, so there's no point to going to lecture. If you have the lab though- its ridiculously easy.

Dr. Bullwinkle taught a great class! She was always very helpful and accessible outside of class. The lab is challenging but at a level where it should be a majors class (personally I thought it was very straightforward). She worked around some difficult schedules and even moved some homeworks to lighten the course load.

Dr. B is one of the best profs at OSU and certainly in the Microbio department. She genuinely cares about students understanding and being able to apply the material that's being taught. If you have questions, she's more than willing to help out. Very approachable and doesn't make you feel bad for asking questions. Quizzes are tough but fair.
She does a fine job. Memorize what she says and subsidize with the notes. Didn't use the textbook once. Homework kind of pointless but worth points.

Although the class was challenging, if your taking it it's your major so you should be used to it by now. Dr. Bullwinkle went above and beyond to help the students and was open to our opinions. I really felt like she valued us and helped us learn and grow as scientists. She definitely knew her stuff, was well organized and made a hard class fun!
Friendly professor and caring. Attendance not mandatory; she reads straight off the slides. If you study each slide and double-check the book for extra info, you will do fine on the exams.

This class was terrible. She reads directly from slides and says "uhhh" a lot. Also told us not to study for certain things on the exam that she ended up testing over. Her slides are overcomplicated and confusing. She is NOT helpful to learning the material. Just throws it all at you and expects you to know everything. Terrible class.

Bullwinkle (not the bar) is a decent lecturer, but she pretty much just reads straight off the slides. Honestly, don't feel bad if you skip lecture every once and a while because she posts the slides and they are pretty detailed and easy to study from. Also Hitchcock 131 is also great for naps... completely unrelated though

A nice lady, and easy exams. Test material comes straight from lecture slides. However, lecture is painfully boring and she just reads off the slides. Would recommend another microbio professor just to learn and retain the info. But overall, easy class and lecturer

Bullwinkle makes great power point slides and is generally pretty easy to understand in lecture. As long as you generally have some idea of what's going on and remember a little but from the intro Bio courses you should be set. Exams were extremely manageable.

Dr. Bullwinkle is a very sweet lady, but a very boring (and anxious) lecturer. I spent three-fourths of her lectures responding to emails on my computer and still did very well in the class. It was a joke. She reads directly off the slides with no incentive to come to class. I don't understand why I didn't stop attending lecture sooner.
Lectures were really boring. She was unclear and repetative

Dr. Bullwinkle made great PowerPoints but struggled presenting them. Would change from topic to topic mid-slide and wasn't always super explanatory. If you take the time to use the slides after lecture alongside the book to help explain the topics then you will definitely be fine. Some test questions are in the online notecard system which is nice.

Alright, so I had Dr. Bullwinkle for the first half of this semester, and  at the time, I didn't think she was that great. I thought she was boring and could be better. However, everything changed when Dr. Hopper came. I take back the bad things I said about her. Hopper is SO awful and makes her look like a great saint. Really, appreciate her.

I personally enjoyed Dr. Bullwinkle. Her midterm questions are more application based, so you actually need to know understand concepts. She is very willing to help in office hours and is very personable.

She is a terrible lecturer and always says "um" while she's taking which makes her seem unknowledgeable of what she is talking about. She also tries to assign seats and do  group activities in a 400 person lecture which never works. She basically just reads off of slides and still doesn't make sense. Only went to class to get participation points

Just took the first midterm and got a B. It was very easy. Only reason I did not get an A was because I only studied the night before the exam. I did not use the book. MOSTLY everything that is on the exam was said in lecture so write everything down Lots of points outside of the 3 exams so even failing midterms will allow you to pass the class
Lectures make you want to cry because they are so boring. She reads straight off the slides and somehow manages to still say stupid things that are completely obvious.

Dr. L is an excellent professor. I've had her for EEOB 2510, 4550, and 4520. She's clear with expectations, always available outside class, and genuinely wants students to succeed. The work and class can be challenging due to the content, but if you put in the effort, you'll definitely do well. I highly recommend taking any of her classes!

Best lectures!!! She's very sweet and friendly, and really does care about her students. She is accessible outside of class and so so helpful. She wants you to succeed. I cannot say enough good enough things about this professor, I cannot wait to take one of her classes again. If you put in the effort in this class you will succeed.
I love her! So nice. Good for quick learner who gets bored easily. Labs tough.

expect intensive lectures which are very interesting! she is a funny person and informative professor; the animals we learn about are really cool to understand; while the material is a little hard, if you engage with the lectures outside of class, the exams are not terrible. there are reading quizzes on articles each week, outlined on syllabus!
She is amazing. Take her if you get the opportunity. Her classes aren't that hard either, I have had her like 5 times and got an A each time!

Erin is an amazing professor! She is so kind and caring to her students, and you can tell she really wants you to succeed in her classes. I also had her teach my lab section of EEOB 3520, and she was just as amazing. The class content is difficult, and sometimes she can stray off topic in lecture. The exams are difficult, but homework is easy.
She's alright. Doesn't answer emails and can be pretty unclear during lectures. Good at answering questions at least!

She has the energy of a golden retriever (very nice and caring but SO MUCH energy). Her lectures are hard to follow, mostly because she talks really quick and starts sentences over multiple times. She genuinely cares for her students and will make time to talk about the material and grades. Exams are very hard - not enough time and math heavy.

Dr. Lindstedt is very passionate about what she teaches! She also is open/flexible to let students come to office hours/receive help with post-grad plans. The only thing negative I have is her exams are extremely difficult compared to lectures/book. They are extended response/math heavy and she doesn't give enough time for the amount of questions.
One of the best professors at Ohio State. Would highly recommend taking her classes.
Great lecturer! Can tell she really is passionate about the material!
Nice but that doesn't make up for the fact that she didn't explain the material well.

Erin is so adorable! She really wants her students to do well, and tries to get to know you if you attend regular office hours. She is a pretty fair teacher, and, as long as you do your work, you should do well!
This class was pretty easy, if you pay attention you should have no problem getting at least a B. She lets class out early pretty often. Also, she's a smokeshow, so I highly recommend this class.

She is by far the best profesor in the EEOB department. Her class was clear and easy to follow. She knows what she is talking about and is so approachable. If you hare having any troubles with the class I wouldn't hesitate to go up to her and ask for help. Nicest person ever and a true teacher that cares about her students.

LOVE LOVE LOVE ERIN! TAKE ANY CLASS SHE TEACHES, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. She is so nice and helpful and made an hour and 20 minute class seem to be 30 minutes long. She's so passionate about teaching and is very approachable, almost like you're talking to a friend. I wish I would have taken more classes with her. (not to mention shes a fair tester)

She loves what she does and it makes it so much easier to learn. Random participation points are given in class so attendance is pretty much mandatory, but they are super easy. Would take another one of her classes in a heartbeat

You will never have a professor as excited about teaching as Lindstedt. She makes class upbeat with her bubbly personality. Organismal Diversity is a fun class. Mostly dissections and keeping of notebooks. Pay attention to notebook feedback and you'll do fine!

She's a pretty good professor and gives you a lot of study materials for the midterm. There's only one midterm and a non-cumulative final. She is SUPER heavy on tophat questions so you need to go to class, but otherwise the class is easy points. I will say her voice is honestly a bit irritating because she talks to us like kindergarteners.

There was one midterm and one noncumulative final. There was a weekly review due every week, along with four lecture quizzes taken throughout the semester. Dr. Calinger responds fast to her emails and is very kind. Top hat is used in class (half for participation/half for correctness), and labs were mainly about working on a semester-long project.

She really cared about making sure everyone in the lecture understood materials and was getting caught up. She was funny and easily approcable and was more then willing to help with a emphasis on being objective throughout. This class has a lot of top hat questions though but she gives you more than enough if you need to miss a few classes.
Attendance wasn't mandatory but she did tophat questions that were worth points. She also posted all lecture videos. She was great overall.

Attendance is mandatory BUT if you email her and ask for a zoom link to her lecture she will send it no questions asked and there is no limit. tophats are graded for correctness BUT incorrectness is half credit. And you can get like 40 wrong and still have a 100%. Labs are fun and engaging. Lectures are fin and engaging. My favorite professor here.
It was pretty interesting; she taught a lecture with tophats (heavily curved), and we would have weekly quizzes, then a midterm and final.

Dr Calinger Yoak is probably the best professor I ever had. Her lectures are so stimulating and she cares so much about diversity which I love. She breaks down every concept into manageable parts and is passionate about supporting her students. Take this class with her!

Take her class! An amazing professor, she is very organized and thorough with her lectures. She cares way more about her students and their understanding of the material than your knowledge about science. She uses Tophat, but allows you to collaborate with your peers and only uses some points for correction. Only one midterm and one final.

Attendance is required (tophats graded on correctness), although you can have a couple misses without any penalty. A lot of annoying (but easy) busy work. Lecture is very boring.
The lab is set up horribly you have a very drawn out and annoying group project, you only ever do like 3 actual lab activities, the rest are the group project.

Attendance is required with TopHat questions in every lecture. Dr. C is very passionate about what she's doing. Her lecture is great and interactive. However, there are hw every week which a bit time-consuming. Her midterm is not too hard but super fast-paced with lots of calculations. Make sure you really know the materials.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is a great professor. Attendance is mandatory for lectures, but she gives a break in the middle of lecture so it isn't 80 minutes of straight yapping. TopHat is also used during class, graded on correctness, she uses it to make sure students understand the concepts & as a chance to clear things up. Very understanding professor!

Kellens teaching style would be great but it just goes super slowly and she teaches very repetitively. Attendance is important because tophat is graded for accuracy. Lab sections is mostly busy work but expect to be there most of the period as it is a lot. Includes terribly designed but fairly easy group project for lab
Good teacher and class

Dr. Calinger-Yoak was an amazing lecturer and I really enjoyed her class. Her tests aren't super difficult, consisted very much of studying what she teaches in lectures on her powerpoints and that's it. The final wasn't cumulative and there was only one midterm. Overall great class and I highly recommend her.

Dr. C is such a caring and engaging professor! I loved her lectures because she goes right to the point and will give you a reason to listen, along with the fact she's very passionate about the subject. Although the content is easy, it is very interesting and I learned a lot about our world and the current natural issues we're facing.
Very caring professor, easy class

She is an incredibly caring professor who places lots of emphasis on mental health and diversity in STEM. Very accommodating. The course content is incredibly easy (especially compared to BIO 1113) so class is a bore. Lab is a bore too. Those things can't be helped tbh.

Got a 91 on the first exam and a 92 on the second exam w/o listening much in class. Look over the lecture slides to study for the exams. She is a caring person and the amount of importance she places on mental health and diversity in STEM is great. She has questions like "two of the above", and "more than one", very often in her exams, however.

she wants you to succeed. her tests are all based on her notes which are super clear. she is very accommodating with an amazing point system. i'd want her to write my letter of recommendation. one of my favorite professors here.

Dr. C is super sweet and it's clear she cares about her students. Be prepared to be taught as if you are a newborn baby. Lecture isn't "mandatory" but there will always be TopHats or ICA's every day so if you start to skip a lot, your grade will suffer. Two weekly homework assignments and only one midterm. Final is noncumulative. Lab sucks/boring.
her class is easy and she explains everything in detail but she is really annoying

Dr.C is very sweet and is willing to help if you ask her to. However she is a very harsh grader, especially if she is your lab TA, so make sure to go to her office hours to make sure your work is to her liking. Additionally, put effort into your artwork. She will dock points if your pictures do not look like you poured your heart and soul into it.

She genuinely cares about you as a human being and understands if you are having a hard time. She puts a lot of emphasis on mental health awareness and diversity within the science community and she puts in so much effort to connect to her students. She also gives amazing book recommendations :)

One of the best professors I've had at this university. If you have the option to take the course with her, DO IT. While attendance is not mandatory, it is recommended you go to lectures, however, if you have an interference she is flexible and may provide a zoom link. Very engaging!

Super easy course but I agree with the review saying if you are impatient do not take this course. Feels like a sixth grade biology course which is fine for an easy A but professor needs to learn to talk to her students like adults not children.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She genuinely cares about her students and what she is teaching. You MUST go to lecture in order to succeed in this class. If you do all of the assignments and actually try your best, you will get a good grade.

Pay attention in lecture, make notes during case studies, and try to get all tophat Qs right and understand why and you will get an A. I never even looked at the textbook because she gives you all the info you need. Just study the learning objectives/review your notes after class (I made a summary study guide). She is super understanding!
i love her
She's a great teacher, but the material can sometimes be daunting. Labs don't correlate with the current material at all.

Learned a lot! The class is lecture heavy and she uses tophat. The course was made up of 4 real life science reading assignments, 4 lecture quizzes, a midterm, and final. This class had a lab component so there was weekly lab assignments. She offered zoom office hours twice a week and was willing to answer any questions after lecture. Loved her!

I took Dr. C's BIO1114 course in the spring of 2021 and I absolutely LOVED her course. She does everything in her power to make the course flexible and manageable - synchronous lectures not mandatory, bonus points, in lecture TopHat questions due way after lecture period, etc. Dr. C clearly cares about her students understanding the material!

I found her class very easy. She explains things extremely well, she sometimes explains things as we are in 3rd grade though. Her exams can be tricky for some due to every question being a paragraph long but just read them carefully and don't get tricked up by some of the obvious looking answers.

Dr. C explains things very clearly in lecture and you do not need to read to do well on exams. Go over key concepts and you should be fine. She creates the homework assignments which are relatively easy and tailored for what we learned in class. I got a 97 on the first exam with very little studying. I can't recommend her enough!!

She's clearly very passionate about biology and her students. Her class is set up very well, so I didn't have to study for exams much at all and still got A's on them. The exams aren't really difficult, but definitely more application than high school! Material and study resources are very accessible and helpful. Solid professor.

I took Biology 1114 during the summer and Dr. C is possibly one of the best professors I think I'll ever have at OSU. She made lectures easy to comprehend and she was very kind and understanding. 10/10 recommend taking this class with her.
Dr. C was AMAZING! She explained everything super clearly and made biology super fun! Everyone in her class (even though it was online) felt like a community and we openly joked with other students!
Super nice and knowledgable about class material, long labs with a lot of group work.

Dr. C explains concepts in very digestible ways--I often found myself putting lectures on 1.5x or 2x because she would spend so much time explaining. Dr. C also makes the criteria very clear as to what is needed to get an A. For a STEM professor, I feel that she is actually very good at teaching everything in an easy-to-understand way.

I learned a lot from the class but this did not translate to exams as exams were much harder than any in class questions. She talks to you like you are in elementary school, but I do not think she means it in a belittling manner. Also she uses proctorio for all exams while other sections of this course do not.

Prof. C made lectures very understandable with a slow teaching pace. Her tests were a little difficult, but she provides the necessary materials to be prepared for them. The assignments were fairly easy and, even as a summer course, were manageable.

a lot of people dislike dr. c, but she truly wants you to learn. none of her tests are focused on the regurgitation of material, but she prepares you well if you go to lecture & pay attention. lots of tophat & case studies shes young & clearly cares about topics at hand grade is heavily dependent on your lab TAsimple labs, but super nit-picky

Kellen is by far my favorite. She is so caring and sweet, and she does everything she can to help you succeed. Don't get me wrong, you need to know what you're doing since she's a hard grader. The tests can be tricky as well. But if you put in the work and come to class, odds are you'll be okay. Definitely recommend her!

Lectures are very interactive - make sure you go to get TopHat participation points. Labs are unnecessarily difficult for the class material. Lectures prepare you well for the exams, which require critical thinking and that you really understand material. Exams are more based on application of information rather than just memorization

Dr. C is a good professor, not a great one. I think she has a thing against giving. 100's, and loves to waste time on TopHat. Despite this, I did learn a lot and had some fun. She is also very nice as she rounded my grade up from 92.8% to an A. Oh, exams are extremely wordy as well. Make sure to understand the concept, not just the definition.

Dr. C is classic proof that you can't judge a professor by ratings. I LOVED Dr. C! Her lectures are interactive with TopHat questions just like the midterm! If you study, you will get an A, even without the book! Plus, she is available outside of class if you have questions. Her midterm averages ended up being higher than even the "easy" professors

If you are impatient, it will be hard to sit through lectures as it feels like a elementary or middle school pacing. She brings opinion into class discussion and is very open to questioning. Exam questions need to be thought through as there are a lot of all/none/two of the above and very similar wording in the same question. Know your concepts

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is amazing. You do need to attend lecture because of Top-Hat questions to get your participation points. She's very passionate about what she is teaching. The exams aren't too bad, make a quizlet with the study guide she gives you and you'll do fine. The labs are actually pretty fun and very helpful to understanding the lecture.

Really nice lecturer that cares about her students. The majority of the tests are from her lecture notes, which she posts online. As long as you pay attention, you will already have a good grasp of the material. She does in class activities and tophat during lecture, so just showing up to class gets easy points. Overall, great prof.

Makes an easy class difficult. I'm not joking, the material for BIO1114 isn't difficult at all, but for some reason this professor feels the need to overcomplicate things. Extensive amount of participation in lecture, so much HW from lab, exam questions are worded weirdly. Please do yourself a favor and take a different professor! Can be nice.

If you must take this class with her, take it seriously. Between your expectation that it will be easy, and the subjective grading present, it will rip you to shreds if you don't work hard and buddy up with your TA. For all the unnecessary difficulty, the way she teaches (and tests) is actually very applicable to MCAT passage-based questions.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is a great professor in my opinion, even though the class is incredibly and unnecessarily difficult. She gives you a baseline of information with examples that are easy to relate to. Her exams are very difficult, but if the effort is put in it is definitely possible to do well.

Her lack of rubrics is concerning. This intro bio course essentially became a weedout class due to arbitrary grading and lack of clarity in what was expected. Avoid this class like antibiotic resistant bacteria.

Do not take this class or with she unless you 100% have to. Her grading is terrible and she expects you to have the exact answers she is looking for or its wrong. Her quizzes and tophat questions are super specific and do not actually test your knowledge. Never got out of lab early. Do not miss a lecture or you're screwed with tophat points.

The grading in this class is horrendous. The content is pretty simplistic (easier than Bio 1113) but because of how this course is arbitrarily graded, you could still do poorly. I had Calinger as my my lab TA too (which I thought would be great) but ended up screwing me over because of how harshly she grades. This was the case w/other TAs as well.

I was disappointed with Dr. Calinger. She was an incredibly nice and caring professor, however her exams are incredibly difficult, and sometimes she had difficulty clearly communicating the information. She is very smart, and speaks to us as if we are as smart as her. Prepare to read MANY graphs in this class, because she loves them.

Everyone says the exams are worded very poorly/ areconfusing, and they were right. I thought I would be fine, but I am not. The lectures are very simplified, but the exams are worded in the most confusing way possible. The lab TAs destroy you with very strict grading, so it is easy to do poorly. Take Dr. Chiucchi instead. I wish I did

This is the worst class I have ever taken. As a microbiology major this should be an easy A but this is not the case with Dr. Calinger. She grades arbitrarily and not by a rubric. When you ask for help she will help you but wont tell you if you're wrong and will give you zeros on everything. Take this class with another professor if you can.

Compared to 1113 lecture is way easier but it is dreadful and boring. I cannot stress this enough that your entire grade depends on who your TA is and how subjective they are. It is unfortunate that OSU still allows this type of unequal grading within lectures. If you get a bad read on your TA drop or transfer lab sections.

I was really disappointed by this class. Dr. Calinger's rating on this website is really high so I was expecting the class to be really interesting and for her to be a stellar teacher. You just have to memorize and understand all the lecture notes, but even with that the exam questions are VERY poorly worded. Overall disappointed by the prof.

I really liked Dr. Calinger, but this was the WORST class I've ever taken. The lab had NOTHING to do with the lecture and the TAs take off points for the stupidest stuff. Plus, Dr. Calinger was on maternity leave for 6 weeks and I wish we had her for the whole semester.

She is very passionate about ecology and know a lot about the subject so don't be afraid to ask questions in lecture! She always knows the answer. You don't need the book because she puts all of her notes online after the lecture is over. Go to class because of all the topHat, and she explains a lot of graphs from scientific articles

I loved this course! She did a great job communicating material- one of the best professors I've had. Her tests are heavily based on application of concepts, but if you understand her examples in class you should do fine on the midterms. TopHat questions in lecture are graded for correctness and completion, but aren't too hard to get correct.

Dr. Calinger does an excellent job of engaging her students during lecture. She gives many chances to earn participation points and more points if you come to lecture and participate. Her tests aren't necessarily easy, but if you come to lecture and study her lecture note thoroughly it helps with the exam. You don't need a textbook for this course.

This professor may have been great in the past but that's no longer the case here. First, her rubrics for the spice lab are inaccurate. Our entire class received half credit since we didn't apparently follow the rubric yet, everyone did and she saw nothing wrong with this. She also doesn't have a rubric for short answers and exams are way tough.

Dr. Calinger is an incredible teacher who really takes interest in her students and their success. She knew just about everyone's name in the lecture a few weeks in to classes. She makes lectures interesting with a lot of real life examples with a lot of in class activates so you need to go to class which isn't hard since she's so attractive 10/10

She is amazing, one of the best professors I've had. If you go to class and pay attention and participate she makes it seem easy. Tests are noncumulative and she really doesn't try to trick you. Don't bother buying the textbook though.
She's a great lecturer and very helpful.  Class is essentially mandatory and you're gonna have to pay attention and participate for the entire class.  Doable, but not an easy A.

You don't need the book, just go to class to learn the material and understand the concepts. Her notes are posted online as well but i would take notes in class. Tests are based off of the notes. All of her tests are fair and weren't cumulative. top hat and class activities help with understanding. Best professor ever

Her lectures are interesting in my opinion. You don't need the book at all, but with that being said you have to go to class to learn the material and understand the concepts. Tests are based off of her notes and verbal explanations. All of her tests are fair and weren't cumulative. She uses tophat & does in class activities for participation pts.
For some reason he kept teaching me how to light fires and go fishing. He's very good at captaining a canoe. Also a DILF.
Horrible. Didn't even take the class and still know he's a bad professor. help
He was very dry and I often found myself not paying attention. I definitely had to teach myself the material. Tophat questions during class.

His lectures were dry, often unorganized, and delivered in a mumbling monotone making it difficult to follow along. You will probably have to teach yourself at times because his explanations could be confusing. I recommend getting help from TA's and watching videos on the harder topics to study for the midterms.

Dr. Mackey's lectures consist of mumbling, spending 20 min on a slide yet not getting his point across, no explaination on missed tophat questions, and rushing through a chapter when it came time to take the midterm. His constant degrading and montone voice made the class unbearable. I only went to class for the tophat and because he's a DILF.

His lack of empathy for students seemed to go hand in hand with his egotistical attitude throughout the second half of the semester. Although Dr. Mackey was clearly very knowledgeable on the subject, the difficult course content was only made harder by his monotone, boring, and sometimes degrading lectures.

Dr. Mackey was obviously very knowledgable about the topics, but he did a poor job teaching. He would spend the first 25 mins of class reviewing the same concepts from previous lectures and rush through a chapter of new material before exams. His lecture slides were also way more dense than Dr. Ball's. I pretty much taught myself with the textbook.

Speaks quickly, quietly, and mumbles through the entire lecture, making him impossible to learn from. Does not care an iota about the academic progress of his students. I would get more information from the textbook and slides than I ever would listening to him rush through class. I only attended because of the TopHat questions. Avoid if you can.

They'll tell you that these ratings don't actually reflect him, but they do. He loads up his lecture slides and blows through them faster than you can take notes. He reads off the slides and his voice is so boring I genuinely start nodding off. If you can avoid him, pls do.

Dr. Mackey's lectures were dry so it was hard to pay attention. His exam was about the same as Dr. Ball's but the info is more complex which is why some people study. Try to pay attention to his explanations in lecture and take notes and you'll do well. Review the tophat Qs and mastering HW before exams and I made study guides reviewing the slides.

Not a good lecturer - only reason for going to lectures is TopHat points. Not helpful at all. When the class average was low on the midterm, his advice was to "Do better", and gave us no resources to do so. Inevitably, the average for the final was failing. Had to teach myself everything when he was my professor.

Very boring lectures, he co-taught with Sarah Ball and his exams were MUCH harder and longer. His office hours were held on west campus, probably to keep people from going, and that was the only way I could learn anything because his lectures were so hard to pay attention to. Class average on the final was a 62%, and there was no curve.
He wasn't great. Tests hard lectures boring, long, and frankly stupid. It's all copy pasted from book. Recitation didn't help.

Dr. Mackey was a very dry lecturer. I literally could NOT pay attention during his lectures because it was painfully boring. I only had him for the 2nd half of the semester because he co-taught, BUT his exam was way too long and more challenging than the first 2 exams from the first professor. Do NOT take him, you will hate yourself like i do.
Put in the work and you'll do well. Very fair.

I thought Mackey was fantastic. The way he taught was really clear. I got a A's on all of his exams without studying that much. His exams were a little tricky, but if you take your time and think it through you will do fine!

You can't rely on his lecture slides alone for exam. In order to get an A on an exam you have to study hard and long and understand the concepts well! His tests aren't that bad they just feel tricky. His lectures are sort of boring and hard to focus  but go because you need to hear the basics. It helps with studying on your own.

David Mackey was a subpar instructor. He was incapable of lecturing well and worded his questions extremely unclearly. Mackey should not be teaching a 700 person class in Independence. Class was boring and generally useless. While I got a good grade in his class, it was because I read the book and spent extremely long amounts of time studying.
His quizzes and exams were really hard and classes are boring. For a gen ed course this was pretty tough. Especially for a bio class.

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. My full review is too long to post so i'll save you time and tell you to just avoid her at all costs. I thought the reviews would be dramatic and it'd be fine, IT'S NOT FINE. Save urself and don't take it with her.

Lots of busy work. Flipped classroom style of teaching. Midterm is one of those “choose the best answer” types and you're not allowed to go back and change your answer once you've passed a question. Grades harsh and takes off points for a lot of things it's as if the goal was to make sure you don't get 100%.

Her module is a flipped classroom, basically a hybrid format. However, be prepared to learn the lecture videos on your own bc she won't go over them in class. She likes to spend the whole class period explaining the HW assignment instead of going over the lectures. A LOT of papers that irrelevant to the exam. Take it with another prof if you can.

Gives hours worth of work outside of class and then ramble in lecture about nothing related to material. Spends 20min going over material and 60 min rambling about "explaining" the concepts. We are in college and are able to read and follow directions. Only cares about her ants. EX: had no idea we were in the National Championship this past week.
She is the worst. So annoying. A million assignments a week. Thinks her class is the only class anyone could possibly be taking during the semester.

This professor is amazing. She is super nice and understanding. There was a lot of work to be completed in this professors class, but it is not for a lot of points and if you finish the assignments assigned through out the course, you are likely to get a good grade.

Dr. Adams is very passionate about ants. The class itself seemed disorganized at times and this was especially true for the carmen canvas page. It was sometimes hard to find assignments or see when things were due.This class wasn't so difficult, but more just a lot of work and preparation. It would definitely be more appealing to entomology majors.

This was the worst GE I have ever taken. I signed up because of the name, but I don't think anyone knew that this class was about ants. Unless you are an entomology major or have an interest in insects/ants, you won't enjoy this class. She wasn't helpful at all, her instructions were never clear and she was super condescending. Avoid this class!!

In the most respectful way, I would never take this Professor again. For a GE this class was extremely strenuous and demanding. I feel as though there were a few moment of unfairness most of them being the instructor saying one thing then doing another. Save your time and energy, pick a different GE that meets the requirement.

Class was advertised as biodiversity but was entirely about ants. The professor was disorganized and condescending, often patronizing students about tech she couldn't even use herself. Deserted projects were due abruptly during finals week. As a pre-med, time wasted. By mid-semester, students were disengaged. Avoid if you value your sanity.
So disorganized, gives 8 credit hours worth of work for a 4 credit hour class. Do not take EEOB 2260
Worst and most unorganized class I've ever taken.
Terribly unorganized, expects you to an ungodly amount of work for a GE. Do not take EEOB2260 is it the worst class I've ever taken.

Makes a GE class, then proceeds to grade projects expecting high level work. Grades very strictly, class is unengaging and mundane. Most unorganized professor I've ever had the displeasure of taken the class of.

Do not take EEOB2260 unless you are an entomology major with previous experience.

Dr. Adams seemed disorganized and this class made me question the relevance to my major (Biology). She lectures on ants for 8 weeks but it is a flipped classroom so you don't really learn anything and lectures were hard to bear. Midterm was extremely hard and you couldn't check your answers.

Bio3401 made me wish I dropped my bio major and ran for the hills to any other major. The class has almost nothing to do with biology and is just a series of writing assignments that take a lot of work and have unclear expectations. Dr. Adam's exam was super confusing and the TA's grade so hard you'd think they got fired for handing out 100s.

If you have the option, avoid taking her. Not organized & you have some sort of writing assignment due every week. Flipped classroom for lectures. She BARELY goes over lecture material in class,so you are not getting set up for the exam, it's awful. "Best answer" and you can't go back to change your answer after you submit next on a question.

Great professor, excited to engage with students and participation. Material isn't too hard, flipped classroom but only attend one day a week. Recorded lectures were very precise with information you needed.

She's a very nice person but the way the class was set up was so overwhelming. Too much busy work and TA's and graders were really tough on assignments that really should have been easy points. Expectations for assignments aren't spelled out clearly too. Lectures are hard to pay attention to, partially due to them being an hour and 20 minutes.

This class is very boring and, for the most part, useless. However, Dr. Adams did a good job at making the material somewhat interesting. I am giving her such a high rating because her section of the class was extremely easy. You don't even have to show up to lecture (just watch the videos she posts online) and keep up with the busywork assignments

Dr. Adams is an amazing and well-respected researcher who really cares about her students in Biology 3401. She was in tune with students and adapted where necessary. There was a lot of material communicated in confusing ways in long out-of-class lecture videos and her exam is very tough. Understand everything thoroughly. Lots of small assignments.

This course was easily one of the worst courses I have taken as a graduating senior. The layout of her module was unorganized and there were too many unrelated assignments to focus on actual class material. The flipped class format does not work. The exam was all "what is the MOST correct" questions. I would literally take anyone else.

If you can avoid having Dr. Adams do it. Her lectures were all over the place and the organization was all over the place. We had too many pointless group assignments and papers that didn't really pertain to the class. While I think Dr. Adams is a really nice person, the structure of her class was god awful. Stressful for no reason.

Dr. Adams' lectures were some of the most disorganized I've ever seen. Her slides followed no logical order and she basically read directly off of them. There are also multiple papers that do not have anything to do with "integrated biology," which is what the class is supposed to be about. If you can avoid it, do NOT take this class with her.

The professor is nice but her slides are disorganized. Lots of slides are posted per lecture (upto 90) and are difficult to navigate through as the topics are not organized properly. The class also has a lot of papers to do & presentations. The paper topics are often irrelevant to the real world application. Be prepared to get bored & frustated.

Only taught half of the semester, so having her wasn't terrible. Lecture slides are terribly unorganized and confusing, so it's your job to sort through the info. Despite that, her test wasn't too hard. Fair warning, this class has a lot of recitation/in-class assignments, which you don't want to slack off on!

She's nice but her lecture slides are awful and very unorganized. She'll post 100+ slides but only go through 40-50 of them. Her in class assignments are pretty easy but her exam was pretty confusing and it dropped my grade by a lot. Not the worst, but definitely not the best.

Dr. Sarah Rose is the worst TA I've ever had. These other reviews are completely spot on. She is the toughest grader I have ever seen, and it seems like she takes off points for no reason. She is the toughest grader I have ever had, and she also takes weeks to grade assignments. Take anyone else.
Worst TA ever had, find someone else in SchedulePlanner

I took her at CSCC, not OSU, but I can't find her for CSCC.

I wanted to be charitable to her because I did like her, but she sent a dispute over me having a meltdown after intentionally antagonizing me (I'm autistic, FYI) and now I can't start my classes on time. She had ample time to tell me this but she didn't. She wasn't even mad at me. Insane.
Actually the worst TA I've ever had in my life

The other ratings here are not dramatic or exaggerated whatsoever. She is very condescending and rude towards her students to the point that it is cruel. The lecture portion of this class is incredible but the recitation… specifically HER recitation sections… worst experience I've ever had. She is the SOLE reason I do not have an A in this class.
She was the harshest grader the first half of semester. Once Donald Trump was elected she became much more enjoyable. It seems there is a positive correlation between his election and her happiness.

Avoid any class with this teacher, the work that she makes you do in recitation is tougher than the course itself. It's tougher than an ochem lab. Any example that you will try to use she turns down immediately.
She is the only thing wrong with this integrated biology class. Grades harder than anyone I ever met.

I haven't met a single person who had anything good to say about this TA. I hope she sees all these bad reviews and decides to change herself, because never in my life have I had a "teacher" (I put teacher in quotes bc she doesn't teach) this bad. I genuinely think she's heartless the way she's tanking everyone's grades...

She is exactly who Steve Chordas talked down upon. He said he hated how scientists are so brutal when peer reviewing articles and she grades every assignment like you are submitting a paper to the world.
