He does in class TopHat questions that seem tedious, but theyre super helpful for review. I recommend reading the book sections before and after lectures. Easy A if you put in the work.

Danhart is a solid professor who cares about his students' success. His exams are incredibly straightforward and although you have to put in work, you can be successful as long as you thoroughly study his lecture notes. Lots of opportunities for points besides exams. Great at responding to emails and meeting outside of class to offer help.

Lectures have TopHat questions throughout for credit. It's not hard to do well. No homework except online prelectures and no textbook use. He taught the first half of the class but it was definitely the better half. Very clear in his lectures, fair on exams, helpful with questions. Genuinely cares about his students. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Danhart is a nice guy, but his class was not set up in a great way. Pre-lecture assignments were not helpful at all when preparing for lectures or midterms. His exams proved to be very difficult, even after going through all of the material. His powerpoints and lecture recordings are online, but in-class activity points and TopHat do matter!

Pre-lecture assignments over readings before every lecture. In-class activities every day for attendance. Very nice guy but lectures were confusing and easy to lose focus. A lot of outside reading necessary to understand the material, and you pretty much have to teach yourself. However, tests not weighted super heavy, therefor room for error!

Super nice guy and professor, cares about your grade and wants you to learn (definitely isnt a I teach for an hour so I can pay for my research kind of guy). The textbook is nice but not necessary to get an A. His slides are an amazing study tool, though they can be a little unclear at times. Responds to emails quickly and very willing to help.
Dr. Danhart really cares about his students. He gives numerous other point opportunities to better your grade if you're not a good exam taker. Overall, just go to class and you will do fine.

I took Biochem 5621 with Danhart. Although I struggled through the class, he made it worthwhile. His lectures are comprehensive and he cares about his students. If i had any other professor for this class, I would've given up immediately.

Professor Danhart was such a great professor. He likes using Tophat and in-class activities to help with your grade and also to see who does attend, but attendance isn't a mandatory thing. Just a fair warning if you skip this class, you will have a tough time passing exams because he makes his exams a little tougher in order to test your knowledge.

He likes to use in class activities and Tophat questions. (the attendance is the questions not actual attendance). The activities worked better than I though they would for a lecture size of 500. He is a solid choice for introductory biology. You have to work for an A but a C should be achievable with minimal work.

Danhart wasn't a bad professor and his exams weren't terribly difficult. If you took AP Bio in high school, this class will be a breeze. Going over lecture slides and in-class TopHat questions will be your most sure-fire way to pass, and honestly his lectures mainly consisted of him reading the PowerPoint slides so attendance isn't that important.
Loved his class!
Tough class, but not too bad if you keep up with homework and stuff. Exams are tough, but there are lots of other points in the class to help your grade.

Engaging lectures, even though it was at 8am. As long as you go to class and pay attention, and keep up with the material, you will do well. Nice guy and always willing to help out in person or by email.

Danhart made exams unreasonably difficult and if you question anything he will respond with attitude or Im unsure. Although you have to read each chapter to be prepared for all exams, he demands you attend his boring lectures that cover NO material needed for exams so you can do a five point class activity.
She doesn't post any notes online, expects us to review every bit of content including useless videos for tests, and does a terrible job explaining concepts. Would never take here again.

Professor Booton is passionate about the material but his lectures can be fast-paced. Practice exams are crucial, and using tools like Unstuck ai alongside the textbook helps cement the concepts. With effort, you can do well in this challenging but rewarding class.

Dr. Booton was really great. I took his course over the summer over 8 weeks, so it was really lecture heavy, but it was not unreasonable. Dr. Booton explains tings really well, just make sure to come to lecture consistently.

Not much work outside of keeping up your lab notebook and lab reports. Exam was easy enough, though there wasn't any practice to prepare for it other than him verbally giving some practice problems in class. A lot of waiting around for the experiment to run though so it could be fairly boring

The worst teacher I have ever had in my 16 years of education. Lecture chapters > 350 slides and completely disorganized. Clusters of mass information are projected and exams are given every two weeks. I taught myself the entirety of the semester. With a 89.4, Dr. Booton would not round my grade. No curve even though he states it in the syllabus.

His lectures are very heavy for example the first module was over 700 pages. He gives you practice exams for the actual exam. Here is my problem he tells you to generate 6-9 of those practice exams. Which I did and still on the actual exam all the extended response weren't on the practice exam. Just be prepared to be disappointed.

Dr. B provides the materials you need to succeed, all you have to do is use them. Go to his office hours, get to know him, and take all of the practice exams. If you do good on the module exams, the final won't be stressful. He also provides a lot of in-class points so make sure to attend even if it isn't required.

Practice exams will definitely help but exams are still pretty hard. I'd recommend taking his recitation 4500E as it's a grade booster and not that much extra work(and a good way to get to know him, he's a very nice guy). Lectures were kind of hard to pay attention and certain concepts I felt he explained fast/poorly. He tries to keep it engaging.

Dr. Booton is a highly engaging lecturer who truly understands the field of genetics and all it entails. His lectures, while they had a lot of slides, were interesting and highly applicable to today's world. Does assign a lot of homework and exams were difficult. Do the practice exams he provides - they are a great help in succeeding in his course.

Prof. Booton is a great guy and fun to talk to. However, his class is difficult with how he sets it up. Each module has about 4-5 lecture slideshows and each one is easily 100-150 slides. He lectures quickly and it is easy to get lost if you miss something. He gives you unlimited practice exams which is the only reason I am passing this class.

Dr. Booton is a decent professor and he taught the material well. My biggest issue with him is that his problem sets fell out of sync with the lectures so we couldn't usually even begin the weekly homework until the night before it was due. Also, he uses TopHat so attendance becomes part of the grade.

Dr. Booton is very knowledgeable and willing to help. He provided plenty of practice materials to help students succeed and provided strong feedback on answers. I felt grading among his TAs was inconsistent in terms of points deducted across questions. Each lecture easily contains 80-100 slides with repetitive information.

So the first time I took MOLGEN4500 with Booton, I failed the class. When I passed, I sat in the front row. To study, I converted the practice exams to quizlets. Exam questions are pulled right from the practice quizzes. Booton also will get to know you if you sit up front and really likes student interaction. Also yes, his office hours are great!
he goes through slides so fast and does not explain them. he goes through 100 slides a day and the slides do not always make sense. i spend most of my time confused in his class

Im not sure why his scores are so low because I thought he was an average/good professor. He was really kind and incorporated funny things into the lectures. He does go fast, but its a STEM course after all. Tests are pretty fair and he offers to help often during class and office hours. His grading scale is different too which made it easier.

Super caring and patient professor. He has a lovely tone and is willing to re-explain slides in another way if you ask. Exams were tricky, but if you use the module self-evaluations you'll do fine. Gives a few weekly assignments per week so you can average a B/B+ on exams and still get an A in the class.
Very boring and repetitive lectures.

Synchronous lecture classes. Lots of assignments due before every new module. One project in the middle of the semester. Uses Tophat for attendance often but even if you missed a few lectures you get full credit. Pretty kind. Majority of exam q's straight off the practice exams so do those multiple times.

Dr. Booton taught the second half of my lecture which was pretty hard to adjust to after having a different prof for the first half. His lectures are very dense and it was less clear with him than with Dr. Picking what we needed to know for exams. Overall, he was a good professor and he is also a very interesting person.

If you ask questions there's a good chance he will find your question stupid. There are a few students he simps for but he always treated me like I was dumb. I guess you have to come to office hours for him to respect your learning efforts. He is very unhelpful and listening to his lectures can be incredibly discouraging.
His class is hard but he is a great teacher. Tests are fairly straightforward and easy

Dr. Booton is by far my favorite professor at Ohio State. Although the class was online this semester he still made every class enjoyable and is just a very kind person. He really wants to make sure you understand the topic and will make sure the class is on the same page before moving on. He was a great help and I really enjoyed him! So sweet

Its a hard class. You HAVE to study and keep up with lecture material. But honestly, if you do the practice quizzes AND review lecture material, the tests are fair. Dr. Booton is very caring. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. Going over the material with him helped me to get an A in the class. He wants students to succeed, you just have to put in the work.

You can really tell that Dr. Booton enjoys teaching and he really tries to keep it interesting for students. He is also always trying to help his students and he is accessible if you need help. This class was difficult when it came to exams, however. There is a lot of material covered in each lecture and tests are heavy on memorization.

I didn't really love Booton's lectures. Really dry and sometimes the in-class assignments were super challenging, same with the Tophat questions. The midterms were difficult but reasonable (you really have to study). I enjoyed the topics discussed but I wish he was more energetic. Gives opportunity to make up pre-lecture credit with study modules.

Honestly, with the COVID-19 pandemic going on, classes became easier because professors became more lenient with the situation. Booton however did not, and all he did to compensate for the pandemic was remove 1 exam from the 5 total which did not help us at all. The final was rigged for no one to finish in time and yet no curve was implemented.

During COVID19, this professor did NOTHING to help his students. Every other professor helped me out considerably while Booton only got rid of an exam (thus getting rid of 100 more points for the semester). The final was challenging and barely anyone finished all questions on time. Also, the avg was too high so there was no curve in the class.

Gives 4 exams before the final, one every two weeks. He flies through the material, maybe 100-130 slides per 55min class. He gives you practices exams (do them as many times as you can) on Carmen. He pulls test questions from the same test bank. I found the grading to be difficult, annoying at times. If you do the work you will be fine.

The class is interesting and Dr. Booton conveys the material clearly. He genuinely cares about student success. The lectures are fast, but he provides his power-point presentations as well as "self evaluations" (practice tests) which makes it easier to succeed in this class. There's ample opportunities outside of exams to boost your grade too.

This class was much more work than my 5 credit science class -- this class should either be less intensive or more credit hours. The slides are very outdated and formatted poorly, the exams include stuff that we never came close to learning, and you had to teach every single thing to yourself. He would get annoyed when students asked for help.

Take this professor!! I was skeptical at first, but he truly makes a positive impact on students. Interesting lectures, extremely knowledgeable guy, and by putting in the effort you'll do well. Highly recommend doing many self-evals & memorizing them/knowing main lecture concepts. Dr. Booton is probably my favorite OSU professor!

Lectures very fast paced. Only taught second half of semester, definitely harder half (but it was genetics). Clearly knows his stuff but moves very quickly at times (100 slides per lecture). Exams are fair and out-of-class work is minimal. Studying for your last exam will be tough, though. Final exam not cumulative. Tophat questions for credit.

A very passionate professor, but goes on and on about things that will not be tested. The testing style is super convoluted. He is smart but going to lecture was useless. Booton makes an already tough class unnecessarily more difficult.

He is a great professor and explain everything crystal clear. The lab is interesting and you need to understand materials to write papers. He gives good grades! And he is approachable and patient to students.

Online discussions are a component of class. I came from a small regional campus so a class of +200 was a big change. He explained the material well and made the content very interesting and relevant to modern day events.

Very disappointed in the class. I really like the topic of molecular genetics, but did not learn anything useful. Tests covered material not taught in class. Only way to do well is to memorize the questions from his self-evals, and the test bank is so big youll still get questions you dont know. Didnt learn anything.

Absolutely terrible prof. Spends 90% of lecture reading news articles and little time explaining basics that matter. When he does teach, talks too fast. Test is purely memorizing the test bank. Did not need to take this, but wanted to learn genetics. I was incredibly disappointed. I have not learned anything meaningful.
Basically just do the practice test questions until you get them all right.

Dr. Booton is brilliant; however, it almost seems that hes too smart to be teaching intro level bio. He flies through the material so quickly that you wont have time to take any notes. He also always says you should already know this even though its bio 1. His tests are also extremely specific & there are many application questions.

Booton is passionate about teaching and the content, but 4500 was prob my least favorite class I've taken. A LOT of material with specifics you need to know for the exams (which are every 3 weeks). Test banks make up most of the exams, but memorizing them isn't conducive to actually learning, which is unfortunate. There is a small curve at the end!

Despite being a native English speaker, Dr. Booton has the poorest communication skills I've seen. He spends very little time on material important to the class and more time discussing news. Test questions are worded so vaguely that many answers could be correct. He will only accept one or a few. What is taught doesn't match what is tested

Dr. Booton is passionate about what he teaches and lectures in an engaging way. A lot of what he discusses in genuinely interesting. Unfortunately, the exams are not set up in a way that encourages learning. Test questions are pulled from banks of questions that are saved in Carmen, some of which are based on material that is never discussed.

This class was the worst class I have taken in four years. Lectures are insanly long, tests are "based off of the practice exams" but then he pulls questions out of thin air and expects us to pull answers out of thin air. Class is a waste of time but yet you have to go for top hat. You learn nothing becasue all you do is memorize for the test.

Dr Booton is a really nice guy and gives interesting lectures. He so clearly knows the material and likes to incorporate what's currently going on in the field. It's really interesting to learn from such an intelligent guy. On top of this he is extremely guy, easily approachable, and helpful in all ways possible.
Difficult class, but very interesting. Clear explanations. Absolutely use the practice material before tests

Dr. Booton is a really nice guy who is clearly very passionate about his field!! The material was interesting, but unfortunately the structure of the exams was not conducive to actually learning it. To do well, you had to just memorize test banks of exam questions. There is a generous curve at the end even though he said there wouldn't be one.

I liked how he's really approachable and passionate about his field. The only thing I didn't like was how he teaches so much material at once. The only way to do well for me is to mindlessly memorize the self evaluations.  This class uses tophat and Mastering Genetics which are grade boosters.

The test bank makes this class relatively easy as long as you prepare well. But beyond that, the class is wonderful. Dr. Booton is a fantastic professor, one of my favorites. He is passionate about teaching and about his research. I recommend taking the honors 4500E along side it, very interesting and a grade booster for 4500!!!

This class would not be bad if Booton didn't test the way he does.  His tests aren't about learning the material or the concepts he hits on in class, they're about memorizing his test banks (i.e. self evaluations) this is the only way to do well in this class.

Molecular Genetics isn't my forte, but this class wasn't as terrible as I thought it would be. It also wasn't as easy as I was expecting in the areas I already knew either. Reading the book is highly recommended, and studying often is too.
Booton is great guy. He is very knowledgable in his field, however, he goes too fast and does not give you enough time to take notes. Read the slides and look at test banks to do well.

Prof. Booton clearly knows his stuff. Lectures are thorough and he constantly hints at what to expect on the test (usually meaning what might be an essay question). Tests were hard but he curves! DO SELF EVALUATIONS. They are exactly what is on the test, word for word. I don't see how people get a bad grade in this class.

TAs are very hard graders. For 2nd exam, I got an A.I put that EXACT same level of detail on the 4th exam and final and did much worse. My grade dropped from B+ to B- because of those 2 exams. GET TEST BANKS they're NOT the same as quizlets. Ask students who took it years ago and memorize all slides for each module. That's the only way to do well!

This was a very hard class. My advice is to aim to get near or exactly perfect on the homework, clicker points and on the assignment so that way you have some what of a nice cushion. His tests are not from lecture so try to memorize quizlets or find a test bank and memorize it. That is what I did and I ended up doing well in the class

This class was a great place to develop skills in managing a heavy information load and studying effectively.  Go to lecture and take notes on your laptop - many test questions can be answered straight from the ppt's.  Take as many self-evals as possible and LEARN the material - blind memorization is what makes questions seem "out of thin air."

Dr. Booton has a great enthusiasm in the class. However, this class was one of the worst I've taken. You barely learn anything because you have to memorize most of the material in order to at least do average on the exams (which I thought were really hard). Lecture is a waste of time and the exams questions felt like he pulled them out of nowhere.

This class was very difficult. There was so much to memorize. His exams would have almost half of the material that was not in the textbook or on the "self evals" or homework... You may find that you studied really hard and still are not prepared for the exams as some of the questions on the exam he  pulls out of thin air.

I'm guessing that Booton got sick of everyone passing because things are much different than before. There is no test bank. There's  homework, self-tests and review material. What's mostly covered by the test is covered nowhere in these.  Lectures are  nearly worthless except for the clicker points.

I don't understand all of the decent reviews for Dr. Booton. He is easily one of my least favorite professors. He is not helpful at all, I try to email him and ask him questions after class and he just stares at me. Also good luck studying because you'll study for 40 hours - get to the test - and realize that he pulls the questions out of thin air.

He is director of the department.. meaning he's not obligated to curve a certain way. Although his curve prior is said to be 2-3% usually. I finished with an 86% before the curve and received an A (93+). Google homework, attend all classes for clickers, and recognize what he thinks is important. His weakness is just that. 220 slides 40 areimportant

Memorize the test banks.  I found myself regurgitating information I didn't understand and did alright.  His "midterms" come ridiculously late in the season with one RIGHT before finals week.  He's interesting and likes teaching but gives WAY too much information and likes to pull questions out of thin air.

Out of all of the bio-related professors at OSU, Booton is by far my favorite. Exams can be hard & he does test on items he doesn't talk about in the book, but he lets you know that in the beginning. His lectures are interesting and he engages the class. It is a lot of studying but it is manageable.

Do not depend just upon online quizzes for questions. He will pull questions out of no where. Puts short answer questions about the random tangents he goes on, so be prepared. Never is interested in helping me learn, always short and uninterested. Read the chapter in the book, helps you at least recognize some of the terms that are not on slides.
He liked to talk about the weather.... I didn't like that.

Probably the most boring class ever. I had to take this class for my major but would never take it again. There's no reason studying the lecture notes b/c the exam questions are not from there. Go online and study/memorize the test bank that other people have made. That's the only way to get a good grade in this class.

Tests a lot from non-lecture material. Half of exams are from quiz-banks but other half comes from thin air. Tediously go over lecture slides for that A. Said he doesn't curve, but still got bumped to an A.
Super boring class. Do not waste your time studying lectures, just study the test bank and memorize it.

This professor is a horrible one  I have ever seen in my life. He is lecturing to him self not to people welling to know and understand the material . His slide are useless and very confusing. You can not follow his lecture with the slides you have because simply he does not post all the slides, so the slides you would have won t make any sense

Terrible professor. Seemed very uninterested in helping me and his lectures were boring and pointless. I learned nothing from his class. I had to teach myself the material because he did a poor job. Avoid this professor at all costs!

This class is harder than most say and there was NO BONUS offered. Exams test beyond test bank questions so be sure to understand the lecture material. Sometimes concepts not emphasized in class popped up as short answers on the exams. This class requires more work than what people say but you get out of it what you invest into it. Good luck!

I was really excited to take this class at first, but highly disappointed in the end. Attendence is mandatory (even if you are sick and have a drs excuse he will not give you pts) The book and slides are useless.  Online mastering genetics work is required. Exam every other week, Cum. final. The way to pass is find answers online. Horrible course.

class has 5 midterms, and a final. His lectures are pointless, he just reads his slides, but you have to go for clicker points. He gives a limited test bank, but no answers and 40 pts bonus. The class is manageable, but not highly recommended. The textbook isn't necessary as he mainly tests on lecture material, but you will need Mastering Genetics.

Super cool guy, great sense of humor. Find someone with an answer packet from previous exams and memorize every question - THEN try to read the slides. Lectures are pointless but mandatory for clicker points. I studied a lot for this class and managed an A. Some of the exam questions are not addressed in lecture. Not bad overall.

Dr. Booton is a great guy and very likeable and friendly. However, is lectures are a tad pointless and his exams cover trivial topics, even though he swears they cover the broad topics (they don't). Offers extra credit and lots of points for during homework and showing up to class. Not bad overall.

One of the best professors at OSU in my opinion. I learned a TON, and I come out with a new found love for genetics. You get out of this class, what you put in. His lectures are highly entertaining, and he has a great sense of humor. He also cares about students which is an added bonus!

Yes, this class is a joke, I learned nothing. His lectures are useless for the exams, and you have to go to get your attendance points. Yes, you can repeat the exams, but you have about 100 or more questions to find answers to and memorize within a week or 2. Clicker points are stupid, go to him if you think it's not working, he won't give them bac

want an easy A this is the class, i'm not going to complain because when you apply to grad/medical school they have no idea how easy it is, all they see is a 500 level class with an A, gpa helper. Yes, all you have to do is memorize the questions but you don't get the answers, so it helps to go to class and read the book to have the correct answers
As previously stated, this class is a joke and Dr. Booton does nothing to improve it.  One can easily get an A by memorizing the test answers since you are given the questions ahead of time.

Not really sure what class the people below me are from, but Dr. Booton was an awesome prof. He is extremely interested in the subject and helping people throughout the quarter. Of course there is a lot of info to know - it's a 500 level class. But he makes it EASY by letting people retake exams and even offering extra credit. If you can, take him!

Bad, bad prof. Its not so hard to get an A, but you are your own teacher for this course. It's so hard to imagine this prof has tenure. He only covers brief concepts that are tested. You need to treat the book as your professor, because Booton is useless. The TA was really rude as well (Monica Crary), a really nasty person.

I don't see how this is an "easy A" as some other people said.  WAY too much to memorize.  18 chapters covered in 10 weeks and he expects you to be able to regurgitate it all with a "module exam" every other week.  The only reason for going to lecture is for the free participation points from clicker questions

Conceptually intensive class.  He does not really "teach" and goes over important concepts for too quickly to really understand.  Students like myself without internet access at home and no way of utilizing the genetics learning center because of family obligations are at a HUGE disadvantage in this class.  Extremely disappointed.
This man is a moron. He can't teach. Just the get the easy A and get out of there.

Terrible class. However, it is relatively easy to get an A. This professor does not focus on truly teaching his students. Rather, he relies on "Self Evaluations" to get you the grade you deserve. Truly terrible professor and TA. Just utilize the Self Evaluations, memorize the questions, and you will get the grade you want.

Booton was a great teacher, but MG500 is the most stupidly organized class I have ever taken. 5 midterms and a final, plus a 'bonus' module that isn't really bonus because the cutoff for an A is 95%. Don't do the hw or activities, just memorize the Q/A's from the online practice exams and you will do fine. Class wasn't difficult, just a lot of work
Damn difficult subject matter but a great prof

He really wants you to go to class by not posting grades and only returning tests in class, and handing out bonus points one class period during the quarter.  Unfortunately lecture is boring and fairly useless bc when it comes to test time you just memorize tons of notes and the book actually is good at explaining difficult topics.  Ok class.

Very Fair!  Go to class...bonus points for going. Book only useful for examples, don't bother reading it.  Straight forward exams...STUDY NOTES & what he tells you! Interesting class, and nice guy. Def rec this Prof! Final is a lot of studying, but it pays off.
I didn't find him as good as everyone else. He is an alright lecturer, but glosses over important topics very fast. His tests are straightforward and not too hard. Tons of notes to memorize.
Nice and helpful. Powerpoint based class but read the book for more in-depth understanding. Midterm and final are difficult but he does give hints sometimes.
Good jokes and good teaching ability. Keeps you awake for 2 hours!

One of the best professors I've had at OSU.  He is able to communicate the material clearly and make it intersting too. Tests are hard, but he does give hints on what to study as reward for going to class.

Booton is a nice guy...very laid back and helpful. If you need help go to his office hours. Midterms are hard, but the final is much harder. There are TONS of notes but if you go to class he gives you hints on what to study. Nice guy and good prof!
Class was pretty hard only because of his weird grading system.  Other than that, he puts all the powerpoint slides on carmen.  Kills trees, but great for studying.

He was a really great professor.  he told you what you needed to know, but you have to work hard.  He expects you to keep up, and even though he does go fast, he tells you in lecture "helpful hints" that will be on his tests.  Definitly worth taking.

One of the nicest most enthusiastic profs at OSU. Very clear about what you need to know. The final was definitely harder than expected and he does have a strange grading scheme (making a 95% an A) Overall though I still have to say he might be the best prof Ive had here
Everything comes from the notes that are online, so print them off before class.  The lectures on Punnett squares might put you to sleep, but for the most part this is an interesting class.
Great teacher. Helpful and clear. Genuinely wants his students to succeed and do well in the class.

unlike some mol gen faculty, Dr. Booton has a personality, a sense of humor and is genuinely interested in teaching.  He’s very knowledgeable and always willing to help.  The social & economic aspects he ties into the course are beneficial. The class is geared toward a less intellectual audience and moves slowly at times.  the exams require more re

Definately tells you what you're going to need to know for the tests.  Go over review guide which he posts on Carmen. Seemed like all of the test questions came off those. Kinda boring, tough to stay awake sometimes, especially if you forget to/don't print off the notes before class.
He was one of the best scinece teachers I've had here at OSU.
Awesome Prof. Extremely understanding, couldn't have asked for more out of him

THIS IS IMPORTANT! (write it down -- you will find it on the test!) very straightforward and honest about his teaching. Follow your notes and labs, mostly, but READ THE BOOK! It helps. Made class fun, and interesting, but didnt put up with antics. Great prof -- would take another of his classes again in a heartbeat.

He was an awesome prof.  He was very helpful and actually made an 8:30 am class interesting.  Lecture is the most valuble part of class, he really explains stuff well.  He's a great teacher and a nice guy.
Go to class.  Tells you what will be on the test.  Prepare those concepts and it will be easy.  Lectures are interesting as well.
Really nice guy, super willing to help, tests are hard, but tries not to grade too hard, tells you what's important

If he says this is important--highlight it-- it's guaranteed to be on the test.  He's not out to trick you at all; his tests are very straightforward.  He won't ask anything that he doesn't go over in class.  I recommend skimming the book and really knowing the notes.
Pick a different TA, he is very strict and does not explain well

Is all over the place all he cares about is getting out of class quickly. He'll just throw information at you without you knowing what any of it means, spends more time asking if we're looking forward to the exam then actually teaching. He does however hold review sessions that have been kinda helpful.
just no, very tough grader and makes mean comments to those who get a question wrong
He was a tough grader but his critiques made it easy to learn from mistakes. You knew exactly what was wrong and why. When asked questions, his answers were clear and helpful.
Fun person, but VERY VERY strict in grading. He reads every sentence you write and finds every point you miss. Then, you lose points here and there.

alright dr lenny has gotten some bad reviews but he is really not THAT bad. the recitation is annoying and he isnt very helpful for the lab portion but he literally tells you the answers for the lab reports and tells you what will be on the lab quizzes. he is just a little awkward but hes actually so nice. love this guy!

Recitation is a long game with convoluted question delivery. We get no review or deeper explanation out of the content, simply play the game for an hour then do lab. Procedural demonstration and explanation is minimal at best, many technique issues prolonged labs. He also demeans incorrect answers as a joke, discouraging figure engagement.

I had a terrible time in this class. Avoid this TA if possible. I asked him about my extended response answers on an exam and he read them in front of my group and proceeded to tell my why I was wrong and make fun of me. He also continued to make jokes about my responses in future labs. Also if you think it will be a quick lab you're wrong.

He's a horrible TA, genuinely take it with anybody else. He grades a lot harsher than all the other TAs and laughs when you get a question wrong in lab. Lab quizzes are also borderline impossible. He also has a game during recitation that you genuinely get nothing out of, it's boring and takes up tons of lab time. Never take him frl

He was so unhelpful, and often left us more confused. He would not answer any of our questions, even when our group clearly stated we were having struggles. Furthermore, he was particularly distasteful towards me, and would often ignore me when I tried to participate. This truly affected my overall ability to learn and my learning environment.

If you expect to be able to not put in any effort, he will not be fun. He can be a bit tough grading and his labs are long but he teaches you the material well. He is accessible outside of class, approachable, and genuinely cares that you understand the material. His online review sessions were really helpful and so I recommend going to those!

I think he is a nice guy, but lab with him was so stressful. I couldn't understand his directions; his questions were confusing, and asking him for help honestly made me more confused. He is the head TA so he grades lab reports super harshly.

Don't take bio lab with this instructor. He's such a hard grader and makes lab quizzes impossible. He's really not mentally there and has no idea how to teach individuals. If you are confused or need help, he just won't.
Very rude and a harsh grader. He really enjoyed seeing students confused and did nothing to help. He is intelligent but a horrible teacher.

He is just not mentally here - he makes objectively easy directions impossible to complete and I have never left a lab with a better understanding, only frustrated and confused. I truly do not understand how he was approved - he is not a good TA save urself the frustration.

Dr. Lenny has very high expectations of his students and expects them to know far beyond the introductory biology course. He tries to explain things as if he is talking to a professional and leaves students much more confused afterwards. Recitation is useless. His lab quizzes are very difficult and the labs almost always go past the end time.
Dr. Lenny is a great TA! To exceed in his class, participation is key! He is a very experienced and knowledgeable TA who has a lot to offer for pre-med students. He helped me get into a research lab!
Super tough grader, expects you to know what he wants even when the question is vague. Not good at answering questions about
Doesnt try to help and laughs at your confusion.

Dr. linan is a very tough grader. He will take off points and the labs are long. Given that its online, he is not very understanding. Prepare for working very hard just to get points taken off over a small mistake.
He is so confusing and his rubric for grading is very specific. Online learning with this professor was so difficult. He does not set his students up for success.

He was so disrespectful and rude to my lab group. If you have him tried to switch lab times, he thinks your failure is funny. Honestly made me hate biology with a burning passion. The class is not bad but your TA makes or breaks your grade and he has no problem breaking it.

Dr Lenny is a knowledgeable lab TA but explains things in a way only he understands and expects you to just pick up on things right away. He is a very tough grader and if you dont put something the way he would word it he will mark you points off. Rushes students to finish labs even if you dont understand and makes you feel more confused.

Dr. Lenny is a tough but fair TA for biology. He does grade a little bit tough but he cares about his students and wants to help you. Also, he does a really nice job prepping students for the lab practical. If you can, I recommend having him as your TA. Get to know him, he's a really nice guy.

Dr. Lenny is the least helpful TA I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. He does not care about student learning, only proving his intellectual superiority. He is a picky and condescending grader and lead to an overall disheartening experience.
Dr. Lenny is one tough TA, but really fair and pretty funny. I highly recommend spending the time to get to know him, but be aware of his lab quizzes, they are really tricky.

She really knows what she is talking about. That being said, her students don't. She teaches as if we know the material already super well and doesn't give people the chance to ask questions. Going through the problem sets after was really tough and the TA's are helpful. Go to class, but REALLY go to TA office hours. Tons of extra credit too.

Her lectures are extremely boring and she struggles with explaining material to the point where students can understand it. Some questions on problem sets were impossible to do based off lecture material alone, and TAs are relied on to explain the material. Exams are fair based on problem sets and the past exams she gives you.
absolute nightmare of a class avoid at all costs

She's fine. Lectures were a bit dry but material was explained well. Most of the problems went over in class as well as on weekly problem sets were in the exact format of those on the exam. A notecard was also allowed for exams. The only issue I had in this class was with the TAs. I was given incorrect solutions by them on multiple occasions.

I really enjoyed her class and I thought she was an amazing teacher. I actually preferred her lecture over the TAs lecture and she was able to answer my questions way better than the TAs. Her exams are very, VERY fair if you study. She literally gives you extra credit for doing problem sets which you need to do in order to do well. Amazing.

Went into the class reading other reviews on here thinking this would be the worst class of my life. Dr. Chamberlin actually cares about your success as long as you put in the work for her class. Attend ALL TA office hours. Problem sets offered as extra credit, DO THEM. Go to lecture and make sure you understand the participation Q of the day.
She honestly wasn't horrible. Fairly boring sometimes, but is way more interactive in office hours. I found the class to be interesting. Make sure to go to class because there is graded participation

Cant believe she is still employed. OSU needs to let her go. The toxicity level in her course are high. She does perhaps the most boring research in the history of research. NIH is wasting money on her lab. The department needs to hire a better professor. If your really need to take the class, the read the textbook or go to TA. WORST teacher ever.

I really like going to Professors office hours. But Dr Helen is something else. No wonder students are repulsed. She is emotionless to point being nonhuman. Despite that I would go to office hours regularly but I felt bad for her and myself. Because she sucks at explaining and is not lenient at all in grading especially this difficult semester.

For some one who gets paid 100k++, she surely hates her life and will make you hate your too. The recitation are awful because there are 20 HARD questions and NOT enough time for the TAs to explain. With Covid, Online classes was just BAD. I dont know how others handled it. She was not lenient during this difficult semester at all.

Problems on test are hit or miss. You have to be naturally gifted with genetic problems or really work hard. Past tests and problem sets are helpful. Lectures so boring you want to evaporate. Group project sucks-grading is unclear, forced to work with some annoying people. Take this only if you absolutely love genetics. Hardest class I've taken.

Dr. Chamberlin believes in testing your ability to interpret data. Knowledge based questions are few and far between, and the difficulty of the course is high. If you don't read the textbook, you will not pass, as she only goes over experiments and data in lecture. Her TAs were incredible, and an asset to pass the course. Good professor, not great.

Helen is clearly brilliant, but she is not great at explaining difficult concepts. Her TAs are amazing. She gives random in class assignments, so you have to go. She offers extra credit for her exams every week, and often she pulls questions directly off of the extra credit problem sets. READ!!!!

He put me to SLEEP! Let me say that you should take any course of his when you are most awake because by the end you will be on the verge of falling asleep. He was very boring, but I found him very funny, which was somewhat helpful. I did not think he was good at explaining lectures, so be prepared to do a lot of work on your own to learn content.
Slides have alot of material so he goes really fast. Super funny professor but can be easy to zone out when going over super lengthy material. Exams are difficult.
Great professor, has a good grasp on everything he taught in the class. Takes time to answer question in and outside of class. Also just a cool guy, 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Bisaro gave very engaging lectures (at least to me). His background is in epigenetics and plant pathology and you can kind of tell when he lectures what he's passionate about. Very funny. Was nice to me when I was stressed about a grading mistake.
he's a very knowledgeable guy, but he is very boring. try to pay attention because there's a lot of content
Excellent and organized, clearly cares about and respects his students. Never makes you feel stupid. Not great with technology, but great lecturer.

His lectures had a very good set up of starting broad and then adding in all of the details. The exams were fair and were derived mostly from his powerpoints. Reading the book helps because he tried to follow it closely.
Excellent lecturer, fair grader, lots of material but extremely well organized, reasonable tests.

Dr. Bisaro was a great professor! His lectures were easy to understand and he was great about answering questions that students had about the material. His exams were easy as long as you studied what was taught in lecture.

He's awesome, incredibly informative, gives easy and straightforward exams, his notesets are excellent preparation for the tests, and his name makes me think he'd fight Batman.  He was really good and I look forward to having him a few more times in the year to come!
Love his classes! He's awesome!
Very good professor! he explains things slowly and have his own noted which are exteremly helpful. His test was fair. I recommend him.
I love this guy! He is so cool, and he knows stuff and explains really well!
No textbook for the class, simply provides extensive handouts.  They are very helpful.  Very clear in class... expects you to know your stuff but doesn't trick you too badly.
Cool dude, goes nice and slow - easy to follow lectures.  Excellent Noteset, straight forward test.  Would definitely take another class with him.
Very slow and concise. He does not try to cram too much into a single class period. Pretty good teacher.
He gives notes and he's great! I love this class.

I took this class online, and it was by far the easiest GE I have taken. The work consisted of usually one discussion post based on the class book and one quiz every week. The discussion posts are graded on whether you did them or not, and the quizzes were open-note. I recommend that anyone take this GE if they still need it as a requirement.

I took this class online. It is graded on quizzes based on the textbook and discussion posts. The discussion posts are graded on participation and quizzed aren't very hard. There is a final paper which is pretty easy. Overall, if you do the assignments on time you'll get an A.

ONLINE bioethics would be incredibly difficult to fail. Weekly assignments include a usually 20 multiple choice quiz based off the textbook in which there are PRACTICE QUESTIONS that are word-for-word on the actual quiz. Open-note, open-textbook quizzes. Pass/fail 400 word discussion every week, meet the requirements and you pass. Very intro-level.
Super easy discussions once a week for participation and a quiz once a week that is super easy based off the textbook
His workload is very manageable. He is very organized with his modules, you basically do the same things every week. As long as you do your work, you will ace the class.

Dr. Vest provided like 3 (outdated) videos of himself the entire semester. Everything else was outside resources and the textbook. So essentially, he was pretty nonexistent for the course itself. Didn't really matter, though, since the course was easy, and essays were easily able to be BS.
he's good

All of his quizzes are easy, and not that many questions. All his discussion post may get tiring but its literally on the stuff you read. TEXTBOOK MANDATORY!!. you could always get it off z library. quizlet!
class was pretty easy, just a lot of reading

Ignore all of the five star reviews this teacher has! I will be completely honest with you when I say this was the worst class I have ever taken. The amount of reading for this class is insane and good luck getting any points on the final paper (which has super ambiguous directions) unless you read. Weekly quizzes answers are on quizlets I heard.

The class was pretty easy to follow through the modules and due dates are at set times. Dr. Vest does not provide a lengthy lecture and instead introduces topics through a short clip weekly. There is a fair amount of reading, so try breaking it up into little segments for the quizzes. Discussion posts are easy and graded based on participation.

This class was pretty boring. Requires a lot of reading and the videos assigned are all very old. Weekly quizzes are pretty easy and answers can be found in textbook. Final is very long so don't wait until the due date to start.

Professor Vest was not very involved with the class outside the weekly module intro videos, but he was easy to communicate with by email. There was a weekly quiz and discussion board that were fairly easy, you just have to apply some of the concepts that were mentioned in the textbook. Overall, should be an easy A if you put in a little effort.

This class is pretty straight forward. If you follow the directions of what to do then you will get a good grade. The issue is that there is SO MUCH READING, with very very little spoken lecture content. If you have trouble concentrating on written content, you will have issues with this class setup.

His class is pretty much straight forward. It is online based and mostly independent study meaning you study and post on the discussion boards by the end of the week. His quizzes are easy as well and multiple choice. The class is pretty much an Easy A and i'll recommend taking him if you're trying to get your GPA up lol

Weekly quizzes and 400 discussion posts, both really aren't bad if you skim the reading. The final was eight 400 word discussion questions, essentially. I did a little every day and ended up okay, but DO NOT procrastinate on his final. Overall, good class, solid teacher. Definitely recommend.
Took this online during COVID. Super easy only took me 2 hours for each weeks work. Final exam was also easy as long as you did the readings.

I sent him completely valid complaints about the terrible quiz questions he has that are full of trick questions, ambiguity, and typos. He told me he can't be expected to completely literal with his questions and invalidated my complaints. I'm a good student and looking for communication and he was a brick wall. I will never be taking him again.

Anyone complaining about the workload of this class must be lazy. The material is interesting, requires no more than 20 pages of reading (that even if you skim you'll be ok), a discussion post graded pass/fail, and easy quizzes where the answers are easily found. Take this course, you won't be spending a ton of time on it weekly. Easy to get an A.

Bioethics 2000 with Dr. Vest was extremely easy. Every week, we just had to complete a 400-500 word reflection with a 50 word peer response (graded as pass-fail), and a 20 question quiz usually based on the reading, and the answers could be found online. The final was lengthy but not difficult, and you are given more than enough time to complete.

Don't take! You will have to write 500 words paper and 20 multiple choice quiz every single week. Most importantly, this course has the best final exam I have never had, you will be asked to answer 7 questions with total 2500 words. These questions are short, you will begin to talk nonsense repetitively because there is nothing to write about.
Mr vest is a grades the final exam ridiculously hard which makes up 25% of the grade.

I took this class while I was doing an internship, is it was a little difficult for me to keep up with the workload at times. Every week you take a quiz and post a 400 word discussion post online. I did not see any of the films due to lack of time. The final is 7-8 questions that make you think critically on Bioethics, is don't wait or uwillbesorry

If you are looking for an easy Culture and Ideas GE, this is it!! Easiest course I have ever taken. Do the work and you get an A. The class is probably more interesting taught in person, but the online version is super easy.

Easy GE & decently interesting (especially if you're in the healthcare field). Weekly discussion questions (400-500 words; pass/fail based on participation)and open book quizzes (most on answers on quizlet). 7 discussion question final. You need the book, but its only like $15 to rent, so it's worth it for an easy A!

Bioethics is a great class for anyone considering a career in healthcare. The grading is mostly based on completion of weekly discussion topics, weekly reading quiz (16-20 questions), and a 7 question discussion style final. Oh, and bonus point opportunities, which I highly recommend doing.

Dr. Vest is not that involved in the class, it's mostly just you logging on, doing a weekly quiz and discussion post, and that's it. Not too hard or tedious. Quizzes require some reading but it's open book. He provides scans of the first few chapters but after that you need to buy it. I enjoyed this class, and picked up a bioethics minor after it.

Dr. Vest is not too involved in the course other than sending occasional reminders. The class itself is easy, yet those who do not like online classes may find it tedious. Weekly quizzes and discussion posts are the majority of what you do. The final is written and includes seven short essay questions which require work but are not hard.

Easy GE, also pretty fun/interesting. Weekly discussions that are pass/fail--so participation. Weekly quizzes that are easy if you do the reading. Final exam was discussion like short essays that were really easy. Also extra credit for watching ethics films. The professor isn't too involved--very independent class, but he is there if you need help.

3 credit online bioethics class, it's a must take for anyone. Easy A, all the points are on open book quizzes, and all of the answers are easily accessible on google, but unfortunately you will need the book because the weekly discussion posts are based on the passages, but it's pretty inexpensive. I would recommend this to anyone.

I had her for biology survey and she was super nice and funny. The class info was kinda boring but attendance is optional (although she claims it's not, she never did any type of attendance but the first day) so it was fine. Every assignment is due at the end of the semester and if you need more time past that she is very forgiving

I only had this professor for the biology survey course as well, so it was a slight class but ultimately very helpful. Her lectures cleared up many questions I had as a first year in my first semester. We only got into groups once, so if group work scares you, then there is nothing to worry about here. The three mentors for the course were great.

Had her for biology major survey and she is amazing. Totally chill and she is funny. The class does seem pointless but TBH everything you learn about is important and necessary. Since the class is required Lydia Rall is definitely the professor to have for it.

I took this class online, get ready to study but the professor is amazing and understanding. You have many chances of getting a higher grade so if you get a lower grade on the first exam you have a chance of getting it up

This class is a majorly about your exam grades. There were 5 exams in one semester? The exam questions were way more difficult than the study guide posted or homework from previous weeks. The averages on the exams were always very low which is concerning considering they are 'open note'. Way too much busy work. Required online discussion groups.

I took this class online. Easy class to pass. There is a good amount of assignments but it is not overwhelming. Due to the amount of assignments they really carry your grade. Only complaint I have is the tests are hard but open notes. You think you know the material but then you go into the test and the questions are worded weirdly.

Exams can be difficult but she goes back and sees what the most missed and such are and usually gives back points. There are many assignments though, so as long as you complete lecture activities and homework well then your grade won't be terrible. She also did graded discussions, which were free points as long as you tried and participated.

You have to be in class if you want to learn anything. If you prefer to do work alone, this class isn't for you as you are constantly working with a partner. Learning definitions won't work; you need to understand how parts of the body function/how they function in specific scenarios. Midterm questions are very abstract and confusing.

such a kind soul! dr. herrmann is genuinely so sweet and wants nothing but the best for her students. she is so supporting and genuinely eager to see her students do well. great at answering questions! lots of lecture though!

This class is hard, lots of work, & requires lots of studying. Memorization won't work, so make sure you know the material. Watch the lecture videos & take notes on all the assignments. Exams are difficult (there are 5 of them). She is very smart & is good at teaching the material. Just pay attention, actually put in effort, and you'll be fine!

This professor believes her class is the only one at the University. She requires you participate in an enormous amount of homework. Her test are extremely EXTREMELY abstract. Memorization will not work in this course. You will need to understand an explain what she is teaching. Be prepared to put in a lot of time. Takes away from major

Lectures are boring and too much Tophat. She simplifies everything down too much. You could spend an entire class talking about one calculation. Her tests have confusing wording, so even if you know the concept you could get the question wrong. Talked to her a couple times and didnt seem like she cared about fair grading. Have had better profs.

Good professor, lectures are important and theres a ton of TopHat to keep you engaged. Her tests are worded confusingly at times but overall its not too difficult, especially if you study the lecture slides (which are online but omit key words/phrases that you can get from going to lecture, or lecture capture on Carmen). Some grade-boosters too!!

Dr. Herrmann is a good professor and you can learn a lot. Attendance and participation are taken daily via Tophat. Her lecture slides are posted online but she omits key phrases and terms making attendance a necessity.

Good class. Bio is hard but overall if you put in the work you can do well. More points are given in Lab than in lecture and/or tests. Kill the labs and easy assignments you should be fine. Only complaint i have is the wording on her tests can be very confusing. Other than that a good prof! I would recommend.

Dr. Herrmann is an outstanding professor. Her lectures are always interesting, her tests are not too difficult if you study for them, and she provides many opportunities to earn points outside of tests. I have never had a professor who is so genuinely excited to teach, and as passionate about their subject as Dr. Herrmann is- she's fantastic!

Awesome prof. You have to go to the lecture to get the content but her lectures are interesting and hobby quickly because they aren't boring. Also, she's pretty funny. Will meet with you outside of class to talk about grades or just whatever. If you have to take this class, take it from her.

Pay attention in class and take notes and this class is not hard at all. There is very little homework outside of class, and lectures are really good and easy to sit through. If you put in a little effort into the class and study, you'll enjoy this class.

Dr. Sam is super smart and is by far my favorite professor, but she is so difficult. You cannot simply slide by in this class. Attendance is mandatory (graded by TopHat, which is both for participation and actual credit, so good luck), and she flies by with her PowerPoints. Smartest lady I've ever met, hardest science class I've taken.

Students love her. She genuinely makes an effort to know her students. Quality discussion in class. Grading can be tough, but that's definitely more to the TA's credit, not hers. Conveys material in a light, conversational, intriguing manner: encouraging discussion, including real world examples and the occasional video. Would definitely recommend.
Unclear grading criteria (would always take points off for the silliest things), unnecessarily difficult tests and quizzes, not accessible outside of class, just no.
Her lectures are ridiculously long.
She is inflexible and rule oriented. Directions are unclear and she is unwilling to work with you.
Hard grader, not flexible or willing to work with you! You have to pay an extra fee to take the midterm and final at home even though it is an online class.

She's a great teacher, however this class will not be an easy A. She makes you work for every grade you receive. If you show up, you will do fine as long as you pay attention, which isn't hard to do because she is a fine woman.

Dr. Herrmann loves her students and is super passionate about what she does. The course coordinator makes the class 10x harder than what it needs to be. Gives a lot of easy test questions but you'd only know the answer if you went to class. You have to understand concepts, not just memorize stuff. Hard class but she makes it great.

She's a great lecturer because she keeps things simple and clear. She provides Powerpoints with some blanks, so it's easy to take notes. One odd thing was she made her final harder than the previous 2 exams by filling it with tons of trick questions! So that wasn't cool, but overall I enjoyed having her and the class was easy enough.
She's nice.  She is not very helpful though. Your grade will not be based off of whether or not you know the content.
Very personable. Really cares if you understand the material and if you don't understand, she will sit there and help you until you do.

Dr. Herrmann is a very passionate and knowledge professor. She has a great personality  and makes the class fun. However, the course coordinator makes the class harder than it should be for a entry level biology class. The questions on the exams are not straight forward. With this being said, you have to take what you learned in class and apply it.
One of the best professors so far.

Very intelligent and easy to talk to! Great personality and sense of humor! This course involves a lot of time, especially for the project portion. There is so much information covered which made studying for exams difficult especially since there was no list provided as to what to even specifically study.  Definitely not an easy A.
No help at all. Her tests are difficult. She doesn't give out study guides. She goes through lecture notes way too fast. Would not recommend for future students

She's one of the coolest professors I've had. She goes pretty fast during lecture but if you ask her to stop and explain something she will. Don't have anything bad to say except that you definitely wanna study for tests. Expected to end the class with a C and got an A-. Go to class/recitatation it will definitely boost your grade a lot in the end
One of my favorite professors! She's so chill and funny and really cares about the students. She will teach whatever the students are most interested in. A lot of grades so very easy to get an A.

Honestly, take her class even if you don't like science/ biology. take it even if its hard. I promise you you will enjoy it. There are a few movies that you have to watch for recitation which takes up a lot of time but the movies were very interesting except one. Lecture felt like it was really short, maybe because she's such an amazing teacher

I've never seen any teachers/professors like her. (In a good way) her classes are pretty interesting although biology is my worst subject. There are at least 3 movies you have to watch and it takes a lot of time, also a group project. I feel like her tests aren't really that hard if you studied and prepare yourself well.

Definitely one of my favorite professors. She knows a lot about biology and is truly passionate about what she is teaching. Tests are tough, but if you pay attention in class and study, it's not bad. She makes lectures really interesting and bases them off of what students are interested in. Not much outside work, but a group project and one paper.
I love Prof. Herrmann. She makes class interesting and enjoyable. Although her tests are difficult, if you pay attention, go to class, and study, you'll be fine.

She is by far my favorite professor. You can tell she actually cares about our opinions and teaches us material that we want to know more about. Her lectures are hilarious and really interesting. Tests are a little tough but there's plenty of other points offered in the class that will help boast your grade.

She's  a very nice person, and clearly cares about her students. Her tests are extremely difficult, but there is enough other assignments given where you should be able to save your grade as long as you go to class. I enjoy her lectures, but I do not think the tests are worth it.

Pretty tough grader, but very nice! There's a ton of extra credit, so if you do them all then a good grade should be easy to achieve. She goes through the PPTS really fast - so I would suggest bringing your computer to class. Gives PPTS ahead of time, just have to fill in the blanks. Tests are pretty tricky but don't have to buy the book!

This class was definitely challenging. You have to work hard to get a good grade. The instructor was really nice and really helpful! She does go through material a little quickly but is always willing to slow to down if need be. Tests are tricky. I would definitely recommend not waiting until the last minute to study. Does give extra credit often!

As long as you go to class and pay attention this class is really easy and she is really nice! The final exam is just questions that have been on previous midterms she couldn't make it much easier to get an A in this class especially because there is always extra credit available.

Very polite and down to earth. Will answer any and all questions.....  Bad news is she flies through slides too fast and her tests make you want to put your head in a grinder. She covers material decently but the test questions are tricky and hard. TESTS ARE HARD. GRADING IS HARD. Find another instructor if possible. Do not take this class...
GREAT teacher! She takes her time to explain fine details of a topic you're confused about until you get it! Physiology is a hard topic but she makes it easier to understand. Wish she taught a class!
She is a nice person but this course is difficult. If you want a high GPA, do not attend this BIO1102
Very helpful on what to put on exams.
She was wonderful! There were great class discussions and everything was very hands on. Oh, and she's not hard on the eyes!

Dr. Foster is an amazing person, he seems to care about the course and the students. He is not a great professor. He consistently has mistakes in his slides, sometimes going unnoticed until he references the slides later, his lectures are unorganized, and he is not great at explaining topics. It feels lecture is his first time seeing the slides too
Worst professor you can ever have. He never knows what he's talking about. Often skip slides, BUT THE SKIPPED SLIDES WILL SHOW UP DURING EXAM! TRY NOT TO TAKE HIS CLASS TO SAVE YOUR LIFE.

This dude messed up in lecture so many times that it made attending not worth it. You basically had to self teach yourself all the material which made it impossible to learn stuff like multiplicity. Seriously made me consider the BA for biochemistry due to the horror of taking Pbiochem 5722.

Never had a more unorganized professor, wow! He seems kind, but his lectures were disastrous. Often had to end early because he got lost in his own slides, or couldn't figure out the algebra of a problem that he put in his slides. Side note; no calculators allowed on exams, which is unnecessarily cruel in my opinion.

Dr. Foster has a destructible pattern of teaching that goes something like this: 1. At the start, he is very ambitious in the amount of material he wants to teach & expects students to retain. 2. About half way through the semester he can't keep up with his own course & blames it on his students. 3. By the end, he gets sloppy and crashes. Beware.
Terrible. Don't expect good lectures, example problems, a decent understanding of material, or fair tests.

Dr. Foster knows what he is talking about, and if you are willing to put in the effort, he will make sure that you know what you're doing. Lectures could sometimes be confusing- would definitely recommend reading before/attending office hours after. HW assignments can be lengthy, so start them early! He was receptive to our feedback.

This class will test your knowledge of coding more than pchem. We were told when our exams were with little notice (and sometimes he decided to change the exam time the same day of the exam!). The coding made this class 10x more difficult than it needed to be & the frequently canceled lectures also didn't help. The HW assignments take hours on end.

Biochemistry is full of unintuitive concepts that can be hard to understand. Fortunately, your professor is there to clarify things to prevent misunderstandings, right? WRONG. Mark Foster has the unique ability to make students leave his lecture even MORE confused than when they came in. Then he wonders why 75% of the class doesn't attend lecture.

Dr. Foster wants you to learn. The class was difficult but if you watch the lectures and do the homework and actually understand it you should be fine. It was an intimitating class at first (since it includes coding) but he helps you out with it as long as you reach out. Communication was still difficult thought, wish it was in-person.

Hes not the best nor the worst. I wish he could be more approachable this semester in a pandemic. He complained about attendance in class & office hours. But i wish he could be more interesting then people would actually show up. Just goes over dry notes. I think he and Magliery are the only ones teaching it. Bot are exceptional. May the force bwu
Nightmare of a class, no clear schedule or guidelines, lectures and breakout rooms are unproductive

I get COVID makes everything difficult, I really do. But my God, this guy has no idea what he's doing. The lectures are just him reading the notes he posts to you pretty much verbatim. Poor communication, constantly changing due dates, no set schedule or clear grading guidelines in the syllabus. An absolute nightmare of a class.
Great teacher and very good slides.  Exams weren't that bad.  A very knowledgable and cool professor.

The only compliant I had was that I felt like her lectures were very rushed, otherwise she did good at explaining the topics and seemed approachable. Attendance is graded through tophats and she does have weekly quizzes but I never read the textbook and was fine. There is also a lot of extra credit.

She's a very good teacher and incredibly smart. I think the previous bad reviews are from her teaching lab, which she stopped doing this semester. I will say her tests are kinda hard compared to the notes, but still not bad. I don't like ecology, but I didn't mind her class. I also never used the textbook or went to office hours, and got by ok.

Dr. Beggrow's class is great...there is really nothing to complain about. If you show up to lecture and participate, there is no reason to not earn the grade you want at the end of the semester. It is evident that Dr. Beggrow was also highly knowledgeable about the subject matter, and I am really glad I got to take 1114 with her.

idk everyone's mean on here so maybe she's changed her style but i thought she was awesome. Really responsive and caring during office hours. I thought the class participation aspect was really useful for this class. Nitpicky grading but i think thats a bio department thing

Some of these reviews are kinda dramatic or maybe she has just adjusted her teaching and exams. Dr. Beggrow is very sweet and it is clear she wants students to succeed. There is A LOT of opportunities for extra credit and points outside of exams. Exams are difficult compared to content but are still very doable.

Literally the worst class I have ever taken. Super easy content but is graded harshly plethora of busy work. Attendance is graded. Lab is excruciatingly painful as you do nothing for an hour and then rush to finish actual lab, which parts are expected to be completed outside of the lab period. Asking for help doesn't even improve grade.

I liked her passion for biology and the way she challenged us to think critically. However, this class was harder than it had to be with the grading. I took the peer led section so that was a bigger commitment and had a lot of vague, subjective discussions about evolution that were kinda boring.

Dr. Beggrow definitely wants you to succeed and she lectures on antibiotic resistance for 8 weeks which is semi-interesting. The class is mostly writing assignments which are graded pretty difficultly. Luckily I had Dr. Beggrow as my TA so she is more than willing to help and outline what she expects from you.

If you're willing to put in the effort you'll be okay, but she is an incredibly tough grader and doesn't always give the best feedback because she can be condescending and not helpful. Avoid having her in lab and you'll be okay. Her tests can be very hard but there's a lot of easy points to make up for it in the class. She's decently nice.

Dr. Beggrow is a very nice person but her class is very complicated. A lot of the material does not seem very intense, but she grades labs very hard. Her lectures are very informative and I highly recommend attending them. Work hard on the labs, the grades will catch up to you.

She's a great professor, despite her tough grading and lots of class points (1000~ total points in the semester) her lectures are very in depth and require good note taking, but if you genuinely enjoy biology then it's a great class! She's a very kind person and is always open to help. I would take this class again if I could.

I loved Dr. Beggrow as a person, but not as a professor. She grades very tough and no matter what you do it never seems to be good enough. The tests are very tricky and a study guide is provided. However, with all study guides and reviews she gives, there is no answer key. How are you supposed to confirm you're even studying the right answer?

Dr. Beggrow is nice but her class is awful. Lectures are easy but the tests are purely application questions that have no way to be prepared for and barely have anything to do with what she teaches. She grades labs super strictly and kind of seems like she wants her class to be impossible to get an A in.

If you can take another prof do it she is the absolute worst! Nice to your face but grades like a psychopath she will not let any thing slide. Condescending and not helpful with answering questions. Assignments are nothing like  what is seen on exams. I could go on forever

This is the first 5 credit class I've taken that had a helpful lecture. Her use of top-hats, in class assignments, and call and response was soo helpful to learn the course work. If you go to class and follow along with her "fill in the blank" slides, you'll do well. Lab makes up most of your grade, ask the TA for help with lab and you'll do well.

Lecture content appears to be easy however exam questions and quizzes are extremely difficult and have almost nothing to do with the lectures. My TA once said he had to google multiple questions on the exam because he did not understand them. Lab heavy course, however TA's will take off points for any little mistake in lab reports.

Though I did not enjoy the fact that Dr. Beggrow's exams were significantly harder than her weekly quizzes (and that the class was basically memorization), I appreciated her as a person. She took the time to include the scientific research of diverse groups and wanted to ensure that her lectures were very engaging!

Im currently in Beggrow 1114 and I have an A+. If you come to class for attendance TOPHAT points and you take notes or actively listen this class is very easy. If you have a lab TA that is not Beggrow, lab is also very very easy and is lots of group work. All quizzes open note. Skim the textbook too! Easy if you put in the work

Had her as a lab coordinator and TA a couple years ago. She absolutely picks favorites and takes off points for minuscule errors. Office hours were useless as even if she point blank told you what to write on an assignment, she still found ways to take points off. Avoid if possible.

Beggrow is nice but she is a tough grader. Most of your grade is from lab and she grades it to the harshest degree. When asked questions she gives cryptic answers or is condescending. She reads off powerpoints but have to go to lecture for participation. exam questions are obscure & don't make sense. refuses to take critiques & blames the student

Dr. Beggrow is nice, but the way the class is structured does not make sense. Theres two exams worth nothing (basically). The grade you will get in class will primarily be based off of lab points, which she grades to the toughest degree possible. Let me remind you, your lab work will likely be due on a Sunday and is collaborative. Good luck!
Not as bad as people say. She grades lab reports harshly and is not very helpful in lab, but her lectures are good and she is pretty nice. Don't skip lectures.

Dr. Beggrow might be the worst professor I've had at Ohio State. She takes off points with no explanation and for things that aren't put the way she wants it to be. I had a ton of obstacles come up during the semester such as covid and she was no help at all and continued to dock points on things that shouldn't have been. Very condescending also.

Very critical grader, if you don't answer questions, especially in lab, exactly how she would answer them you get points off. Took of points for trivial errors. Can be condescending when asked questions. Doesn't listen to feedback and instead blames the student. An additional 1 credit hour class is required and is a waste of time.

Honestly I'm not sure why Dr. B has such a bad rating, I love her class. She does grade lab assignments harshly and there's lots of group work which is annoying at times. But her lectures are interesting, with a good mix of discussion and lecturing. She's very kind and enjoyable to talk to outside of class; she even learns everyone's names!

She was my lab/recitation TA in Summer 2021. The content for this class isn't hard... I got A's for the midterm and the final. But she is basically looking to take off points on every assignment. Not wording your answers the way she wants will take off points. If you can get another TA, you should. She's decently nice though I guess.

Terrible professor, try to take any other person. The class content was very easy to learn but she would consistently ask questions that depended on information that was not presented in the question. She also doesn't let you see what you missed and on assignments, she would dock points with no explanations.
