AVOID! Course content is easy to understand but she makes exam questions ambiguous and very tricky. She wastes your time with dozens of small assignments (which she grades very harshly) and lets class discussions drag on and on without saying if you're right or wrong. I love Biology but absolutely despised this class and her "teaching" style.

Don't be fooled by the grade, only A- of the semester. Took this class last year, honestly miserable. Her practice exams did NOT correlate with the actual exam at all. She docked points for literally EVERYTHING. For writing her thesis on how to teach evolution, she is the WORST. I could go on forever about her, but I have limited characters :)

Actually one of the worst class experiences of my career. She REQUIRES you take an extra class no other professor requires so that she can use data from it for her research without telling you. She's nice to your face, but a nightmare to deal with. Makes you do group work CONSTANTLY even when she asked us our opinion and we said no.
Beggrow teaches very well and the information in her lectures are very concise. However, she can go a little fast sometimes, and the tests are difficult.

I took her for my Biology 1114. Her lectures were terrible. It was examples and no content. I did not learn anything. Her tests were super heard for no reason and very specific. I studied so hard and still ended up doing poorly. Her class average was terrible and she did not even care. The class is based on more discussion than actually teaching.

She is a harsh grader. Shell take points off if you make small mistakes or dont include the specific wording she was looking for. Her lecture drag and she spends most time talking about examples rather than the consents themselves. Shes sweet and easy to reach out to but shell likely not answer your questions and go on a tangent.

Terrible. She takes points off for small grammar mistakes during the labs and her test questions are much more difficult than her practice exams are. Easily accessible but not very good at explaining. She also words the questions so weird as if she were trying to trick you; knowing the material will not help you do well. MUST BE AN ENGLISH WHIZ

LOVED Dr. Hopper, was super easy to approach outside of class and she cares a lot about her students. She is great at recommending students for labs and sees the potential in everyone. Her class was very beneficial for anyone looking for research and didn't know where to start.
She's the best.
Dr. Hopper was the best! Granted I had her for a career and research opp. class, but she was always looking out for your best interest. Do as she recommends and youre set!

She is a good instructor. Exams were very hard, but fair. Well representative of the material covered. Nice lectures, very nice powerpoints, but certainly have to work for the grade. Not an easy course (molecular genetics 605). She is very clear on what you need to know and what you do not. Unless you are going into genetics, consider molgen 500.

Good intentions, bad professor. Seriously lacking clarity. HW problems are extremely obscure, takes an excessive amount of time (up to 4hrs). Tests are fair. Information is presented poorley in general. She is a nice woman though, she throws out candy to people in lecture.

Dr. Mendes is an incredible professor! As long as you come to the lecture and pay attention, it is very hard to do poorly in this class. The smaller assignments have a much larger impact on your grade so be sure to get all of the attendance points and to complete the homework!
His tests were very unfair. He would test us on material that had never come up in the lecture and then tell us to "read the textbook" without telling us what to focus on.

Attendence isn't mandatory but TopHat is used about every lecture for points. He does get off topic during his lectures a lot but it's all for a purpose. He is very interested in the topics at hand. Overall great professor. If you're planning on taking this class, make sure you read the textbook and know details.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really good guy, but his lectures were not very well organized. He often got side tracked during lecture. He also expects you to learn the content outside of lecture from videos on his carmen which are very boring. His exams were tough but I didn't think they were tough compared to other professor's exams I have taken.

Dr.Chiucchi is an amazing person, but he is not a good professor. The class is plagued with disorganized content, confusing exam questions, and no practice actually reflective of the exams. You watch lecture before class and do useless tophat during, so if you hate this, avoid the class. Focus on your lab grades because they can save your grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a very nice guy, not a great teacher (I think his ratings are inflated due to that). He teaches in a confusing style, cancels A LOT of class time, and stretches out explanations in lecture. The lab and lecture do not line up, and the joke of a lab was terrible. I do like his passion, teaching metacognition, analyzing graphs, etc.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really cool and laid back guy. Material was interesting to learn as well. Lab kinda blows and its graded somewhat strictly. My biggest problem was the exams. They do not correlate well with the material that is barely being taught through his lecture videos. They were borderline unfair. Cool professor, sub-par exam style.

Prof was always late to class and you have to attend to get points. Young prof goes off on wild tangents, extremely difficult to understand his lectures, exams are extremely difficult. Prof doesn't create atmosphere conducive to learning. Inability for students to adapt in harsh learning conditions results in lower "grade fitness" to overall GPA.

The worst professor I've taken. He doesn't bother to show up on time, is always a few minutes late, and then has the audacity to keep everyone after the allotted time. Makes tests unnecessarily hard and relies on outdated team projects which basically determine your entire grade. Very difficult to keep a good grade, and gives no practice material.

Prob my least favorite science professor I've taken. I heard good things, but man he drives me nuts. Doesn't bother to come to class on time, his answers to questions are so drawn out that I forget what we're even talking about at times, and the tests were not easy. I wouldn't say I don't recommend him, I just didn't particularly enjoy his class

I love Dr. Chiucchi! He was very funny in his lecture and made learning bio fun. You need to go to lecture to answer the Top Hat questions. Tests were easy and he emphasized the important things you needed to know beforehand

He is honestly one of the best professors. If you are willing to take notes outside of class then it is very easy. Going to lecture was mandatory for easy tophat points. His lectures are fun and most days we wouldn't even do anything. He doesnt teach you anything that you dont need to know for the exams. Exams were exactly what he taught in notes

You need to come to lectures for 70 top hat points! Dr. C was a decent professor but he didn't like the online format very much. Exams can be tricky but the textbook helps reinforce lecture concepts. Grades are largely dependent on your TA and some rough grading. Be proactive, put in the effort, and ask questions to do well!

He is MUCH MUCH better in person. Seems very unorganized and less interested in teaching now that things are online. Also (and this may be do to carona) he is IMPOSSIBLE to reach, if you email him you get an automated email back saying "please wait 2-3 business days for a reply". Hes a great and funny dude, just wait till class is in person again.

heard his class was easy. lecture seemed pretty straightforward and top hat questions were easy and simple. thought i was prepared for the first exam. NOPE. got a 68. never have gotten below a B on an exam before. he does not prepare you well for the exams at all as they are way more complex than the top hat qs. wish i could change my prof.

People really like Chiucchi, but he is not my fav. Lab is hard and this class is very dependent on those grades. He says exams dont have trick questions, but at lot do have one piece of info in paragraph that dictates the answer which can be tricky. Go to lecture because tophat gives you free points, and i suggest taking notes on his slides.
Dr. Chucci is a pretty funny guy but he does not know how to present the material in a way that is easy to learn. His notes are scattered and his tests are difficult to prepare for.

He's a very funny and caring professor. This course is very passable, but you have to be willing to put in some work. He is very accessible outside of class. The labs in this course are incredibly easy, too.

Hes aight. Nice guy whos clearly passionate about the subject, but slides often include a lot of info that is not relevant to what is tested on. I did find a lot of the material to be interesting. Exam scores barely affect your grade somehow, and there is no hw to boost you up. Your lab TAs grading will pretty much determine your overall grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a good lecturer and cares about his students success. However, this course has a lot of the problems 1113 did. Exams are hard to prepare for (no practice exams) and it is unclear what content will be tested on and what is just important stuff to know. Course can be unnecessarily difficult, as I got the same grade in here as in OChem

Easily my favorite professor of my college career. If you're reading this Chiucchi, ily. Don't let the haters bring you down. - Lots of office hours/personal help - Very funny and personable - Cuffs his jeans - Drinks lots of tea - Plays soccer with colleagues - Likes dogs - Hates when people misuse the word "adaptation" - Individuals don't evolve

Jimmy is a relaxed, funny guy that teaches 1114 well. I studied about two hours the day of all the exams and got As on all of them -- he's definitely not out to trick anyone with his questions. The worst part about the course is by far the lab component. I would definitely recommend Chiucchi over the other 1114 teachers if you can.

Makes simple content necessarily complex and confusing. His lecture slides are unorganized, and they are your only resource besides the book (which doesn't align with his lectures). He often can't figure out his own exam and tophat questions when he attempts to explain them the class. Was disappointed by this course.

I loved Dr. Chiucchi. He is hilarious and there is no homework outside of lab & a final research paper. Lab assignments are easy and completed in groups. The textbook is not required (I never looked at it despite having it from Bio 1113) and he posts his lecture slides. (I used solely his slides to study for exams and ended with a 97)

I took this class, because I saw that he was an easy teacher. BUT DO NOT LET THIS FOOL YOU. He doesn't know the answers to his own tophat or exam questions. There is no homework, leaving you with no way to practice. His exam study guides are a jokes and half the stuff on them he admits he forgot to put on the the test. He is funny but not helpful.
Very chill professor tests are straightforward and fair
Seems clueless about his students and what he's supposed to be teaching. Spends a lot of class time talking about himself. He's basically the Donald Trump of biology teachers.

Chiuacchi is unorganized and barely knows the answers to his own exam questions. He doesn't explain things well and will spend an entire lecture trying to explain, and then he will play catch up because he wasted so much time in class. He shoves all the material that he didn't cover onto the final.

Dr. Chiucchi is an amazing professor! He makes lectures really interesting. His tests are not that hard as long as you pay attention in lectures and go over the power point that he posts. He is also very easy to talk to so don't be afraid to go to his office hours and ask him questions!! He is seriously the best professor that I ever had!!!

Dr. C is hilarious! He keeps his lectures interesting with funny videos and makes the material easy to learn. The lab portion and the final paper make up the biggest part of your grade so if you don't do well on his tests, which are pretty easy, you'll still pass!

He is redundant, confuses himself, and his lectures are boring. He is terrible at writing TopHat and Exam questions which is really annoying. His class is too easy but he is friendly and for a class with relatively easy concepts it isn't bad. Also I can't believe he is rated hot, have any of you sat up front or actually talked to him after class?
Dr. Chiucchi is a great professor. What determined my grade was the lab portion, so getting a good TA is important

One of the best science classes I've taken at OSU. Lectures are required in order to get in class TopHat points but he makes the material enjoyable and easy to understand. He also made me laugh at least once a lecture. Unlike other science department classes, Dr. Chiucchi has a fair grading system/style. Wish he taught more of my classes.

Solid professor. In my opinion, he made the material interesting. However, sometimes his lectures became rambling and his power point notes sometimes didn't help too much when studying. Overall though, his exams were very fair and he kept the class interesting. He seemed to care about students learning and enjoying the material.
Keeps lectures interesting, tests are based on his slides not the book, as long as you have a decent TA you're set.

I got As on the midterms and final and still was fighting for my grade because the TA graded so horribly. There was even a "curve" or basically 5 free points added to even out the grades. Horrible lectures. He doesn't really care. Do not recommend.

Getting a B- to an A- is pretty easy as long as you show up to class, put some effort in, and study the slides for the exams. An A, however will take some work. His exams are kind of annoying, but doable. You have to attend lectures for tophat, but he is all over the place during lecture and it's hard to follow him and pay attention.

OK everyone loves this guy because he's got a dry sense of humor and tries to be cool, but really his lectures are all over the place and his attempts at fitting in are repulsive. He also never answers emails and comes across as arrogant when you talk to him in person. His class is pretty easy if you study the slides, but lectures a waste

The best professor I have EVER had. I failed the first exam and was devastated, so he suggested I start going to office hours, which helped tremendously throughout the semester. He was SO helpful, has a great personality, and loves/cares for his students. Lectures are very fun/interesting & labwork is awesome. Take his class. You wont regret it.
Okay, he is honestly the best professor. Funny, smart, clear. It's not hard to pass, but not easy to get an A. PLUS he's so hot you definitely won't want to skip class.

If you want an A, you need to attend class. An A is attainable but you have to work for it. He provides several opportunities to earn points, so it would be difficult to fail. It is true that he is pleasing to behold.
Dr. Jimmy is very enthusiastic about biology. His lecture was always entertaining and fun. Lecture wasn't always well coordinated with the lab work, but I still enjoyed 1114. He's funny too.
He's passionate

Dr. Chiucchi is the ideal professor. He tells you what he wants you to know and doesn't try to trick you. Still, you NEED to study. This class is NOT an "easy A." Most of the points come from lab and the TAs are tough!  You will learn a lot if you take the course seriously. Also, he has a fabulous sense of humor and is VERY easy on the eyes! :)

Chiucchi has been my favorite prof. so far. He truly cares for his students and makes an effort  not to trick them on exams. Book is not necessary - everything comes from PP - and his slides are concise about what you need to know. He's funny and entertaining, and I would gladly take another class taught by him. Take his class!
Best prof I have had at OSU. Would take every class with him if possible

He was a great professor. Really funny and makes lecture interesting. His tests are based off of his lectures, but I still found the questions somewhat difficult and abstract. Overall, a really good guy... but be ready to study and think critically.

He is willing to answer every students question in lecture. He was very clear and made topics easy to understand. He does get distracted sometimes and we get out of subject, but that's what made class fun. Awesome professor.

I really liked him as a person and would definitely recommend his class. At first I wasn't a total fan of the way he lectures, but it really grows on you. He actually tells you not to buy the textbook, so the exams are totally based on his powerpoints which is nice. 2 papers, but they weren't difficult at all. Overall good class and super cool guy.

Good looking guy. Lectures move really slow but the concepts are discussed in depth. Don't need book, lecture slides are all you need. Midterms and finals are important. There are two scientific research related writing assignments  in the class. Not very difficult. Test are easy but the course is not an easy A. Uses Tophat. So go to classes.

The content of the class itself was pretty easy, lab portion was a lot of busy work. Lectures consist of 400ish students and he pretty much never or very slowly responds to emails, so hopefully you have a good TA. What I loved most was that he made his own lecture slides and you could just study the powerpoints for exams

Dr. Chiucchi was very engaged in his lectures and it's easy to see that he really loves what he teaches. Sometimes he would go off topic and that pushed our schedule back a few times but he made lectures enjoyable. He was also really funny and poked fun at students. Tests were straight from his lectures, so review all of his powerpoints.

Jimmy is an awesome person who you would definitely like to hang out with, but he is an unclear lecturer. He has discussion in a 400 person lecture and never really clarifies what the right answer is. He leaves most things up to interpretation, which isn't great in a science course. Overall, it's a decent class and he is good looking so that helps.

The lectures are actually a really good representation of the exams so textbooks aren't needed. There is a grade for showing up to class to answer questions. He's a pretty engaging lecturer, and was helpful when I met up with him in office hours. Most laid back professor I've had at OSU. The only thing hard about the class was the labs.

-participation only matters for tophat, other than that his PPT's are online and say exactly what you need for exams -exams are easy enough, no tricks -no need for text book -lab matters, be nice to TA, be ready for quizzes  -writing assignments were easy enough

Dr. Chiucchi is easily one of my favorite professors at OSU. If you spend time to get to know him he's a great guy, but even if you don't he is still a great lecturer and teacher. He clearly conveyed concepts and was pretty clear about what was on the test. To do well on the tests you do need to know definitions and apply the concepts.
Doesn't use the book at all. All the exams are based off his power point lectures which you have to study. Labs were a lot harder than lecture

The class itself was great! The exams were not too difficult, but not that easy. I feel like you have to be a good test taker to do really well. Or just study really hard. Lab was the part that brought my grade down. My TA was just a really hard grader, but still you have to try in lab in order to pass the class!

Dr. Chiucchi is probably the best professor I have had at OSU. I hope he reads this because he deserves to know how much I enjoyed his class. He lectures were extremely clear and his tests were more than manageable. He was also very fair and did not ask too much of his students. I wish all professors at OSU were as nice and engaging at him.
HES SO FREAKING CUTE!!!!!
After getting a C+ in 1113 with Weinstein, I actually loved 1114 and because of him I am now a Biology major. Great class, no textbook needed.

Dr. Chiucchi is a great teacher and advisor. Uses clickers so you need to come to class. Final exam wasn't cumulative. Tests are fair, not too difficult but you have to study to get a good grade. Pretty laid back guy, and easy to talk to.

I loved this class and Dr. Chiucchi. He's really funny and he actually made the classes interesting and made me enjoy going to class. His tests are pretty much straight off his powerpoints and clicker questions and are super easy if you pay attention in lecture. I'm honestly going to miss this class. Not to mention he is a flaming red pepper.

Easiest class I have taken here so far. Go to lecture for clicker points and just study his power points. He never tries to trick you and really wants everyone to do well. I would definitely recommend him.

Dr. C is a great professor!  His lectures weren't too boring.  The only time they were a little rough was when you can tell he was only talking to hear himself speak.  I personally liked the classes best when he showed up in his black sweater. The tests were based on notes and not on the book, which made me angry for wasting money on the book! $$

Dr Chiucchi is HOT. I mean his parents must be Gods to have created such a beautiful son. Besides that, his tests are solely based off his powerpoints and he uses clickers. He can be funny at times and tries to make class interesting. However, he talks about his research a little too much and I only paid attention during movies.

Dr. Chiucchi was a good professor, his class was solely based off his powerpoint notes and exams were very fair and not that hard if you studied. The lab practical was tough so definitely study hard for that. Actually try in lab because that actually brought my grade down rather than save it.
I don't want to say too much. Class is interesting. But this course ruined my interest on Biology.

Professor Chiucchi has definitely been one of the better professors I've had so far. He is a good, clear lecturer and has his notes up ahead of time. He is very fair and whenever there was an incorrect or debatable quiz or exam question, he was willing to look into it and give back points. He doesn't use the book at all, exam are based off notes.

Jimmy was a great professor. Funny and good looking. He never used the textbook and only tests you on notes FROM HIS LECTURE. He explains everything well and doesn't try to confuse you. All of his lectures (most of the time) were posted BEFORE lecture and he keeps them all on carmen throughout the entire semester. He uses clickers for points.
Great guy who loves his students and is very open to discussion, especially during lectures. Get to know him! Also an advisor, so he has a wealth of information even outside the realm of biology.

Dr. Chiucchi really cares about his student's learning and wanting them to succeed, but also understanding the subject. He's passionate in his lecture and makes attending lecture enjoyable, but it also helps that he's cute. The book is not really necessary, if you go to lecture and pay attention.

Dr. Chiucchi is a pretty laid back professor so the class is manageable. He is super funny and wants his students to succeed. Lecture is somewhat mandatory as you get clicker points but they're easy points to get
Fantastic professor, really clear and his exams are fair.  Basically doesn't use a book, but there really isn't a need for one.  One of my all time favorites.

Literally my favorite lecture. He is such a great teacher and honestly wants to help his students succeed. He makes sure that he covers everything on his exams and then makes the exams very fair. His questions are easy to understand and he doesn't try to trick students :)
He's based, but not the Based God. He is helpful, engaging, and brings laughter to class when it starts to get boring
Very clear, engaging, approachable, and funny.
Jimmy is amazing, uses clickers so need to go to class but i also found the questions helpful and engaging. He is super nice and also very cute!

He's a lab TA for Bio 113. Jimmy's very willing to help and always comes prepared. He's a nice guy and he's patient with his students. He's pretty laid back and relates to us well, but he definitely puts work before play. Good-looking guy with a pretty smile. He made lab enjoyable.

Every class he complained about something in his personal life via long petty rants. He would flirt with students making the class uncomfortable. Also, he was condescending when students asked questions instead of engaging in self-reflection regarding the nature of his job. He was commonly insecure, which had an obvious effect on his teaching.

The class structure made sense and was straight-forward, but I do not think he put much effort into the course material. His lecture slides were very basic and simple, not very interesting. Also, he talks very quickly and it is sometimes difficult to hear what he is saying.

Have him for GE launch seminar. Easy grader, pass/fail class. He kinda understands that no one really wants to take the GE seminar haha. He's funny, tells good anecdotes, although sometimes feels like I'm being indoctrinated. I'm pretty liberal and it still feels like he's trying to push me further left. Otherwise he's nice, would recommend.
Dr D is passionate about teaching. I enjoy his class, even though I struggle. Tests are difficult as well. He cares about us passing and doing well in his class.
He expects you to work but doesnt have unrealistic expectations. Pretty funny and gives good feedback

Hes a good person, however, hes a bad teacher. Exam questions dont even relate to exams. And homework doesnt even help you in studying for the exams. I am a Bio major and now Im even questioning my major. If you do take his class just drop for another teacher or another class.

Dr. D was a solid choice for this class. His exams werent that hard as long as you studied and asked questions just for any other course. He was generous and gave multiple opportunities for extra credit and giving points back on an exam. Stuck to the syllabus and was a laid back but respectful, professional guy.

He can be condescending at times, and it can be frustrating to get a clear answer. He isn't nearly as bad as people make him out to be, but he can be a handful. You need to take detailed notes - in some cases just printing diagrams from the powerpoints for your notebook - but it is doable with a minimal amount of effort.

Dr. D was a good professor, you had to study a lot to do good on the exams which is normal and expected for any college class. Did not give study guides though which was kind of annoying because half of the notes wouldn't be on the exams. Was sometimes hard to pay attention in lecture but other than that I had a good time in his class

Overall not bad but not awesome either. Does in class quizzes for grade. Exams are moderately difficult. The course material is hard but doable. lectures aren't awesome, but do attend. Funny guy. Wears nice shirts.

Tests were basically based on lectures (powerpoint slides). I had already taken AP Bio and therefore had read the Campbell book. All I did was study the slides--and easy A. He mumbles a lot, which gets annoying and confusing. Other than that, he's nice and funny, but tests are definitely a challenge. We had pop assignments in class so had to attend
Dr. D isn't for everyone, but I found him easy to connect to and laid back. He's helpful and cares about your understanding of information.
tough professor,much better than hopper though

Dr. D is great at lecturing. I know people disagree with me, but I found that he explains things clearly. I know he mumbles but he tries not to. I recorded his lectures so that helped. His tests are based off his slides and lectures. Clicker questions were helpful and he put them on his tests. I got Bs on his exams while Weinstein, I got Ds.

He was good at first although he mumbles and doesn't always explain everything clearly. Clicker questions are used as attendance for 1 point a day. Quizzes are easy as all questions can be found online on Quizlet. Exams are out of control. 60% average with NO CURVE. Find another prof if you can.

I never take the time to do these reviews, but this one was necessary. If you ever get Dr. D'Orazio as a professor.. RUN. Drop the class while you can. His tests were unbearably hard and he made you feel like an idiot when asking questions. I am an A student and have never struggled with a class as much as this one.

Dr. D'Orazio ruined Biology.  First off, in lecture, you cant understand a damn word he says.  He mumbles.  His material is poorly explained.  His tests are basically impossible.  Run, run far way and do not look back.  I should have listened.  No matter how hard you study, the potential for an F is always a possibility.

Lectures covered surface while tests asked for much more detailed information. Definitely want to read and re-read textbook, though certain information was only mentioned in class. Man is also a fitness buff, so if it relates to muscles or health, take a note and star it. It will be on exam. Try to find more difficult problems than are in textbook.

Dr. D'Orazio was an extremely difficult professor. I found this class even harder than chemistry not because of the material, but because of how it was taught. If you do not read the textbook you will not get anything better than average on a test. The class averages were around a 60-65 where other sections were around a 75-80. Unnecessarily hard.

Dr. D'Orazio had bad ratings, and he admitted that he had changed due to the ratings. I definitely loved him as professor. He had lectures that were easy to follow. I did not even try to learn but the way he taught engaged me. His clicker questions were great and he even used some on his exams. I did not touch the book and got Bs on my exams.

His lectures are confusing. He will tell you that you don't need to know certain things for exams that are in his powerpoint, and skip through multiple slides. The material itself is not the difficult part, it's just poorly taughtorganized. He will tell you that you don't need the book but if you want higher than a C you better have it.

D'Orazio is a pretty tough professor. He knows what he's talking about and expects everyone to know everything. He can be jerk at times. Take pics of the clicker questions because they are not available to you and may show up on exams. Overall, this class was challenging and harder than an intro level bio class should be.

Not the worst professor I've had, but definitely challenging. Attendance is mandatory and recording lectures is helpful  since he moves through the material fast and mentions small details that will be on an exam. Listen to lectures and go though the book. The class not impossible. Also, don't be afraid to ask for clarification on an exam.
He mumbles and talks extremely fast so it's difficult to understand. He offers no help and expects an illogical amount of effort from the students. If you get this professor run away.

Dr. D is one of the tougher professors I've had. He is very passionate about what he teaches. In my experience, if you need help in the class, just ask him and he can be very helpful! He does require a lot of work and effort out of his students.
He taught the first half of class. He mumbles a lot and quizzes/exams are way harder than anything he goes over in lecture. Mostly read the book. No curve.
Worthless. Exams were hard, unclear, averaged between 60-70 and no curve. The course coordinator amy kulesza was also very unhelpful. Neither cares to see you succeed. Avoid at all costs

Just don't. Seriously the worst professor I've ever had. You can't understand what he's saying, he goes through slides ridiculously fast, and his tests are so much harder than an intro level bio classes tests should be. He's also rude and condescending towards students and in general. Hate him, and because of him I now hate biology as well.
I would avoid this professor if you can, his tests are ridiculously difficult and I honestly loved biology before this class.

I loved bio coming into this class, but he managed to make me hate it. He words his exam questions horribly and expects you to remember tiny details. He'll go through a ton of unnecessary information in the grand scheme of things. Nothing stuck and it was really a waste of time. Study his slides and maybe get some back up from the textbook.
cannot understand what he is saying lecture, isn't clear, doesn't annunciate. just reads from the slides. exams are 10x harder than clicker questions

This is the worst professor I've ever had. He is unclear, fast paced and doesn't answer your questions. He's rude. He doesn't give resources to study from either. Clicker questions are not available unless you take a picture of the slides. I hate him.

Very uninspiring. Does not explain topics clearly, if at all... You will be reading every textbook chapter for specific details. Exam averages ranged 65-73 for my section with NO CURVE. He is very condescending. Related asexual reproduction to Peyton Manning.
Not a good professor. You can't hear him during lecture and you basically only learn from the textbook. One kid tried to ask a question during class and D'Orazio made him feel like an idiot.

He is very interested in the material, but also expects a LOT from students. Attendance might not be mandatory, but clicker questions are heavily used. If you don't read the chapter prior to class, then it can be difficult to get them correct. He isn't the easiest grader and exams require a lot of application of concepts; you can't just memorize.
Anthony was a super hard professor! He assumed everyone understood the material. His test questions were super hard and complicated.

make sure you read the textbook and assigned chapters prior to going to class.  you'll need to buy a clicker.  he does clicker questions everyday so you must attend.  he doesn't really answer questions, he just says "it's in the book". he's a cool guy and easy to talk to, but not the best teacher

Cool guy, but I had I hard time understanding him during lecture. I think his mike was too low? He uses clicker questions a lot and they are for POINTS so attend class! Also, he posts online notes that you can fill in during lecture which is nice. But, seriously, READ THE BOOK. The class is fast paced!
Very interactive, and helpful. Some people say he is a hard grader, but he uses mostly scantron so he grades very fairly in my opinion. He does not get off track often and when he does its about bio.
He sucks on grading!! I advice you not to take him.

Anthony is a cool guy, but sometimes is a little rough on grading, but usually fair. Assignments sometimes aren't clear, but overall not terrible. Not awesome at explaining things, but he tries. Not recommended for intro classes, but fine for advanced.
Anthony seemed to care more about talking about his muscles and crazy diets than anything else. He was way too tough a grader for a freshman bio class, but at least he answered questions.

Nice guy, but a really tough grader. Probably a little too tough a grader for a freshman bio class. To his credit, he is very good about answering questions and helping students out with the material.

Anthony is actually a really nice guy, and is genuinely interested in helping you learn, even though he looks scary. He grades very hard, but the key is to not be afraid to ask him for help/questions. He will go out of his way to help you understand concepts, and that way you can score well on the assignments, because you actually get them.
I liked Anthony. He is sort of intimidating at first, but he really wants students to learn and is very willing to help you and answer any questions.
He runs lab well, and he is very helpful is there is something you don't understand.  Don't be scared to ask questions, because even though he looks kind of scary, he's not!
Great teacher very down to earth and is very approachable if you have questions.

Anthony is a good TA. He wants to run class with an iron fist which is cool cause he's a alright guy. He keeps your focus with fear and intimidation. His biceps which need a larger shirt scare me to death and everyone but he's a cool guy
Pretty helpful and knowledgeable. Kinda of intimidating though
No Comments
He's a great lab TA.  Knows his biology and is always willing to help.

Love this TA! The class is somewhat difficult because the writing must be done in a specific way, but the directions are usually clear. It was a little hard to adjust to her grading, but she gives so much feedback that you improve really quickly if you listen to her advice. Study guides are provided so you will be fully prepared for any lab tests:)

Very fun and goofy lectures. I admittedly already knew the material from a previous course by coincidence, but I was still interested and engaged regardless. You can really tell he loves what he does and he is a very caring professor.
Dr. Chordas is an engaging prof who makes lectures fun. Exams focus on lecture notes, so staying on top of those is key. unstuckstudy was a huge help for study prep.

This man is hilarious!! His lectures are so easy to follow he keeps things fun yet gets straight to the point. He allows you to vote if you want collaborative quizzes and also has you vote on how the exam is set up. Attendance isn't completely necessary in my opinion but I did go to all of his lectures just because he was so easy to follow TAKE HIM

Certified Yapper, is what I call him, but ties it into the subject well. Material is easy and the exams are easy (read the slides!). Literally did a poll in the beginning so we could choose basically the entire grading criteria. Pretty awesome guy! Attendance not 100% mandatory but you will have to go a decent amount to maintain a good grade.

Dr. Steve is an amazing professor. He made our 80 minute lectures entertaining with his comedy. The exams are very straightforward and only relies on his lecture notes. The only downside to this class is a lot of points being from lab. If you get a TA who's a tough grader it is difficult to keep an A in the class without doing well on exams.
Dr. Chordas is an amazing professor.  His exams are 100% based on lecture material which is easy to remember if you pay attention.
This is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. The class breakdown is very nice and he always brings in stories about his life and keeps the course interesting.

Dr. Chordas is a great person and professor. He is very goofy and will not hesitate to crack jokes during lecture and does a great job of keeping his students engaged. He allowed us to vote on how we wanted the final and in class assignments to be set up which was very nice. I would 1000% recommend Dr. Chordas.
His lectures are entertaining specially when he relates lessons to his entomology research. Try on Packback, reading quizzes, and exams and you'll be fine.

Dr. Chordas was amazing, such a nice professor who had interesting lectures. At the beginning of the semester, he asks you how you would like to be graded and the majority rules. Would take again, great teacher and course.

Did well in Bio1113, expected this class to be easier. Dr. Chordas himself is a fantastic lecturer and his exams aren't difficult at all, but the lab portion of the class was incredibly tough for some reason. If your TA is not lenient when grading your lab worksheets you are going to be in for a tough time for this class. Be prepped for lab.

Such a chill class. Would recommend taking his class if you don't like science but need the credit. Attendance for lectures is required but the lectures can be very entertaining. Students are also allowed to work together on reading quizzes and there are only 3 quizzes.

Chordas is a great lecturer and loops his own experience into each lecture so it makes sense. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't go off of slides or record lectures so if you don't go you could miss things. Very funny and likes to make class fun even though its over boring topics.

Dr. Steve is a great teacher. He encourages his students to work together on quizzes and class assignments. He let us vote on the point distribution and how we wanted the final formatted. Very personable and humorous. Also cares a lot about the students that make an effort.
Dr. Chordas is very passionate in teaching and tries to make lectures as interesting and engaging as possible.

He is so engaging and genuinely loves teaching students about nasty ticks and mosquitoes. You would think learning about bugs is boring, but he makes it so interesting that you can't help but listen when he is speaking even if you are not fully paying attention. Exam was not bad at all. Just pay attention in lecture and you will be fine.

I seriously loved Steve and his class! His lectures were so interesting and made it very easy to learn and digest the material. Exams were pretty straightforward as well, no trickery. I wish I could go back and take this class again!
Super nice and has cool work experiences that he shares in class. The class can be a little unorganized but it doesn't matter because it's super chill. Enjoyed him and the course.
Class was easy but his exam was closed note and pretty hard. Encouraged students to work together but was an online class.
If Easy A was a person it'll be Stephen Chordas. Let that sink in well

Chordas was definitely the easier of the 2 professors that you get for this course. The lectures did not seem to interest me at first, but I quickly got drawn into them because I believe Dr Chordas has a great way of delivering them. The questions on quizzes and the exam was very clear and there were no trick questions. Watch lectures and get an A.

Bio 3401 is a 2 module class. Dr Chordas taught the first module on vector borne diseases. The content is very interesting despite learning a lot about mosquitoes. Take good notes on the lectures and you will be fine. He does not make questions to trick you and as long as you put in a little effort and complete the assignments you'll get an A.

Dr. Chordas is such a down to earth and humble professor. Everytime you email him, he is so nice and gentle. His lectures are amazing and his exam can be a little confusing but all you need to is to go to his lectures and take good notes. Also, he is so helpful outside of class. I wish I could take all my classes with him.

At the beginning of class, he lets us selected how we want to be graded so that's nice. Coming to class is encouraged because his lecture notes are kind of bare so it's easy to miss important information. You can tell he is passionate about the topics and he cracks jokes often. In-class quizzes and assignments are very similar to the exam
Steve is a legend 100% would recommend. He gives me the willpower to continue with a BS in biology.

He truly cares about his students, very straightforward, makes material concise and easy and fun. You know exactly what you need to do to get an A and it isn't hard. He's also hilarious and makes it interesting, but if you don't come to lecture you won't get the material.
Best professor at OSU, let students vote for class set up. Very straight forward grading. Go to class.

Dr. Chordas was the best professor I ever had at Ohio State. He is incredibly enthusiastic, he finds a relatable way to understand concepts and has an awesome sense of humor making it easy to look forward to lecture. You are doing yourself a disservice not to attend lecture.

Dr. Chordas is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is so down to earth and loves teaching and inspiring students. His section was so much fun and he could make any subject interesting. You got to choose all aspects of the class (test format and quiz format etc). Dr. Chordas never failed to put a smile on my face. He's amazing!
Very funny and made those 3 hour lectures a breeze and entertaining.
Awesome instructor! His quirky stories allow you to be relaxed an enjoy his lectures. Would recommend doing all the assigned "homework." Almost guaranteed to get perfect scores if you attempt it.

Very down to Earth. Always there to help you. His class is fairly easy. Just do the assignments, and you'll guarantee to get good grade. Not to mention his exam is super easy. Go to class because most of the assignments and quizzes are done in class.

AWESOME. Best professor I've had yet at OSU after 3 years. He makes information easy to understand at all levels and interesting no matter what you're learning about. Very helpful and very friendly when approached. Wish I could take another class with him!

It's been 2 semesters since I've had Stephen Chordas but man was he a great professor! He was very relatable and didn't sound like some stuck up science professors we have around here.  His class was a breeze. I barely had used my book.

Dr. Steve's portion of the class was super easy. Show up to class for the pop group work for participation points. My only complaints were that the class had a lot of worksheets and in class group work, which gets tedious. I also wasn't a fan of all his long winded stories, but most people think they're hilarious.

Dr. Steve is great. He is funny and he knows what he is talking about. There are pop quizzes throughout the semester so attending lecture every day is highly recommended. He is very engaging and kept me interested throughout his lectures.

Dr. Chordas is a really engaging teacher. He is so excited about the subject matter and it makes it easy to stay interested in the class. He would go above and beyond to help any student and helped me to secure a research position with the government. I would take any class that he teaches.

Funny, knowledgeable, easy going. This prof. makes Biology super interesting. I would recommend this class to anyone. His lectures are fascinating and relevant. Enjoyed every class. Attendance is not mandatory but I strongly recommend it because there are pop quizzes which are easy if you take notes. Class power-points are posted on Carmen.

Dr. Chordas is my favorite professor of the semester.  He makes his lectures interesting and very entertaining.  He's very clear to understand.  You need to go to class though, he does pop quizzes, his notes are not online, and we do not go with the book (don't even buy it).  I'd definitely take more classes from him.

Steve's lectures were to the point and entertaining. He tried to get a class of 200+ as involved as possible. He does not give study guides for exams so you have to learn all material on lecture slides. That being said, he is very clear of what topics are being tested over. Come to lecture because there are pop quizzes. BAD HAIR.

Dr. steve was probably one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He made things easy to learn and so interested to listen to. He is always very friendly and helpful when asked. If you get a chance to take a class with him, snatch it up!! (hotness rating because of the sick waterfall mullet)

If you need to get your Bio Gen Ed out of the way, take 1102. Steve is my favorite professor this semester. He does a good job making the lectures interesting. He gives out pop quizzes, but they're very straight forward. Exams are not too difficult. Not textbook needed. If you go to lecture, take good notes, and study for exams, you'll do well.

Steve was awesome, if you participate then you will do well. Pop quizzes but you did them with the whole class, so pretty darn easy. He also gave all the assignments the 1st day, so you had plenty of time to do them.
Book not needed. Lectures are entertaining. Pop quizzes are easy if you pay attention in lecture. Take this class with Dr Steve, you won't regret it.

He's awesome. Makes lectures super stimulating and is extremely helpful if you reach out to him. He also really considers the students and lets you vote on a lot of aspects of the class. His personal stories make the class easy to pay attention too. Take all assignments seriously though!!

Best hair on campus. Seriously he is still rocking a mullet so clearly a chili pepper for this dude. Also the best teacher I've ever had. He cares about the material, provides excellent examples, tells personal and relevant stories about the material and teaches it well. Take this class to fulfill your gen eds. You will not regret it.

This guy is great. I wish he was here for the whole semester. He explains things so wonderfully you'll remember what you learned in class and won't need to take too many notes. Very entertaining guy. The labs are never related to lecture though.
Dr Steve is amazing and very helpful. He makes his lectures funny and interesting. One thing about this course, take all the assignments seriously including the exams.
Funny guy. Open to any and all questions. Makes class enganing and worthwhile.

My favorite professor at Ohio State. Makes lectures interesting, funny, and his tests are fair=if you study you will do well. Very easy to get an A in the class if you do all the HW and go to class and take notes. TAKE HIME!!!!

Best Professor at OSU. Every time I asked him a question after class he explained it really well. He was so laid back and funny. A lot of professors are a bit intimidating but with him it was completly different. His exams and quizes are very fair!
Amazing Professor, he's very helpful, kinda funny in a cute way. Fav class of the semester! If you have him, you will love Bio!!!!
Awesome professor! Classes weren't too difficult and he was hands down my favorite professor at OSU. I definitely recommend this GEC.

Chordas is one of the best professors if not the best I have ever had at osu. Keeps lectures interesting and makes you enjoy bio. I don't like science at all and I liked coming to his class. Easy A and you will actually learn a lot more than you would if he made mad the class difficult. Hes also a very funny guy.

BIO 101 with Steve Chordas was one of the easiest classes I've taken at Ohio State. The one project he assigns is a cake-walk. I got a B- while I had mono and literally slept through 5 quizzes and didn't do a single thing. Unless you come down with an energy-killing disease that wrecks you, expect an A.
Steve was awesome. If you went to class you got an A.
Steve was awesome. His lectures were interesting and I still remember all of his funny stories. He wins for telling the most stories about his wife. Definitely a professor to have
Dr Steve is amazing. He makes you interested in Biology and his stories stick with you through college. I still remember random things biological because I'll remember a story he told us.
Easily one of the best professors. I hated bio but man he makes you want to come to lecture! DO NOT TAKE BIO WITH ANYONE ELSE!
Dr. Steve was great!  You will get an easy A if you attend lecture and DO your work!!  If not...you won't!  Pretty simple..huh?
Chordas was so cool and easy A.
Great lecturer.  I enjoyed lectures.  Would highly recommend.
I absolutely loved Chordas! His jokes are hilarious and he does an incredible job making the class interesting and interactive.

Dr. Steve is an excellent lecturer. I wish he could lecture all my classes - he's funny, he explains thing incredibly clearly, and he's definitely motivated about teaching and helping students.  Don't buy the book -- completely useless. He even puts copies on reserve at the library.
super funny and is always telling stories that relate to what we're talking about. even in a lecture of 200+ people, we can still still ask lots of questions and interact.
Dr. Chordas is a great lecturer, I haven't missed a class. He's funny, tells hilarious stories and is friendly and entertaining. Class material is super easy and well-paced.
Dr. Steve teaches in a very laid back atmosphere.  Lots of great information given in an easy to understand manner. He gets an A.
He was a great teacher! I hate Biology and he made it bearable!

Dr. Steve was great!  This class was easy but very interesting and helpful. Take the class and with the professor.  He is funny, loves the material, teaching and life! One of my favorite teachers so far.

He's the funniest professor ever! Always interesting, cracks jokes constantly to keep the course material bearable (which is not bad, just basic biology, you probably learned it in high school). I would definitely recommand this prof!!!
Awesome! Need I say more? Dude, Dr. Steve is the SHIZNAT!
Great teacher. Communicates very well with colorful and entertaining slides. Take him for an A
He was just the course coordinator for this course, but he was so helpful. You could go to his office hours and he would clarify everything the crazy lady teacher said.
He was really understandable and kept everything basic. Unannounced quizzes every couple classes that weren't too bad.  I would definitely recommend his class.
Very good professor class was pretty easy. Dr Steve understands its a GEC so he does not go much in depth and is very easy to do well.He does make lots of wife jokes but there not that bad
He is a very clear teacher

Dr. Chordas was by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. I never thought Biology could be so interesting, and he always throws in hilarious anecdotes to keep things going. Also the easiest class ever! TAKE HIM!

A gentleman and a scholar. Steve Chordas is the best professor I have ever had the pleasure of studying under. He was extremely thorough and clear, but his best quality is that he puts the students and keeps the class interesting and fair. Attendance shouldn't be an issue in this class because you'll actually look forward to his lecture/story time.
dr chordas was my prof. at columbus state. a great teacher for every one in the class.
I hope Dr. Steve checks this so he can see how awesome he is! This guy is what the other Ph.D's at OSU should emulate...class act, treats students FAIRLY, and just a happy go lucky kind of guy!
His attendance policy was not strict. You had to attend labs but lectures you did not. He would "take attendance" by having random-ish quizzes.

He is the only reason why I go to BIO. He is what the class needs to make it tolerable. The other professors are a train wreck!!! Only wish he taught a module too. Super great guy, likes the students. You can just tell he loves life and his job...unlike the rest who hate the world...and their students

One of the easiest classes I have taken so far at Ohio State.  He was interesting and made everything clear.  He also was pretty funny and made lots of jokes in class.  It's hard to get anything below an A in this class as long as you attend lecture.

great guy. He was the course coordinator for this class and was very clear in everything, was extremely helpful and understanding and just fantastic. Really balanced out the poor quality of the other teachers in this class and made this class somewhat enjoyable and worth going to. Fantastic course coordinator and is exactly what we needed.

Dr. Steve is the best Bio 101 teacher ever! Attendance is not mandatory but if you attend lecture you will do well. He is funny and interesting and plays not tricks, its an easy A if you go to class and take notes. This was one of my best classes so far.
He is so funny! I find biology interesting, but HIS teaching of the class made me actually enjoy the subject and the class. Plus he's just really nice and a very easy prof.
One of THE easiest classes I have taken so far. If you want an A+ take this class!

Awesome professor! If you can get this guy for biology, definitely go for it. His classes are easy, he's always ready to help, and he keeps the class fun and entertaining. Also, if you're not the biggest fan of science, this is the class to take. He recognizes that most people are in there just for the GEC req.
He's a genuinely nice guy.  Makes lectures very fun and interesting.
Great teacher. ery easy class. Pay attention and you will do well. I was in the class with a 100 on the midterm. AMAZING.
Awesome teacher!!!!
A+ professor. Class was very interesting. Tests and quizes are very easy. This is the man you want for Biology.

Best Professor Ever! I actually looked forward to going to his class. He explains things very well and throws in funny jokes to keep it interesting. Definitely take this class...you will be glad you did.
No Comments
He is soo awesome! He makes lecture actually enjoyable and I look forward to going! He'e hilarious too.
Take this class!! If you don't you will regret it! Its so easy

I love it! He makes the class easy and enjoyable, I don't totally dread going to the class.  He makes the notes fun and short which def makes it easy to remember.  He gives quizzes, so going to lecture is a good idea so you don't miss one, but they are straight forward and directly from the notes. Def take him, he's awesome!!!

He is a great guy, his jokes are kind of ridiculous but, still, very fun-loving. The class was really easy because he is very understanding of college students and what to expect from us. There are no outragous assignments, and his lectures are very clear so that you sort of just... remember.
The best professor in the world. Take him.

Unbelievable guy! Just gave 650 kids in my Biology lecture 100% on their midterm exams just for showing up to class. Thats like 20% of our overall grade! He's a legend and if you don't take him your making a mistake!
Very good teacher! Funny, smart and really into what he does! Made me consider biology for a major!
This class was great. It was really easy. Dr. Chordas helps out alot makes class really interesting. Also tells wife jokes

Great class! Biology 101 with Dr. Chordas is easy, humorous, and even somewhat enjoyable! He has a great sense of humor and relates many bio. topics to personal stories (which often involve his wife!) Exams are extremely straightforward, as are pop quizzes. Wants you to succeed! Highly recommend this course!
The absolute best teacher ever!! He is so entertaining, funny and energetic! Class was a breeze, very straightforward! TAKE HIM! You'll love his class!

He makes Bio fun and there were times I was actually looking forward to class.  Very easy to understand and the exams are not hard whatsoever.  Also, he is very easy going when it comes to questions or responses

Doctor Chordas is by far the best science teacher I have ever had... Maybe one of the best intro instructors I have ever had! He uses real-life examples that are interesting... Information you will actually USE! He's entertaining, smart, and honest. Take this class!!

Awesome professor. Easy A. 2 exams, which are barely any harder than the quizzes. The quizzes are extremely easy and the answers often follow a pattern, such as a b c d e aaaaa. One project, you get all quarter to do and it's easy and counts for as much as an exam. TAKE THIS CLASS!
Easy and fun.  Biology can be interesting with this guy.

Professor Chordas is one of the best I've had! I hate science and he made it a fun class, very funny guy. Doesn't talk down to you, very approachable. Do not take any other proffesor! Class isn't mandatory but there are pop quizzes. Book isn't necessary either. This class should have been an easy A but I got high C due to myself!
GREAT GREAT GREAT PROFESSOR!!! I hate science and he made it fun and interesting. Loved going to class!!! Dr. Chordas is the best!

Great Professor! comes across very clear and does not teach you boring stuff you don't need to know. Would recommend going to class, tells hilarious wife jokes and tells you exactly what you need to know.  Do not buy book! you need to only read short pieces and can go the library to do so. Great class, very easy A

Great class! I was worried about this class- a long class and about science! Ugh! Don't worry! Flew by and had fun! Notes are online! Never a dull moment! Learned a lot and use the info in my other science class from his notes! Luved the class! Best prof!

It is the best class with the the best prof. I was worried about this class- a long class and about science! Don't worry! Flew by and had fun! Notes are online! Never a dull moment! Learned a lot and use the info in my other science class from his notes! Luved the class! Best prof!
Great professor! Makes a long night of lecture entertaining. Has many hilarious stories about his wife. Overall cool dude.

Good professor for a long night lecture.  I hated biology in high school but consider it tolerable now.  If you have taken any chem class at osu you will notice that they treat you like babies in the labs.  Bio101 is so much easier than chem101.

Has slides posted on carmen with some blanks to fill in during lecture.  4 best of 5 pop quizes. Labs are boring but easy, research assignment is easy and can be done in one night.  midterm and final are straight from notes.  likes to put "words" in Matching and quizes like, NOBIGDEALK or DECAF...look for those, go to reviews, easy A.  great prof!
what a professor ! take his class !!

Dr. Steve is awesome. He makes the 3 hour long lecture go by so fast --- he's really fun and makes biology interesting, his tests are what 101 level tests should be, definately take his class if possible.
If anyone needs to fulfill a science GEC requirement at Ohio State. I highly recommend taking Bio. 101 with Chordas.
If you want to know how to make Biology fun ask Steve Chordas.

Chordas is the best professor I've ever had. He is super cool, and tells jokes all the time. I love to go to his lectures even though they last till late night. The only bad thing about this class is the Lab, which I feel boring and not really helpful. But that again could be the problem of my TA.
You the man, Steve!!!
Definitely recommend taking his class and going to his review sessions for the exam ;)
GREAT! PROF. Cool Guy! Love the stories. And he keeps it REAL. I am a non traditional student and I would recommend this class to anyone that has been out of school for a long time.
Steve is pretty amazing! He made  a GEC interesting. I would recommend him for bio 101. Library project is a pain, but it is easy

Great Professor if you just want to get biology out of the way. Short, clear lectures and his jokes are pretty funny. His final was awesome b/c most q's had an outrageous answer that makes you laugh, which is a nice help during a bio final. His fu man chu is almost as cool as his mullett too. Oh, and labs are a joke.
He is a great professor, prob. my favorite so far at OSU! He is really great, and the tests are not hard!! He has a review.
Made learn FUN

He is a great teacher! He understands that his students are not bio majors and relates the lectures to things that will affect you, they are interesting.  REALLY EASY.  the library project was an easy 100 pts and if you do the labs you will get an A
I LOVED him! Great Teacher :)
All around a great guy, exams are easy, and classes are usually interesting and funny
I usually struggle with science, but this class was so easy.  He keeps it basic and is able to relate to his students.  I would advise taking Bio 101 with him!

Dr. Steve is an extremely nice guy, who goes out of his way to help students. He actually remembers when he was a poor student with bad professors so he's strives to do well. VERY FAIR TESTS. Also has very amusing stories which are related to material. I didn't think I'd take anything away from this class, but I did. He's a great prof.

Dr. Steve is an extremely nice guy, who goes out of his way to help students.  He actually remembers when he was a poor student with bad professors so he's strives to do well.  VERY FAIR TESTS.  Also has very amusing stories which are related to material.  I didn't think I'd take anything away from this class, but I did.  He's a great prof.

If ur good @ memorizing.Take this class!Because that is all u have to do for the exams.He is a great great prof-helpful,patient,and wants u to get that A.Bonus pts are everywhere.Only recommendation i can give u is pick the right TA(that is the key)Get that A in the lab and ur set.The rest as i said is straight up memorization.JUST LIKE THAT- A

If ur good @ memorizing.Take this class!Because that is all u have to do for the exams.He is a great great prof-helpful,patient,and wants u to get that A.Bonus pts are everywhere.Only recommendation i can give u is pick the right TA(that is the key)Get that A in the lab and ur set.The rest as i said is straight up memorization.JUST LIKE THAT- A

This guy is the greatest, he wants students to do well so he makes the class easy.  As long as you go to the majority of the classes and study a little bit, you're guaranteed an A.  SOOO much easier than any other bio teacher!
Had a good time in class, though lectures are long and boring...If you take it at night he WILL keep you til 9

one of the easiest classes i've taken!! his lectures aren't boring, he keeps your attention and makes it interesting by making it simple, explaining everything, and telling jokes and stories. he tells you what to study for the exams, and his tests are super easy. he gives tons of bonus. and puts almost half the notes online... take this class!!!!!!

Dr. Steve is a smart man with three PhDs! Don't let that scare you; he is very clear in lecture. I hate Biology, I'm all about the social sciences, but Dr. Steve made Biology tolerable and do-able. The tests are a little hard because there's so much information you have to know/memorize, but the questions aren't trick questions. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Dr. Steve is a smart man with three PhDs! Don't let that scare you; he is very clear in lecture. I hate Biology, I'm all about the social sciences, but Dr. Steve made Biology tolerable and do-able. The tests are a little hard because there's so much information you have to know/memorize, but the questions aren't trick questions. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Dr. Steve is the man. He tells you exactly what you need to know for exams and is one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. His sense of humor makes lecture enjoyable, and he usually lets you out of very eary. This guy is a great professor.
Awesome teacher all around.  Made learning fun!  Didn't make you learn things you would never need to know in life.  Extremely helpful.  You have no idea until you take his class!
Excellent professor with a wonderful sense of humor. Precise in explanation, helpful in every sense of the word.
Comprehensive class, but he took out the fluff and it was nice and easy.
I would definitly take another class of his.
Cool Professor. If you attend class, you can get an A. He is a nice guy and tries to be funny, which he is most of the time. He does NOT have a chip on his shoulder. Fun class

Dr. Steve, you don't have to call him dr., was a really good professor. SOOO much better than Prof. Rissing who also teaches Bio 101. He was sort of boring but he put his lectures, most of them, on WebCT for us.  Overall, I really liked his class.

For me the lectures were impossibly boring. His jokes were so lame too. His tests are pretty easy though. Usually they spell something. If you like men that have mullets and bash their wives then take this class. If you hatelate night classes then don't.
Made lecture fun to go to, which was a plus. Tests are not hard, and half the final is exactly the midterm. He usually gives hints answers on the quizzes (abcde or all b's, etc.).

Good lecturer, even though the talks were somewhat boring.  He did make an effort to make the class interesting, and that's why I did well.  He's easy to understand and comfortable to talk to.  Knows his stuff, and has a sense of humor.
Steve is a really great teacher!  I'm planning on taking his 102 when it's offered!
Easy to understand and very helpful yet doesn't go into too much detail in non-major courses because he believes that should be saved for major courses, also a pretty funny guy when he wants to be:)
No Comments
No Comments

I cant recommend enough! If you do the work and show up for discussions you will not miss any points. Exams are take home, homework is light, and the class is neat. I think really great movies were chosen and I have been able to remember/learn all the content really easily by being able to see it incorporated in film. Dr. W is passionate & great

Evan is a sweet man, decent lecturer and tries hard to give his students a good experience.  But he was so in over his head at times. Told us grading would take 1 week, in reality it took 6ish weeks. Also, his test questions suck and are made unnecessarily hard with weird wording and qualifiers. He would be awesome if he was more straightforward.

Dr. W makes this class way too hard for an intro bio class. I have friends taking the same course with other professors who have much better understanding of the material and their grades are much higher. Evan is kind of all over the place and his exams are MUCH harder than they need to be. There are constantly assignments to do. Lots of work.
Good professor but an unnecessary amount of work for a GE. Exams arent easy either.

Interesting professor but exams are extremely difficult. There are a lot of assignments to help boost your grade, but the lectures can be a bit disorganized as well so it's hard to know what is going to be on the exams.

Dr. Waletzko is clearly passionate about what he teaches, but often struggles to get his point across. Lectures are a bit unorganized. There are several errors in slides and even exams. TopHat is used every lecture. Grades exams toughly, and multiple choice questions are weighted extremely high for no reason (3+ points per question).

Evan Waletzko is passionate and dedicated to what he teaches, and tries his best to make lecture somewhat enjoyable. On the other hand, class participation is huge and he is a tough grader for no reason. His lecture is EXTREMELY unorganized and tends to get off topic frequently. This GE credit harder than it should be.

Dr. W is a funny guy who is passionate about what he teaches. He can be disorganized at times, but he gets the point across. He is fond of daily TopHats so it's worth attending class. Also, he tends to dance around on the lecture stage a lot, sometimes without shoes, so he's pretty entertaining.

Awesome professor that kept lectures extremely interesting. Sometimes would jump around from topic to topic but syllabus clearly explains what topics the class was discussing. Exams can be an easy A if you read the textbook and go through the top hat questions. Also super helpful one-on-one if you need individual help.

His lectures were informative and somewhat interesting. This class had split professors which didnt really allow time to get used to either teaching style. Class was just okay. Exams were similar/same as simutext and lecture based.

Inspiring professor, interesting lectures. Required to show up at least 80% of time to get 100% on participation. Interactive lectures. Some easy extra credit ops to raise grade by half a letter grade. Two exams and final make up only 30% of grade so focus on labs and homework grades especially. Exams are wordy and confusing, so don't rely on them.

Evan is such a good Professor! I really enjoyed his class. His lectures consist of slides he prepares but they are very interactive. He is such a funny guy that he makes the lecture bearable. Exams are pretty hard but he has sooo many grades. If you do the reading, show up for all your lectures, and labs along with putting in some effort, A.
I made this solely to express how hot he is
Great class! He cares about his students and is passionate about biology.

This class has been awful. The amount of work between the online homework and projects for lab is insane. I spend at least 15+ hours a week just on the homework and projects and then add in the studying. Lectures are boring. Attendance is mandatory. The online homework/textbook is hard and makes losing points easy. I would absolutely not recommend.

Would not recommend Dr. Waletzko or Ecology to anyone trying to satisfy a biology lab requirement. There is excessive amounts of work required for this class, beyond the norm. Homework is due before each lecture, attendance is mandatory, there is lab work and a very time consuming semester long group project. Avoid if at all possible.
Evan was not the easiest class but I learned a lot from his class, exams get much harder from the first one and no curve is given but plenty of extra credit is offered to boost your grade
Tests were way too hard and harshly graded for a GE.  No curve.  He's a very nice guy but take with a different prof if you don't want a gen ed to hurt your GPA
Harsh/critical grading makes this GE course difficult.  Very particular about assignments and lectures are somewhat confusing

BIO 1101 is way more difficult than it should be with this professor. This class should be an easy GE for non-bio majors but the exams are very difficult and grading on everything is very high-expectation. Don't take this class if you don't have to. However, Evan is a nice guy and gives you all the slides, and attendance isn't mandatory.

Great Guy, awesome to have conversation with outside the classroom, very interesting and extremely intelligent. Transfers that to the class room and is very helpful and fair, I would highly recommend him.
He was really nto helping students, and would never glaze over an answer to a question from a student.

Professor Weinstein's class is challenging, but with discipline and tools like Unstuck study, you can succeed. The exams are tough, but extra credit opportunities help offset the difficulty. Stay engaged in class, and you'll learn a lot.
He got fired over spring break!

This is a tough class overall. Going to lecture is important. Exams are tough, but there is a test bank for every exam. Do them multiple times and you should be okay on the exams. Cumulative final. Weinstein isn't a very good teacher in my opinion. Class is unorganized with an ungodly amount of slides per chapter. Take with someone else if you can.

Go to lecture and participate for easy extra credit. Exams are tough but you have access to the test bank before hand. Do multiple practice exams to prepare. Pay attention in lecture as some of the extended response questions will be from lectures right before the exam

Dr. Weinstein is such a fun, whimsical guy. Unfortunately, his exams are often impossibly difficult. My advice would be to take advantage of the extra credit as much as possible. Absolutely participate in class often, and prepare for exams well ahead of time.

Nice guy, wants students to do well, lots of extra credit, and he makes lecture engaging and entertaining. HOWEVER, his exams are completely impossible, his emails can be blunt and condescending, and he can cross a few lines. HOWEVER, his class is very manageable and if you participate just enough, you will surely get at least a B.

Dr. Weinstein is a nice guy and I think he means well but his class is very difficult. The material isn't the problem it's the lack of time between modules. 4 module exams and a cumulative final. He does give out a lot of extra credit but you have to participate to get it. You pretty much have to teach yourself the material.

offensive: called classmate uni-bomber
bonus points for dumb things (being a mom, being in the hospital years ago, and being a clicker/scroller on the computer so he can run around the room during in-class activities)
Talks loudly during exams
Does not let you finish your question - interrupts with an answer of what HE THINKS you are going to ask.

Dr. Weinstein's lectures are way too fast and its difficult to tell which topics are important. He provides very little study materials for his exams, just a bank of questions that don't tell you if you answered them correctly. He refuses to go over student's questions if they are too complex/time consuming. Take this class with someone else.
THE WORST EVER

He has good intentions, but he is incredibly out of touch with the students he teaches. Made several incredibly inappropriate analogies/statements during lectures that made many students uncomfortable. He had little structure to the class and apologized profusely, then proceeded to do the same things over. Lectures are useless but mandatory.

Dr. Weinstein started the semester on the right foot, communicating well, creating a positive environment. Within a few weeks he slipped, but his response was something you won't find in any other professor. He wants everyone to pass and succeed. The reviews within the last few months are not accurate. This is a doable course with a kind professor.

He is knowledgeable. But unfortunately, I could not gain anything from him because I did not have a single minute to digest what he said in his lectures. I basically had to self-study through this course. It was extremely difficult.

The reviews below are completely correct. He may have once been a great professor, but he is no longer fit for the current generation of students...for multiple reasons. The class is disorganized and difficult as a result of his disconnect, but in fairness he tries his best. Unlike evil professors, he wants everyone to pass. I can appreciate this.

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had. I feel as though I have no idea what information I need to know because he speeds through everything and then ask the most in-depth fill in the blank with no word bank on exams. I would rather drop out of school than have to take this course with him again.

The most petty professor ever. The second masks got lifted he stopped doing zooms with no warning. Was very nice at the beginning of the term, but quickly started backtracking. Exams have little to do with textbook or lecture. No word bank and only fill in the blank exams. Do not take him.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Fails to communicate material in a proper manner. Fails to be considerate of students with extenuating circumstances. Fails to provide us with resources to do well in the course. Fails to prepare us for exams. Fails to educate as a professor. There is extra credit but it is insubstantial and uncontrollable
worst prof I have ever seen

Do not take him. For your own sanity and well being, do not take him as your professor. He knows the material and Im sure some people would thrive in this environment, but just the overall class was so unorganized and he was terrible at communicating. His exams were so hard and theres so much extra work that really isnt helpful at all.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR. Doesn't actually teach a single thing, but instead just reads the slides word for word and then asks insanely specific test questions about topics not discussed.  Attending lecture was a huge waste of time but was necessary because he does tophat questions (also unnecessarily difficult) for points.

He does this thing where he gives points out on Fridays to people who do outstanding work but if youre on the zoom and not in person you dont matter. Regardless of extenuating circumstances or that were in the midst of a pandemic. But its alright when he forgets things and screws up every few minutes. Easy class but take it with someone else.

The worst professor I've taken. Ever.
