Dr. Bell's lectures are incredibly boring and hard to follow. He goes off on a lot of tangents. He uses tophat for points every class.  He's questions are often poorly worded and most of the time you will never find out what the right answer is. He is incredibly unorganized. If I could do it again there is no way I would take this class.

Very poor lecturer, some of the information he gives is incorrect. Frequently asks TopHat questions, which more often then not, do not have the correct answer because of his typos. Often rambles about something and does a poor job explaining both concepts and relevant information.
He's terrible. Boring lectures and goes through notes as if you already know the material. Don't take his class.

Ryan is nice and laid back but he is also quite stubborn and unwilling to listen to any concerns raised about grades. The bio dept. has a system for lodging complaints but he is resistant to any kind of discussion about grades;as if he is taking it personally.Very disappointing coming from a dept. that prides itself in being systematic and logical.
Good TA.  Laid back and casual which is good when your lab is nearly 4 hours long.  Very willing to help out if you need it.  Ask him about spiders :)
Dr. F was very passionate about the knowledge in this class, but lectures could get boring at times. Almost half of the points came from in-class activities so be wary of that.

The materials in this class are easy. Dr. F is a decent lecturer but he is willing to go above and beyond to help students.  There are many assignments that can easy boost your grade. I got around B- on his first exam but still ended up with an A in the class. Must go to lecture! Assignments are done in lecture.
The class is not to difficult but he is not very clear what was going to be on exams.

Dr. Freudenstein is a pretty good professor. He loves orchids and always makes a mention of them, it's pretty cute how much he adores them. Very knowledgeable and approachable, fair exam questions, if somewhat picky. Being in class was absolutely essential, stay engaged and it's easy to do well. No textbook but readings are required.
I LOVE HIM HE IS THE CUTEST BOTANIST IN THE WORLD. LIKE, I CAN'T EVEN
The class is split between him and mark seeger. Seeger is terrible. Freudenstein was pretty good. Class was mandatory because there was a lgs form due pretty much every class. Good not great.

yes the class is difficult but if you show up, pay attention, and put in the work during lab time then you will succeed. the "text book" is a novel and the discussions are easy points. open note exams. recommend recording lectures. Slides are bare but the lecture is very informational. clear grading criteria and gives all the info needed for exams

The lectures are pretty interesting and Kevin is a great professor who truly cares about his students. Make sure you write down everything he says in class and take very very detailed notes. All of the questions on exams are straight from things he discusses in class. As well, draw detailed images in your notebook from various perspectives.

Kevin is a great professor and cares about each student's success in the course. The one thing I would say is to make sure to record every lecture. The take-home exams have a lot of questions that I would not have known without listening back to the recording. Take good notes and ask a ton of questions and you will be fine.

Really nice, reasonable guy, just make sure to write notes on anything and everything he says. Every quiz and assessment is open note, and there is no textbook, so if you miss something it's because you didn't write it down. He is more than willing to clarify and answer questions!
Took his course in part during the pandemic. Very caring and sweet person. Would absolutely love to learn from him again.

Kevin was a good professor and was very helpful in the specimen work. A lot of his test material was either briefly mentioned or not at all mentioned during lecture. However the last exam and final were much easier than the other exams.

Avoiding the fact that the class was online and the labs were in person this professor made his exams very inconsistent and he made Jeopardy and notebook checks for a grade rather than bonus. But dissecting animals was very interesting. Listen to professor's lectures, his lectures help out a lot.

He is a great guy, very kind, but he is not a great lecturer. The quizzes sometimes have questions that are based on random things that he does not mention in class, but he thinks you should just know them. Maybe a textbook would help. Practicals are fine for most part. I feel like the work I put in should receive an A. Quizzes weekly!

Dr. Lumney is extremely caring and EEOB 4510 is an amazing class. This was debatably my favorite science class at OSU. Make sure you enjoy taking notes and drawing. If you pay attention in class and take wonderful notes youll have minimal work outside of class.

Kevin is one of the best lecturers I've had at Ohio State. Exam questions can be specific but Kevin addresses them all directly in class. In opposition to what others have said, his questions DO NOT come out of the blue! Exams are open note- so take decent notes and draw good images for the practicals. This class should be a piece of cake!

Kevins class was great! I learned a TON and enjoyed the material. The exams are pretty tough; some questions come out of nowhere and the exams take about 2.5 hours to complete. You NEED to come to class in order to pass and you must take notes on literally every little thing he says in lecture. Overall, his class is tough but I learned SO much!

Kevin is a really nice and funny guy. His classes are cool- you get to dissect things, but the exams are extremely difficult. Timed practicals and extremely specific. If you SPELL something wrong you get the ENTIRE question wrong. No curve, and attendance is mandatory- you definitely can't miss more than the number allowed.

To get an A in this course, you have to write down everything he says in lecture. I mean absolutely everything. If you do and you have good organization skills and handwriting, the class should be a piece of cake. Format is open note, but questions can seem to come out of nowhere because it's difficult to anticipate what is important in lecture.

Kevin is great, he communicates everything super clearly and lets you use your notebook on the lab practical and written exams. As long as you go to class, listen to lectures, and draw really clear diagrams you should be good. He tells you to get 2 books but you really only need the lab manual for dissections, he goes over the content in lecture.

As people have said, the questions on his exam come out of nowhere! Even if you write down every single thing he says during lecture, you can still do bad on the exam. So to ace this class, get the old exams from the previous semesters! He reuses most of the old questions and that's the only way it's possible to get an A in this class.

I found this class challenging. Lecture exams counted for the majority of the overall grade so make sure you do the best you can. I made sure I had quality notes and I studied really hard for every exam but was still only getting C's on them. Pay attention & ask questions when you don't understand something right away. Doesn't curve the class.

I hesitated with tests are tough and tough grader. Tough grading could be my TA, but written portion of exams depends heavily on what he says during lectures and his slides are bare. Since the class is combined lec & lab, you have to show up anyway for dissections. Kevin is super nice and class is relaxed.

I LOVED the class. There is a lot of hands-on work that is very helpful. However, the exams were so out of nowhere. Even when I took really good notes during lecture & studied a good amount of time, I always ended up getting C's in the exams (which are about 3 hrs long). The way the exams are designed, it was nearly impossible to do excellent.

Kevin is a great teacher and a great guy. There is a quiz each week, which can be kinda tough because they're based both on lecture(which can be long, boring and hard to pay attention to) and readings (also long and boring). Lab is fun and lab practicals are open note. Overall a pretty interesting class if you are interested in this kind of stuff.

Really nice guy. Pay attention in lecture and write good notes because exams will ask about the smallest detail he mentioned once. He does take attendance, in both lab and lecture and grades you on it. Be sure to check out his youtube videos of his tin flute performances.
I absolutely loved this class and Dr. Lumney. He cracks not so funny jokes but he's too adorable not to laugh at him. Probably my favorite teacher I have had while at Ohio State.

Very helpful, wants you to do well. He is very good at explaining things in lab. You get to dissect so cool stuff. Let's you use your lab journal for the practicals so you can write everything you will need. In-class tests are somewhat challenging but you can use a cheat sheet. Takes attendance for lab & lecture but we usually got out early.

Very nice guy. Explains things clearly once you are actually dissecting. Tests only things you have seen or things you have read from lab book. Practicals are hard, but a dichotomous key was allowed on the second, which made it a breeze. Not a lot of effort required, and I would def recommend him for this class!

Great teacher, very helpful. He is very knowledgeable on the subject and is willing to give any help you need. The exams make up 75% of your grade. They are not necessarily hard, but require a fair amount of studying.
Kevin is a nice guy and is willing to help during class. However, his tests are pretty hard. For the first practical, the average was in the 60s, but he still refused to curve or normalize it at all.
great

This is not that difficult of a class. Seriously, I went to only half of the classes (attendance is not required) and I achieved a B. The class has is digitally recorded and is uploaded to iTunes. Don't get me wrong this class is hands on and a couple of open labs will help on exams. 2 Exams and 1 quiz total 240 pts and is your grade. No curve!

interesting. didactic portion really clear, but kevin has a hard time teaching the dissections. his instructions were pretty confusing that even the ta was clueless. his expectations are pretty clear. not enough time in class if you want an A so come in during open lab hours. i should've done that.
I loved Kevin! He was really clear and helpful, but the class requires a lot of studying. It should be worth more than 2 credit hours!
Very good teacher.  He should be teaching the lectures because he is quite knowledgeable and effective.  The department should make it a 3 credit hour class though.
I agree! I had him and he very nice and helpfull. However, the course is way way way to diffucult for a 2 credit hour.
Tried to make this class as interesting as possible. Willing to help students out. Takes attendance in class. Very straight forward. He is a nice guy.

This class was so intense for just 2 credit hours.  I found myself studying more for it than my other three 5 hour credit courses!  However it's not Kevin's fault, he's a great instructor.  He's very clear and extremely knowledgeable.  I would take a class from him again if I could.
This class was waaaay to intense for a class that meets once a week for ten weeks. The amount of material for this 2 credit hour class was insane, as was what we were expected to know.

My experience was pleasant. This course set up like a university writing class. The entire semester is writing assignments about drugs. The final project is a 5-8 double-spaced argumentative paper. Grading isn't strict. Write an even half-way competent homework that covers the rubric and turn it in on time and you will get a 100% on the assignment.
Very nice and friendly however she was a very tough grader on everything. We rarely ever did recitation and instead she would lecture about the lab for nearly an hour each time.

Dr. Hood is a nice person, but okay professor. There were tons of technical issues and syllabus changes throughout the whole semester. Also, he claimed to be open to receiving challenges for exam regrades, but failed to actually accept them. Also, his exam format is very strange and he himself even seems to be confused about the material on it!

Dr. Hood has a wonderful personality and he keeps his lectures engaging. This class was out of 1000 points and his midterm and final exam were very straight forward. He is very easy to get in contact with if you need him outside of class. He cares about his students and the content of this course. I would 100% take another class with Dr. Hood.
Lectures are long but not heavy. Things are explained pretty well.
Dr. Hood is a genuinely nice guy. He is pretty straight forward on what he expects from you which is nice. Overall, I enjoyed the class.

I really hope this was his first time teaching this class, because it really seemed like he didn't know what he was doing. Unorganized and unnecessarily hard and a large amount of work for 2 credits. The homeworks are super long and take forever. There is one partner presentation which isn't so bad, but attendance is mandatory for each presentation

I don't know why this guy even bothers recording lectures and posting them or holding class if hes just going to either use other peoples powerpoints or copy and paste google searches right onto a presentation. So dry and extremely uninformative. His exams are so unfair compared to his awful lectures.

If you don't review the slides and participate in discussions, the material won't make sense. The quizzes through the semester weren't very difficult and related to the material discussed for that week, however they don't prepare you much for the final. The recitation with this class was the worst I've ever had and had unrealistic expectations.

In his video lectures, he talked too much about his research. His slides had good information however. His questions on exams were horrible and he wanted very odd details in his answers. He was also an anti-religious elitist. He also claimed to be a much better person to the students when he substituted my recitation section.

Dr. Carstens is a nice guy and throughly explains his teachings but over all this class was awful. lecture slides and carmen content always had technical issues, labs were unorganized and pointless, and plenty of busy work on top of their text heavy lecture videos. Exams were near impossible that were too specific and had lots of grammar mistakes.

Dr. Carstens is a nice guy but I did not like him as a professor. His slides are text heavy and hard to decipher. He flies by his slides during lectures so you can hardly make sense of the material. The exams test only memory of very minute details from various case studies from his messy slides. Luckily, he only teaches this class for a semester

I really enjoyed his class, I found the lectures interesting and the midterms were fair. The lab practicals were difficult due to the sheer amount of information, but I found flashcards helped with that.

It's really interesting and he clearly cares about teaching. In class there are just activities based on the online lectures he posts to youtube. The labs aren't hard, but the lab practicals are somewhat difficult just because of all the animals you have to memorize. This class should be 3 credit hours instead of 2, there is so much information.

For 3310H.  It was hands down my favorite class at OSU. Concepts were taught through pertinent, recent research papers and were discussed daily.  The class hard but was manageable if you actually put an effort into reading papers.  Carstens was eager to help and made the class awesome.  I left the class with a new lens to learn through.

Pretty clear in lectures, taught well & covered material at the right pace. However, his tests were impossible, the first midterm was so poorly formatted it was a disaster, bad enough he offered a retake (there's no curve).

One of the worst lecturers I've had throughout my four years at OSU. Teaches purely at a graduate student level, which is rough for undergrads, especially those with a major outside the college that are required to take the course. He also does not know how to write exams. Questions don't test knowledge, they test memorization of details.

Dr. Johnson was very passionate about what he was teaching. He did not expect you to become an expert in the field and just wants his students to take home information they did not know before. There are in class quizzes occasionally but if you attend lecture you will do well on those and the final.

Dr. Johnson is very passionate about what he teaches and doesn't expect you to be an expert when you finish the course. As long as you pay somewhat attention in lectures you will do fine on the in class assignments. The textbook for the course is written by him and kind of expensive but it is very informative and covers the lectures in extra detail

Dr. Johnson! I love this guy. He is such a sweetheart. I can confirm all the better reviews this man got and deserved on this site. He wrote his own book for the class, and while expensive, it is full of information that he covers in class. Really wants people to learn and is extremely passionate about the poor babies affected by malaria. Love him

Dr. Johnson was a caring professor. But, 1) The course structure is confusing. 2) Lectures are boring, and go into too much detail. I think the course needs to be modified to not be specific. Dr. Johnson/Dr. Chordas only focused on microbio of disease/insects, and I wish the class went into topics that majors other than pre-med can have interest in

Norman teaches alongside Roman Lanno and they are both great professors. Very positive and calm atmosphere in the classroom. Willing to answer questions but also pushes you to think. Super refreshing to have a class like this especially since we are still in a pandemic.

The worst professor I have ever had. In addition to the test, students were assigned to write two essay questions. The instructions were not clear, and the rubric was vague. All students got a low grade. They refused to curve and regrade. The class was waste of money and time. The grading system was unfair.
Amazing and passionate professor he taught the Malaria module, and the end of his last lecture he donated $250 to Against Malaria Foundation on behalf of the class. Class act

Prof Fisk is one of the most passionate and interesting professors I have ever taken a course from at OSU. He TRULY cares about the things that he is teaching and just wants to share his passion with you. At times the lectures are a little boring, as they are in all classes but his love for the course is what makes it enjoyable. I enjoyed the class

Amazing professor!! He's the most passionate and caring professor I've ever had! He really cares about his students and his lectures are very interesting and make you look at biology from a whole new perspective! He is endlessly knowledgeable and is very reasonable with assignments and exams!! Outstanding!!!

Liked his module more--very kind guy. Gives final essay questions ahead of time; for the short answer part you just have to pay attention in lecture. Wants people to do well. Engages students in discussion more than Module I.

Lectures are boring but points are easy to get. Clearly lays out what you need to do for his half of the class. Gives the exam essays ahead of time, short answer is easy if you were in class with a pulse.
Very interesting class. Dr. Johnson is a great guy and an interactive lecturer.
Awesome guy, and clear cut lecturer.

Dr. Johnson was awesome for the Malaria module in Bio 3401. His test was clear cut and to the point. If you go to lecture, do the reading, and review his powerpoints... you should be able to get an A. Plus, he's a nice guy and more than willing to meet outside of class for any questions.
Dr. Johnson taught our first Module on malaria. He was an excellent lecturer and an overall awesome guy!
Great guy, good lecturer

I think that the way Dr. Hamilton has set up this course needs to be changed. The grading system is extremely confusing and is nothing like how a typical class would get graded. Also, his quizzes and exams feature too many "one or more of the following may be true" options and extremely wordy questions.

Dr. Hamilton is very passionate about what he teaches. The way he teaches the material is sometimes vague and unclear, and this can bleed into his tests as well. However he's very open to feedback and is very willing to help his students. Overall great guy. While the lecture material may have been a lot, the course was interesting enough to suffice

Dr. Hamilton is definitely passionate and well-versed in the subject matter. The lectures could sometimes get quite boring, but he is excellent at answering questions if you are ever lost. Wouldn't call this class an easy A, a lot of people seemed to struggle with his exams & quizzes and there is a semester-long project to watch out for.

Dr. Hamilton was clearly passionate about the field. His exams were fair. Paying attention in class was important as much of the material was examples. His lectures and material are clear to understand.

Dr. Hamilton was extremely knowledgeable, but the course got boring at times if you are not overly interested in the material. Attending lecture is a must due to the detailed examples and attendance points. Exams and quizzes were fair, but definitely stay on top of the semester-long observation project! I wouldnt call this class an easy A.

Dr. Hamilton was very kind and really seemed interested in his subject and our learning. I enjoyed the lectures, but I know a few students who have taken other EEOB courses (evolution, ecology) that were bored by them. Exams were not too difficult, as long as you gave at least a glance at the notes, but watch out for the semester-long project.

Hamilton taught the 1st half of the course. His exam was very fair (cheat sheet provided). Not much need for book for his exam. He even posted many practice problems beforehand. Show up to recitation and you will be fine. Lectures posted on Carmen. He is not the least bit entertaining though.

His midterm was very tough got a 65% on it but with all the other homework (easy) and recitation and clicker points still ending with a solid grade. He was a great professor though, very knowledgeable.

Nice Guy. I don't know why so many people are complaining about him. Yes his exams are challenging even with a cheat sheet but he's making sure you understand concepts thoroughly and can apply them. Also, USE YOUR TA's. If you put in the effort, you'll be fine.
The most boring professor I've ever had.. Homework is useless. The class was way harder than it should have beem

Dr. Hamilton is a very knowledgeable professor. He should NOT be teaching at the undergraduate level. He has a very hard time explaining concepts to an undergraduate audience. His tests are very difficult and purposefully worded to trip-up students. He's persnickety to the nth degree.  AVOID HIM if you can.

Dr. Hamilton is a solid professor that gets a bad rap. He is a genius and sometimes has a hard time figuring out how to get his thoughts out in an under stable manner for the class. He is a very nice guy that tries hard to make changes based on student's opinions.
He was honestly one of the worst professors I've ever had, and I'm usually easy on reviewing professors. He was terribly boring and lectures were useless, but required because of clicker questions.

I learned alot in this class... Lectures were long but he made good use of clickers to break it up and make you apply what you were learning. Clickers also counted as attendance. I found this class very interesting though i am a zoology major... Tests were difficult and had 3 hw assignments and 2 papers

Honestly why is everyone hating on this guy?  I have found this class to be pretty easy and I am by no means a good student.  Fair grading, and use of clicker questions requires to go to class but all of the questions for the midterm come from lecture.  Tons of easy points such as clicker points, recitation etc.  Can be boring but overall good.

Honestly, the class could have been a lot easier than he made it. The midterm was unnecessarily diffucult, not because of the content, but because of the ways he worded the question. He's not as enthusiastic as he could be, which could make the class more interesting. I really hope he looks on this website so he can change his teaching style!
AVOID HIM at all costs. He speaks so slowly it is impossible to stay awake.  This class is a TON of work. He constantly contradicts himself and instructions are very unclear. Grading is harsh.

Very very boring professor. He speaks in monotone and you will fall asleep at some point during the course. He has pop quizzes once a week in lecture making it mandatory to go. He does give a break at the half way point, but most people end up leaving. You don't need to buy the text book at all. Do not take this class with him.
Very well organized, but the exams were the hardest I've ever taken for a biological science course. I felt like I was simply memorizing information rather than gaining anything useful.

The class isn't hard, but he insists on mandatory attendance for everything.  You miss one recitation, you lose points.  He has quizzes on unannounced days (though you know there is one every week) so you can't just skip class.  Tons of people leave as soon as they take the quiz.  You will definitely hate this class.

Hamilton is the worst prof. I have had at OSU. He is boring and monotonous and he never shows any emotion. His posts very basic notes online, and then shows them while he talks in lecture. There are "pop" quizzes in lecture, so that you have to go, and there are to many homework assignments. Take the class with Meg Daly if you can, avoid Hamilton.

It was a pretty easy class, BUT... Hamilton is THE most BORING lecturer on the face of the earth.  Caution: You WILL fall asleep. You WILL leave class early when possible and you WILL hate this class if you take Hamilton.  If anyone else is available, take them. He has pop quizzes in lecture, which sucks because it makes yohave to attend sometimes.

This class is poorly designed but easily passed. The lecture videos must be watched before class, but none of the videos were recorded by the professors. Extra credit was offered for lecture participation but imo it wasn't worth it. The weekly exams are open note but covered material that we didn't go over. The lab section is entirely useless.

disorganized lecture 
never reply email 
lecture = read ppt
ask question = I'm not sure
last EEOB grade depends on SELF STUDY & TA
Absolutely ridiculous... be prepared to teach yourself

Dr. Sabree was a very nice person who cared a lot about us as students but not the greatest professor. Content was communicated through long, disorganized lecture videos from other professors; weekly online exams often had material not covered in lecture videos. Definitely shows passion for the course material, but does so in a disorganized course.

Professor Sabree's lectures were just a summary of lecture videos we were required to watch before class. He didn't put effort into teaching the class material & instead chose to use recorded lectures of other professors instead. They were long and too many. It was ridiculous how much he expected us to do outside of lecture.

NEVER ANSWERS EMAILS! No one in class seem to be able to get hold of him! if you have questions after assigned lecture time it will never be answered! Structure of the course is so confusing. you have to watch videos by other professors that are boring, and the actual tests has nothing to do with lectures you watch! Material itself is not hard.

The class was setup in a weird way where the actual lecturers only give the lecture once a week you need to watch several videos from other professors every week. I just didn't like this setup at all and it did not interest me since a lot of the videos were boring. The professor himself was completely fine. Some of the exams had strange questions.

The class itself wasn't bad but the lecturing was mediocre. Lecture notes aren't made to be studied & things were often disorganized. I feel like your experience is entirely dependent on having a good TA (Which I luckily did!). That being said, the content is easy to grasp and it's very possible to get an A! TA's will be your lifeline!

Dr. Sabree is hilarious. The lectures were very entertaining. My only problem was with the structure of the course which caused a lot of unnecessary confusion and stress. Very TA dependent, so having a good TA is super important. Weekly exams were a little unpredictable, but overall pretty easy and 2 got dropped. Pretty easy course.

Honestly the class was just absolutely stupid. I learned nothing new from Bio1114 and the innovation project in the class was the first time they have done it. They had high expectation for the first time doing it and it stressed a lot of people out. Not very organized or good at communicating. Not a bad dude, just a bad prof. Would not take again.

The tests are very difficult. All lectures are online but through some Carmen based site so they rarely worked for me. Recitation helps a lot and he often gave graded in class assignments which could be done at home most of the time. Its better not to skip, but most can be done if you do.

This class is not bad at all. It is disorganized, but once you get used to the flow its easy. I stopped going to class until there started in class assignments (with easy extra credit!) which wasn't bad and a grade booster. i did not watch a single lecture video, and studied minimally and got a B+. Exam averages are 75%-80% and you get to drop one!

Zakee is not a bad guy but he is an absolute mess of a professor. The format of the lectures changed with each midterm, and he refused to take student feedback on the format of the class. Would not take again.

The class itself (Evolution) is HORRIBLE. Do not take this class. Dr. Sabree is one of like 6 professors so it doesn't matter how good he is individually. He is an easy grader for module responses. However, tests are unnecessarily specific and lectures take FOREVER because this is a flipped classroom. I would not recommend this class to anyone.

Dr. Sabree is a very charming professor. His jokes are probably the best out of the other professors I've had. His lectures are great, and he explains things very thoroughly. His exams are a little on the unpredictable side, and some questions can be confusing, but they're very doable. He's the most millennial middle-aged man I've ever met

Dr sabree is a cool guy. He has lots of extra credits in his class, but his teaching method is not great. Reads off from slides. If you miss class it doesn't really affect you much but has 14 pop quizzes which are online so if you miss you can do it at home but it has to be done during class tIme. EXAMS ARE HARD. Be ready to learn by or avoid him.

BUGS AND MICROORGANISMS GALORE. Dr. Sabree is (a cool dude in a loose mood) very intelligent but his teaching style is lacking. He'll teach his own material and expects you to read from the book separately. Exams are very difficult and don't always make sense and there are 14 "pop quizzes." You definitely need to do a lot of studying on your own.

Dr. Sabree is a super cool dude. He is very open about what is going to be on the exams and he even lets the students submit questions that he will then put a percentage of those questions on the exam. He doesn't try to trick you, and is straight forward in his teaching. His classes are very interesting and I would definitely take him again.

Worst class taken at OSU.  Pop quizzes randomly throughout semester, and they are really tough.  You will have no idea what will be on exams.  Exam questions are so unclear it is unreal.  Recitations are an enormous waste of time, but they are mandatory.  Avoid this professor AT ALL COSTS.

He goes up to 2 chapters/week. You have to know *everything* in the chapter readings (basically the entire book),  material from lecture (a lot of it is independent from book material), and material in recitation (scientific papers you need to study). He doesn't explain what you should be studying. Smart but not good at teaching, unfortunately.

Sabree is one cool professor. He is truly interested in the students success, took me to grab coffee to discuss the class lecturesmy future professional plans. The lectures are straight forward, just ask if you're confused about something.

Teaches the second half of the class, exam 3 and the final (not cumulative).  We could drop 1 of the 4 exams, I dropped the final even with failing exam 1.  So many points, just do the work and you'll be fine.  He takes his notes right from the book, and it explains it a lot more clearly.  His exam 3 was straightforward, a few tricks but not bad

Don't be fooled by his outgoing personality and comedic skill. Dr. Sabree gave very little direction on what to expect for his final. He told us 65% of the questions would be from the text and only 35% from the lecture. Good luck trying to figure out what to memorize. His questions came from a test bank. His slides were also not very clear.
Great professor, he was funny, and really knowledgeable on the subject. Had a great fashion sense.

Professor good is like 70 or so years old but he still is active. I had his intro to biology over the summer and for my first ever college class (as a sophomore in high school) it was not hard at all. Very fun to learn and he was very passionate, not too much studying and he hands out bolded notes what you need to know. Good prof talk to him

Amazing Professor and gives you tons of practice and guides before exams. Lots of content so the exams are kind of hard but as long as you study days before, you should be fine! Also willing to help outside of class times and responds to emails fairly quickly.
This professor taught the lectures well. The exams are average but as long as you study you should be fine.

PPX are extremely long, he does not elaborate on them at all. Reads directly from PPX, blanks in PPX to ensure attendance. He does not care that the average grade for exams are failing, he says we should study harder. Gives a research project, but we cannot conduct any research, just read articles. If it's not to his liking, it isn't good enough.

Dr. Beres truly cares about his students and is willing to help if you ask him. If you work hard and get good grades on in-class assignments and labs. Then they will balance out failing the tests, which most people do. It is not impossible to pass, but extra time and effort is required.

This professor does not keep his word when talking about what is on an exam, it is very specific as to what he wants and nothing else. In lab with him he is very nit picky when grading and will comment about a lot of things that you did wrong. Questions on the exams are not in his lecture or labs and he just randomly expects us to know it. AVOID

Grades way too harshly as the class average on midterms is a failing grade. The class is blamed for poor study habits when more than half of the class fails a test, rather than considering his own participation in the matter. Tests are worded poorly causing confusion. Students study more and do worse on exams. 0/10, would not willingly have again.

His lectures are designed and performed well but everything else about this class is horrendous. Average class grade is a C I believe and he doesn't care how you do on exams even though it is obvious multiple kids are struggling. Avoid

Terrible professor. Kids who study 20+ hours for exams still fail and instead of taking responsibility and realizing he makes the exams too difficult, he blames his students for not having proper study habits. Yes, college is designed to be difficult but not to the extent where the average on exams is ALWAYS an F.

Among the worst professors I have ever had. Does not prepare students for exams. Expects students to remember information from 6+ weeks of lecture with very little review and blames his students for not preparing enough. Avoid if possible.

He is by far the worst teacher Ive ever had in my whole life. Im a freshman and I have never experienced such a worse professor. The first 2 exams the class average was a 55% and 51%. He is the worst grader in the world, for labs he will take points off for anything and everything. I once put a arrow on a graph and received a -1.5 PLEASE AVOID

This professor is by far my least favorite. He grades extremely tough and will not be very helpful when reviewing for exams what so ever. This professor will make the exam over material not covered in lecture and make it extremely hard to pass every exam he gives. Lab groups are also random and permanent. AVOID!

The toughest grader as far as BIO1114 TAs go. The assignments are difficult as they are but he takes points off for the smallest things. Compared to other BIO1114 TAs he is a much hard grader which I find unfair. Try to avoid or switch sections.

The most I can say is that he is good at teaching concepts that have been covered in class. Other than that, avoid him. He will say that your work looks fine just to take off points when he goes on to grading the papers. He is super nitpicky about what you wrote down as well. Any small deviations result in points lost. AVOID.

Very genuine dude, clearly loves the material but doesn't explain concepts well. Talks as if everyone else is an expert and not learning the material, unclear explanations. Lots of outside videos to watch that aren't even his lectures. Class time was supplemental and final focused on the novel required for class and outside videos. Exam was easy.

I had Professor Seeger for the first half of Bio 3401 and I struggled. He obviously cares about the material and the material isn't hard but he lectures in a way that doesn't highlight key concepts, the quizzes are indecipherable, and he is obsessed with fruit flies. It isn't as hard as chem but it is so boring. The other professor is great tho!

He put zero effort to make the material more comprehensive or interestin. Also when approached with questions he would always say things that never really answered the question. DROP THE CLASS IT ISNT WORTH IT.

I had Dr. Seeger for the second half of the semester. While definitely an adjustment from the easy first half of the semester with a different professor, I don't necessarily think all the negative reviews of Dr. Seeger are fair. His exams are based on lectures and assignments, so they are definitely manageable if you pay attention! Content is easy.

I had Dr. Seeger for the second half of the semester. It was definitely a huge adjustment to make as his content was more intense and you had to really know the concept in order to get a good grade. His quizzes and exams were very detailed with very little multiple choice questions. Pay attention to recitation activities and go to office hours!

Take him at your own risk. This class had 2 modules meaning it was broken into 2 different sections and he taught the 2 part of the module. His way if teaching is old school and his exams are really difficult for no reason. It is open book but trust me it is EXTREMELY HARD. Buuuut if you're up for the challenge then take him lol. Thats all I'll say

Never rated a professor before but DO NOT take his class!! His exams and quiz questions are very difficult to do because his style of questions are very extremely difficult to understand. He said in his own email that " I think it is a fair yet rigorous exam appropriate for the online/open book". Do not fall for this Open notes scam-ONLINE

Dr Seeger is the harder of the 2 professors. Although his module may be tougher, it is not too difficult. I think that people get used to the first module and when they switch to this one, it seems leagues harder but it is not. If you pay attention and take some time to understand, then it's like other Bio classes. Only annoying thing was iBiology.

I honestly could not tell you anything that I've learned during his module. Our semester was switched online because of COVID and he gave us so much work to complete. It was impossible to keep us. His lecture style is very boring and impossible to listen to. The only perk was that he gave us over 24 hours to complete our final and it was open book.

Although he can seem to talk about drosophila forever it is a great genetics class. He is super accommodating and enthusiastic, he brings humor to the class which is especially appreciated due to the statistics base. If you do the assigned homework you will not have a problem passing the class. He is truly a great professor.
I suppose a good teacher, but his tests were pretty difficult.

So ungodly boring. Dr. Seeger is nice and clearly brilliant, yet he constantly makes basic math mistakes and all of his equations are wrong in his notes. Exams are reasonable and assignments are long, but straightforward. Be sure to read outside of class though!
Incredibly nice and helpful prof. Just make sure to work your butt off and study well in advance for exams, not just several days prior. Exam averages were consistently in the ~60s.

Seeger team taught the class. Lots of small details to remember, and he teaches like a stereotypical research prof. Cares about his students but presentation of material was rough to say the least. Class exam averages were low (50s-70s) and only going to class is not enough to learn material. Does post slides beforehand.

He has no textbook, useful syllabus or general direction for the class.  His lecture slides are just pictures and give no useful information- meaning you have to write down every word he says in lecture to learn anything.  However, this is impossible because he's so boring.  I've learned nothing in 7 weeks.

I'm generally opened minded when it comes to  classes, but this professor is the worst I ever had. Monotone voice that bores the hell out of you. Late postings of tests and homework (didn't post the grades for the midterms till week9) If I ever have another class with this prof. I would drop that class right away.

I have no doubt this guy knows what he's talking about. He kinda looks like professor flitwick. But he is the classic research teacher. He's only teaching so he can get his funding and lectures are often just him reading off slides which are just research papers.
Class did tend to get boring at times, but he's a nice guy and by no means a bad prof.

super easy class. i had him for the latter half of the quarter. he's really boring but he likes to sneak x-files into his slides which i found really charming. he's more than happy to explain stuff after class. if you're not satisfied, talk to a TA or watch the cd in your textbook.

Seeger is a nice person.  He is willing to meet with you if you need help.  However, I won't gurantee it will do any good.  Lectures are long and BORING.  Tests are hard and ask for detailed answers.  They are entirely problem based and we didn't do any problems in class.  Assigned a bunch of work in the last week of the quarter.

He has horrible communication skills and is all together an awful teacher I came in loving Genetics and left hating it. He can't explain anything and has incredibly boring lectures. The course is unorganized and piles up exponentially at the end. Hard tests with no practice other than the book to help. In his class, you learn entirely from the book

He was obviously interested in teaching the subject to his students. His close interaction in labs was very welcome. My only complaint is that lectures got a bit boring, but that could have had more to do with the classroom or the subject matter.  If you have to take this class, I would definitely recommend this teacher.
He assigned too much work the last week or so of class, but it could have been worse. Nice guy.

His lectures get a bit long, and his midterms are very hard with detailed questions, but he does have great hair.  He did, however assign two lab reports, and 4 chapters of work during the last week of class.

Professor Lanno has long lectures, and the beginning of the course was difficult. The labs are almost all dissection, so if you have a weak stomach, I do not recommend this course. There was a lot of group projects at the end of the semester that can make or break your grade, choose your lab partners wisely.

Dr. Lanno was passionate about what he was teaching, but the course structure could use a little work. The lecture material was a lot to learn at once. Some of the exams (practicals) were a month apart, some were barely over a week apart, which sometimes left us not much time to study. The class just felt a little all over the place.

Dr. Lanno makes this class harder than it should be. He gave us 50-page slides a few days before our final without a lecture and half of the final was over that. He could've planned ahead but did not, causing students to cram and fall behind on learning content. His explanations drag on and are confusing, even when a student has a simple question.

Dr. Lanno was an awesome professor. The structure of the class was difficult at the beginning with few assignments and long lectures, but Dr. Lanno is very open to feedback and changed his class delivery to accommodate us. Study for the tests because they make up most of your grade. Labs depend on the TA, but the endophytes project was interesting.

Dr. Lanno is an amazing professor who will do his best to prepare you (though a bit fast ) That said the lab and the semester project are hard and the course content is over whelming. I love bio and I found myself hating this class. If you like bio and want to preserve your sanity dont take this class at 8am! The course is fast and content heavy!

Pretty good professor, kept lectures fairly interesting at 8 am. Good at explaining concepts, and breaks up the lectures with readings and discussion. Study for the second exam early, lots of memorizing. Endophyte project is tough, but doable. Not the best with technology, but tries his best.

Super nice guy and very good teacher! I was always interested in his lectures & they were 80 minutes at 8a.m! He breaks up the class time with discussion and 2-6 page readings that tie the material into current issues. The endophyte project is a lot of work but it's split up over the semester. As others said, start studying for the 2nd test early!
Dr. Lanno was a good professor, but he wasn't the best at emailing back. He was easy to understand, and although some test questions were poorly written, it was fairly easy to do well.

Wasn't a fan of his module-- because I didn't find toxicology interesting + he used unfamiliar words and it was really hard to pay attention in lecture. He focuses on the oil spill a lot- pretty boring. His exam is fairly easy if you study what he tells you is important (red + blue stuff on slides -- beware he changed this on the slides midway).

He's an okay professor overall. His part of the class consists of listening to lectures and answering graded LGS questions. The lectures were straightforward, and he will highlight important parts before the exam. In my opinion, recitation was a waste of time.
Get points for going to lecture. Exam is poorly written but is manageable to do well on. Lots of points come from showing up to lecture. Lecture is interesting but sometimes gets pretty boring.
Show up for in class assignments. He usually walks you through them for easy points

Dr. Lanno is a nice guy but I wasn't particularly found of his module. I thought that the oil spillHiroshima& Nagasaki stuff was interesting but the rest was really dry because it was mostly bio stats. I felt that hardly any bluered info was on the exam even though he said it would be. The exam wasn't terrible if you study just really random
Very thorough and makes summary slides so you know what to study. Really good at explaining applicable uses for information in field. Overall, I recommend this professor
Dr. Lanno was seriously awesome. He legitimately cares about students. He offered plenty of extra credit opportunities. He is an excellent lecturer.

The class seemed easy... until the second exam killed everyone. The first exam was really easy, but he threw us a curveball and made the second exam extremely difficult. Also, like others have said the grading on the small assignments is very  nitpicky which hurts grades in the long run. That being said, Lanno is an overall great professor.

Dr Lanno is a good professor, the material isnt too hard but the way the class is set up makes it nearly impossible to get an A . Get used to a lot of 3 out of 5s on small assignments which add up to kill grades

The lecturer is extremely good and understandable. However the TA Jessie Wallace is so critical, I think it's absurd that the majority of the class is getting close to no points on drafts of papers which is bringing down grades tremendously.

Lecturer is fine, and worth taking.  Watch out for TA Jessie Wallace - grading is extremely inconsistent and you will get nickel and dimed on everything.  Getting absurdly low grades on DRAFTs of your paper sections based on trivial things is absolutely ridiculous.  This ruins ths class.

Really liked him even though i absolutely despise science.  Really wanted students to do well.  We were in 4-person lab groups and I was pulling all the weight in my group so he noticed that and pulled me aside and asked me if i'd like to be put into another group. i said yes and he changed everyones group around...i really appreciated this!!

Like everyone said, you can go once a week and go to lab and get a good grade. However, make sure to study for the quizzes, bc a lot of the questions come from newspaper articles and you will not otherwise no the answer no matter how well-read you are in biology.

Easiest class I have taken at OSU. There are no midterms and no final. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. I don't even know what the cover looks like. I went to class once a week and when I did go I either slept or studied my notes. I got an A. He puts all the notes on Carmen so as long as you at least glance at them you will do well on the quizzes.

Good teacher...makes a boring subject pretty interesting.  Class is easy IF IF IF you study the notes before hand.  You will for sure fail every quiz if you don't study for them.  All the questions come right from the lectures notes(online) and the readings(online).  Don't waste your money buying anything for this class.

He is nice professor, interested in getting you in and out of biology with a decent grade. But your TA may be a different story. No final, weekly quizzes (find someone who has recently taken the class, they can help you alot), and the labs are easy but you have to go to them. Also REMEMBER to do the weekly blogs, an easy  5 points.
fairly easy class. dr lanno is a nice guy no exams it is all based on weekly quizes and labs. go to lab and make sure you keep up with your deadlines and you will be fine.

This class was really easy. There were 8 quizes(one each week) instead of a midterm and final. You do not ahve to go to lecture (except on quiz dates) because the notes were on carmen. I would reccommend this class to anyone!
Don't buy the textbook, it's never used at all!!  The class is very easy, just review the notes given on the website before quizzes.  Lanno is a nice guy too who explains everything clearly.

VERY EASY CLASS!!!! I only went to lecture when there was a quiz and passed all of them.  I ended up with a B in the class and thats with no effort.  The no midterm/final is AWESOME.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. Total waist of money and they do not buy them back. Overall very eas class, High School Biology was harder.

I loved his lectures they were very interesting. Pay no attention to the other dorks on here. The only reason they think it was a joke, is because he does make great notes to where you dont have to use the book,and then he post everything.If he didnt the slackers in the class would prob flunk! I learned a lot in his class,and thats most important.
Don't bother buying the book, you will never need it. Just download the notes off the web. SUPER easy, the labs are identicle to ones I did in 7th grade.

sooo easy. stupid lectures, but easy to skip and do well in. he reminds me of tobias from arrested development. my TA doesnt speak english very well, but its still really easy..like first grade stuff.

He's super boring, but he tries to be funny and make class interesting.  Maybe it's not so bad if you don't take it in the morning...  The quizzes are super easy and right off the notes which you can get online, so you don't really have to go to lecture except to take the quizzes.  Make-ups are SUPER hard so don't miss.

he was pretty easy, just be careful on the quizzes, theres only like 10 questions on each so you miss 2 and your down to an 80%.  labs are easy just make sure you go.  i didnt even really try hard and i got a B+.
Easiest class ever at OSU.  Easiest professor ever, never have to go to lecture except for quizes, no midterm or final, and all notes are online.  Highly recommended
Very easy class, I highly recommend it!

This class is such a joke! I never went to lecture except for quiz days because everything was online. Common sense is all you to get an A! Plus the labs are ridiculously easy and you always get out early. I recommend Joe Beuchel for your TA- EASY grader! =)
Excellent lecturer! Highly recommended!

If you can stomach Lanno bashing the Bush Administration and pushing his environmental agenda on you, then go ahead and take this class. The good thing is that there are no midterms/final, and I studied for the quizzes in lecture and got an A on every one.  Labs are a joke.  If you passed 5th grade then you should be able to get an A in this class.

Easiest class in the world. Lecture notes are posted ahead of time, so you don't even need to bother going to lecture. Quizzes are a piece of cake. No midterm, no final, how much better can it get? However, don't get Mike Nelson as your TA. He grades the labs ridiculously hard considering that this is a class for ppl w/ no bio experience.

Yeah, this class is pretty easy, and the professor is pretty cool, just make sure you do NOT get Mike Nelson as your T.A. He grades the labs extremely hard (they've had to raise all his classes' grades to meet the average of everyone else in bio) and alomost always uses up the entire 3 hours (most T.A.s don't)
extremely easy
GREAT class set-up -- weekly quizzes instead of finals and midterms.  Also, he wears really tight pants.  It's great.

This class has been the easiest of my college career, I slept through all of the lectures and still came out with an A. Just agree with his propaganda and use common sense and you'll been fine. Doesn't do much to prepare you for 102 but nothing can prepare you for the NYT disaster.

Piece of cake class. If you don't mind agreeing with his environmentalist propaganda on every quiz, this is the prof for you. If you want a bio class that will prepare you for the second half of your biological science sequence..... Lanno and the New York Times will not help much. Clarity and easiness don't always equal preparation.

Easiest professor yet.  He's funny and keeps the class simple.  No midterm or final, quizzes are a breeze if you study your notes-- questions mostly over definitions.  If you can find someone who kept their old quizzes, they're 95% identical each quarter.

If you're gonna take bio 101 get this guy.  Class is easy (no final or midterm).  Just short weekly quizzes that you can study for while he lectures.  Don't bother buying the book if you're going to take his class as I didn't open it once and as a result lost $60.  I got an A with no effort.

The class was easy..quizzes were short, sweet and to the point--sometimes a little tricky though....all notes are on webct ahead of each class, no midterm or final :)  really easy to understand prof.  made the concepts VERY simple!

Definately worth taking. You hardly even need to read the book to do well. Im sure if I spent more than 30 minutes a week studying i would have an A. Think im at an A- or B+ with close to 0 effort. Lectures are interesting, but dont fall asleep or he'll come after you asking questions. NO EXAMS!
Not as boring as some proffesors, but he presents the material pretty well
the course material isn't very exciting, but i wouldn't say professor lanno is boring. he's a great lecturer and very clear.

This is probably the easiest class I've ever taken.  No final or midterm, just multiple-choice quizzes every week.  Notes are online, so you don't even have to write anything down or buy the book.  INCREDIBLY boring, but hey, it requires no effort whatsoever.

I am ashamed that I have to pay money to take this class but I'm taking it because it is a requirement...  If you've taken high school biology - this class will merely be an inconvienience.  Good thing it's really easy because the class is really boring.

Talk about easy! Just like everyone else says, no midterms or finals which are a huge +. Quizzes are over notes, NYT, & any movies shown so make sure you go to those lectures when a movie is suppost to be shown. Lecture is kinda boring unless your into this kind of stuff and notes are online.

This guy is very understanding about situatuions that prevent you from making it to class. But his lecture is hella boring, but i mean it's basic biology it would be very hard to make it interesting. Pretty cool guy overall.

Lecture was pretty boring, but he keeps you updated with New York time articles. He's very knowledgeable, nice, and he wants to teach. There is no final or midterm, just quizzes every Friday--which are directly from the notes. Only lab sucks!!!
Lanno wasn't an exciting professor but he always referred to current events to keep things interesting.  No midterm or final was awesome,  Made things less stressful!

Lectures weren't the most exciting things ever, but definitely go. Notes are online but he blacks some slides out so in order to get all the info you have to be there. The no midterm or final rule was incredible. I'd recommend him.

For a professor, he was not bad. The problem comes with the TA's. If you get a crappy one, even if you go to class and take notes, if your TA is bad, you will still get a B+, which is what I received.
Very good bio professor, puts all notes on the internet and makes quizzes (NO FINALS OR MIDTERMS) very fair. Best bio 101 teacher
Prof. Lanno is a very even-handed and fair to students.
We didn't have any midterms or finals only quizzes and labs! How nice is that? He wasn't the most exciting lecturer but it was fairly easy stuff. Definately recommend him if you have to take bio 101.
No Comments
No Comments

Other than the class content being completely mindless, and hating every single passing second I was present in this class. She was a great professor, she came in with a positive attitude everyday, the class was an easy A. If you can handle attendance, which is only 2 days a week ( I hate going to class lol) then TAKE HER.
Rocky start trying to learn her expectations, but she mostly makes her grading seem worse than it actually is. A wonderful professor by the end of the term, very comfortable joking with her students.

Dr. Z is awesome and hilarious!!! She truly cares about her students and wants them to do well. If she notices the class is getting something, shell stop, take input, and fix her lectures to make sure everyone understands. Totally recommend
I LOVE DR Z. SHE IS FANTASTIC AT EXPLAINING, COMES IN EVERYDAY WITH A POSITIVE ATTITUDE, AND REALLY CARES ABOUT HER STUDENTS.

Dr. Z is great, I took her for an Introduction to Undergraduate Research class, and if you do your work and actually try, then this class will be easy. She has helped me enormously in getting involved in research at Ohio State, and will help anyone who gives effort!
Robert is the best TA EVER. He will help you prepare for exams, shows he cares about you, and prioritizes your understanding of the contest and your overall well being. 10/10 highly recommend !!

Robert was the best TA I have had at Ohio State so far. He was always prepared for class and did good recitations. He was helpful while also allowing students to think for themselves. He connected well with us and I would recommend him as a TA to anyone!

Robert was very helpful in bio 1113 lab. Whenever the class, or just I, was confused, he had no problem taking the time to give a thorough explanation and resolve any misunderstandings. I enjoyed having Robert as my TA this semester, he is one of the best TAs I've had so far.
TA Rita is so helpful!! She really cares about her students and made practice exams to help us even when she didn't need to. I would choose her as my TA for every class if it was possible.

Rita is the BEST! She is the most fun and caring TA I have ever had. If you don't get Rita as your BIO 1101 TA you are missing out on the best experience of your life. She is so smart and pretty. Couldn't recommend her enough.
I enjoyed Professor Tucker, he's funny and has the lecture slides downloadable so it's much easier to follow along. As long as you actually pay attention and take notes the class should be fine.

Dr. Singh is a better lecturer than Dr. Booton for 4606, but his tests are harder because he grades the open response questions harshly. His section of the class is a lot more memorization and less application. He also uses TopHat so you should probably show up to class to get the points. He started posting lecture recordings online too.

He teaches the second half of Molgen 4606 and I loved his explanations. He makes the difficult material much easier. I did another class that has the same material as his and I used his explanations because the other professor made it so hard to understand a thing.

He said okay almost once a minute. This made the lecture extremely boring and the material hard to understand. He is also very unclear on what to study and how much of the specifics a student will need for the exam and problem sets.

POLITSCI 4191 - Internship for credit. Great guy, very understanding of your time and if you can't do certain things. Always willing to talk and super easy to reach! The course itself is super easy and has like 4 assignments that can easily be completed.

Troy is such an awesome teacher! He was my TA for Bio 1113 and was absolutely incredible! He made the classroom a welcoming environment and made each student feel comfortable. He always went the extra mile to make the labs fun while also ensuring we were learning. I always looked forward to my labs because of him!
Easy-going nature makes class fun. Spends as much time as you need to help explain things so you understand. Goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable and want to learn about biology.

Dr. Wolfe was in her retirement during this semester, so she canceled a lot of assignments. The final paper was a lot of work, it needed to be 10-15 pages and was only allowed to have academic papers as sources. Dr. Wolfe was almost always a couple minutes late and attendance is a big part of the grade. Most days were just lectures.

Dr. Wolfe is an average professor. I had her online due to COVID and most of the time I didnt pay attention and I finished the class with an A-. We had a really big project worth a large portion of the grade. The most difficult part was a paper where it had to be 10 pages MINIMUM. In addition you had to do a presentation and a blog post.

Literally on of the worst professors I've had at OSU. She makes the work very tedious and you are expected to write A TON. She is also a very picky grader, and she isn't approachable. If I could give her a 0/5 i would have. I don't recommend having her as a professor, she is the worst.

She takes over EEOB3310.05 halfway through the semester. I have no complaints about her, she's friendly and the material is easy. I was surprised to see so many of my peers complain about her, when all that's necessary to get an A is to put in the effort to do the work.

The midterms were 30 percent of the grade, participation was the equivalent of a midterm. An easy class to get a good grade in. Dr. Wolfe is a really interesting lady and willing to help outside of class. Lectures can get a bit dull at times though.

You have to go to class, there are clicker questions almost every day and they make up a good part of your grade. The class itself isn't that hard, but you've got to go to class and go to recitation, there are worksheets every week.
Kinda boring, but the material is fairly interesting. Just be sure to keep up with the readings and go to class.
Nothing good to say...

I liked her class much better than the other raters. Her personality was not likeable. She specifically told us to not go to her office hours. In spite of this, her pop quizzes were EASY, as were the rest of her tests and labs. If you don't mind an unapproachable professor in exchange for a good grade, take her class. Book is useless, don't buy it.

aweful. kept bringing up her kids during lecture. she was extremely patronizing  referring to herself as "Mom." final exam required analysis of a research paper & raw data (unparsed) & not enough time to complete. she gets offended if evolution isn't your world. please avoid this class!

Her lectures are clear, but she makes the material needlessly complicated. Pop quizzes in lecture make attendance de facto mandatory. Tests were very difficult and too involved for the time period (must read article and interpret). She's very picky with exams and homework. My biggest gripe is that she's arrogant and unapproachable. Avoid textbook.

I took her PLTL. Everyone was illegally coerced into signing an NDA burried in the sylabus.  Aparently Faust gets off on coercion in general.  She has posts on social media and there are comments here in this vien as well. The PLTL is science by conscensus as no answers are ever given to the prompts. We were given topics far past our abilities.

Sara modified my class schedule without my permission and delayed my financial aid/refund by WEEKS, which almost got me evicted. When I tried to talk to her about this she showed no remorse. Her actions made my mental health spiral that semester, got me extremely behind in work, and no one involved in the situation even cared. Thanks, Sara!

PLTL is a waste of time. Avoid it if you can. It is just a bunch of busy work and completely unnecessary to learn biology. I guess if you don't know how to study you might find it useful. If you know how to study and have important things to get done, it is a monumental waste of time.

The absolute best person to learn bio 1113 from in PLTL. She makes the best workshops and knows all her stuff and is too intelligent for us. Just too intelligent. In a good way though it's cool. Take PLTL just for her workshop packets you'll love it.

Really enthusiastic about teaching and eager to help. Will schedule extra office hours if you need them & checks e-mail a lot. Grades really hard, but is clear about expectations and spends extra time making sure you're prepared for assignments and exams. Actually cares about teaching unlike most TAs I've had.
Very helpful. She really explained all the information from lecture in detail and was eager to help any student. Best TA I've had at Ohio State.
Absolute worst teacher I have ever had. Super belittling and expects you to know everything and if you ask her to repeat it she says you should've studies harder. She shouldn't even be. a teacher.

I love OBrien. All of the work besides the big Health Plan assignment was super easy. And the health plan (3-part project with 2 essays) wasnt bad either. Shes incredibly knowledgeable and kind. Shes an easy grader too.

O'Brien is a great professor. We have pre-work assignments and reflections every week that usually take 15-25 mins to do but are super easy. The tests are online and its easy to score well. My class was late on Mon and Wed which was sometimes hard but she had zoom optional classes and you could watch the movies on your own if you can't go to class!

O'Brien is a great professor. Her lectures and course material are straight forward. She gives a few article reflections and PackBack assignments that have all been extremely helpful and informative to the course. The tests reflect all information presented in lecture and lab. Attend lectures and labs and the class will be simple.

Dr. Jackson was a great professor! I really liked her and she seemed to care about the students understanding the material. I would definitely go to lecture as the slides do not contain all the material. Exams were fair but she gives out so much extra credit so it's easy to make up lost points. Office hours were helpful too.

She made me question my whole minor. Tells the class not to know things but puts them on the exams anyways. Too much work for a 3 credit class. Went to her for help one day snd she yelled at me to stop asking questions about stuff that is not going to be on the exam. She is nice outside of class and her office but not good at lecturing.

THE WORST. Likes to make life hard by forcing attendance (sparse slides, codes, refusing worksheets). Clearly doesn't understand COVID & goes out of her way to force you into a room w/ 100 people. Insanely boring, condescending & rude. Makes the exams entirely from tiny details she mentions once that aren't even on the slides. Take someone else!!!

Gives absolutely way too much work for a 3-credit hour class. Don't expect an easy elective. Made everything way more difficult than it needed to be. Test questions were based on one-line details in the textbook. Half of the class had lecture material before lab exams, but the other half did not, making it so incredibly difficult to do well.

Dr. Jackson made an interesting-sounding class one of the worst classes I've ever taken. The class is memorizing neural pathways of animals, but they are not relatable to the human brain (taking Anatomy won't help). The exams are stupidly detailed. Her communication sucks. She talks SO slow, too. Don't take! I don't know anyone who liked the class.

It shouldn't be possible to take 80 minutes to cover 10 slides, yet Dr. Jackson found a way to make it happen. The exams are straightforward and nothing in this class is too difficult, her lectures are really just so incredibly boring and impossible to pay attention to. I recommend recording the lecture and listening at 2x speed.

She is the first professor that I have had that really cares and wants you to learn. She loves helping shes chill and whatever works for you she wants you to do that. come to call or not when its lecture up to you. lessons are easy. The lab is tough a bit but she lets you know. Best take her!!!!!

I really enjoyed EEOB 4550 with Dr. Jackson. It was a true pleasure to learn from her. She had very high expectations from students and their dedication to the course content. If you study hard and frequent her office hours throughout the semester (not just before exams) to clear up any confusing concepts, you will do well.

Leslie's content was dry and boring, which was disappointing since a class about animal behavior could be very interesting. I do think I have learned a thing or two about neuroscience overall, however. Her exams were mostly very difficult short answer questions. It didn't feel worth the overall amount of work because it was so boring.

Prof. Jackson is very nice and wants to get to know everybody in her class. The exams are not difficult, but she does grade hard so you need to make sure that what you're writing is 100% correct or else you will get points off. The group project was easy and she grades that relatively easily. If you put in effort, the class will be very easy.

The tests are about half multiple choice/matching and half short answer/extended response. Start studying early because the answers are quite detailed. Its all very fair, one big group presentation but if you follow the rubric you will do very well.

She is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. Tried to know all her students, which was impressive considering the class had 200+ people. Also would make an appearance in the weekly labs and help/talk to the students. Exams were very fair. However, it is extremely important to go to class, as much material is presented verbally in lecture.

Dr. Jackson was very fair and consistent in her teaching style. I really appreciated the fact that she learned everyone's name and made an effort to come to the labs. Book is not necessary. I would recommend recording her lectures, relistening to them as you answer the objectives to study for the exams. Exams are fair but must know specific details
Nice and caring teacher. Exams are beyond fair! There was one group project that was not hard and it was enjoyable. Take this class!

She was one of my favorite professors. She actually takes the time to make an appearance in most of the labs and also tries to know everyones name. By far they most dedicated and caring professor Ive had at OSU.

Really patient and kind professor, probably one of the best I'll ever have here! She puts in effort to know every student by name and person in her classes, and takes time to explain and elaborate on confusing concepts. Textbook isn't necessary and tests are based on her lectures. Not everything is on the slide handouts though, so come to lectures!

Dr. Jackson is an awesome professor! She really knows what she's talking about and is always willing to help students and even tries to get to know everyone personally. She has review sessions in preparation for lab exams.  You definitely need to put time into studying for exams but her assignments are very fair. I would definitely recommend her.

As long as you go to lecture and pay attention and take notes, tests are fairly easy and straight forward. There are weekly reading quizzes and occassional in-class activities so you can't skip class, but otherwise, an easy A. She drops one quiz and one activity.

Dr. Jackson is a good professor. She seems to really care about what she is teaching. Definitely record her lectures, she only uses power points for visuals such as pictures and animations. Exams are no multiple choice, but not difficult if you take good notes and study. And the labs are pretty easy .

Dr. Jackson is a great teacher! She always explains things well and is really interested in the subject material, as well as taking the time to know her students! You definitely need to go to class, as the power point slides don't have all the information you need to know.
Lecture can be dry, but material needed for the exams isn't always on the slides. The class topics are interesting, but can be delivered in a non-interesting way. She takes forever to grade. 6/10

Exams are heavily based on lecture, and she says alot of things that aren't on her slides that you have to catch. Would honestly recommend recording her lectures. Exams are NO multiple choice, take them seriously. Most questions come directly off study guides but those always have a ton of material. Lab is pretty easy and not at all time consuming.

No textbook was assigned. Class attendance was essential. Email responses takes her an extremely long time or no response at all. Grading is a big issue. She takes off points for everything. It takes her a long time to even return grades-1 paper took her 2 months to return(not a joke).Would not recommend this course to anyone under her instruction.

Unfair grading on her exams. Doesn't see if you really know the stuff but looks for really picky details, be warned. Takes back what she has to say a lot in lecture... Very unclear in her message. Just go to her help sessions before exams if she has them (randomly she does). That helped me the most.

Everything is in the Lab Manual, which she wrote. Save $$ & don't buy textbook. Lectures Follow powerpoint. Answers questions, works hard to get to know her students. Straight forward & covers material fast. Gentle grader. I bombed a lab midterm (bad day) & still got a B in the class (did OK on everything else)

Clear lectures. Exams and quizzes very straightforward. Just regurgitate lecture notes. A few exam questions are a bit unorthodox. She's very approachable and willing to help. She's also very enthusiastic. I would definitely recommend. Lecture de facto mandatory because of unannounced class participation.

I actually enjoyed EEOB 415-- which I was not expecting.  Dr. Jackon's tests are extremely fair and I appreciate how she related the material to current science/biology (i.e. cancer, stem cellresearch etc.) I def. recommend her for cell bio (as for EEOB 410.. eh) Just study the notes, and you'll be fine.

I dont really know how she taught. I was busy copying down her Library of Congress size notes during class.  Exams were quite tough but were not impossible. Reviewing notes and reading the book are your best bets. Nice lady but below average professor, doesnt know how to teach. I would not take any of her classes again.

Horrible teacher. She always went back and changed what she said and never sounded like she knew what she was talking about. We were instructed to get a new edition of the text book which was very expensive and was a total waste. She never referred to the new edition and all her notes had figures from the old text. Not a good teacher!!!

Dr. Jackson is a nice professor.  She posts an outline online so you can take notes during class.  DO NOT buy the book.  I never even looked at it and ended up with an A in the class.  Just go to lecture, take notes and know the gist.  She doesn't ask specifics on tests and exams were way easier than I expected, especially or a 400 level class!

Leslie is super sweet. She is more than willing to help you out, but you have to ask her. Go to class, take good notes, and study her notes for her exams, you don't need to buy/read/reference the book at all. Pay attention in lecture, sometimes she'll accidently say something backwards and you need to point it or be confused.

She is a very very easy teacher. This class is hard to get anything below a B. The notes are very easy and detailed,she outlines them for you, you fill in the rest in lecture. She makes this material very easy to follow and learn. Recitations help alot with things you get confused about. Overall she a great teacher to take this class with.
Good person, horrible professor

She must have changed this class.  She didn't have reveiw sessions when I took it, the notes were terrible, and we never knew what the quizzes were going to be over.  A quiz every week and a final exam that is comprehensive.  That was the most material I had ever had to study.  A ridiculous course not taught well at all.  Barely got a B.

there is no reason for anyone not to get a good grade, at least when I took it. A reveiw session every week where the TA would almost give you the answers and two reviews before the final and she would stress what you needed to know. I studied the night before each quiz and exam and got an easy A.

I thought this class was very interesting.  I thought she was a great professor! She was always willing to help you out.
